docs.title: Birdsite
docs.text:
This is a semi-navigable archive of the random twitterings of one @kfitz between 2008 and 2022.

One key note: timestamps claim to be clickable but are not; the account to which they linked is now deleted. As are many of the accounts with which these posts were in dialogue. Such is the way of things.

docs.title: 2008 04 01 tweets
docs.text:
Just joining up with this Twitter thing, fer reals.

Sat Apr 05 06:19:56 +0000 2008

Is it true that any press is good press? Or do reductive, misleading reviews just suck?

Sat Apr 05 13:41:14 +0000 2008

Everywhere I go, there's a parade.

Waiting for my flight; $71 to fly standby on the earlier flight lost out to $20 to drink in the airport bar.

Sat Apr 05 22:11:45 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

@BryanAlexander: thanks for dragging me in. Happy flying!

This is it. I'm stopping now. Really, I'm not kidding.

Curses. Foiled again.

docs.title: 2008 09 01 tweets
docs.text:
Replying to @kfitz

Replying to @kfitz

Replying to @kfitz

@chutry: thanks -- it's hard being this far away and feeling the world so silent about it all.

Fri Sep 05 06:52:58 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

Fri Sep 05 14:10:15 +0000 2008

The announcement: as of 1 July 09, Pomona Media Studies will be converted from an interdisciplinary program into a full-fledged department.

Fri Sep 05 14:14:59 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

@calamityjake: I'm pretty amazed. I'd love to trace the network by which the word spread. \(Appropriate for such an announcement\!\)

Fri Sep 05 14:19:19 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

@2xlp: it's a pretty unmitigated good - this gets us dedicated faculty, dedicated space, and a proper budget. There's very little downside.

Fri Sep 05 15:31:09 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

@wmrandth: Thanks -- we're ecstatic. This enables us to better support the students we've got, as well as the ones we hope to bring in.

Fri Sep 05 15:32:50 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

@2xlp: but the disciplinary aspects allow us to branch out internally, to be unmired and coherent. You should check out the current major.

Fri Sep 05 15:44:38 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

docs.title: 2008 10 01 tweets
docs.text:
Good grief; it's been a week since I've even been able to come up with 140 characters about anything.

Sat Oct 04 00:07:46 +0000 2008

What little of today actually belongs to me will hereby be spent lying around reading a novel.

Sat Oct 04 16:52:18 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

@chutry: Hey, totally looking forward to seeing you there!

Mon Oct 06 01:28:45 +0000 2008

Traveled today for the first time since getting home from Paris. TSA has new uniforms. Continental has new planes. Service remains the same.

Thu Oct 09 01:03:11 +0000 2008

It does not surprise me that the AT&T Conference Center has very nice phones. It does surprise me that they're made by Cisco.

Thu Oct 09 01:17:10 +0000 2008

Grading.

Sat Oct 11 14:46:46 +0000 2008

Just wrapped up Flow with very genial pub after-party. Now packing for heinously early flight back to SoCal. \(Then maybe one more beer\.\)

Sun Oct 12 02:47:55 +0000 2008

Digging my way out of an avalanche of paperwork. Surely there should be a Saint Bernard with a little keg of brandy somewhere nearby?

Wed Oct 15 17:15:39 +0000 2008

On the plane \(headed out to give a talk at MITH\).

Mon Oct 20 18:14:26 +0000 2008

At the hotel. The kitchen closed 30 minutes before I got in, but the bartender took pity on me and let me take a beer back to my room.

Tue Oct 21 04:03:41 +0000 2008

Going to give this going to sleep thing a shot. It's 10 pm in SoCal, so I'm hopeful that it will work...

Tue Oct 21 05:05:44 +0000 2008

Talk at MITH completely rocked, if I do say so myself. Now sitting in the lounge at IAH, about to go catch the next flight home.

Wed Oct 22 01:29:01 +0000 2008

Replying to @kfitz

Just out of curiosity: how do you negotiate the politics of unfollowing? Do you ruthlessly drop the overtweeters, or do you suffer through?

Replying to @kfitz

@noradio: Heh. I like the image of everybody scrambling to see if I'm still there. \(Honestly, though, this is nonspecific; just curiosity\.\)

Replying to @kfitz

@amandafrench: That's my sense as well. But I'm curious whether there's been much in the way of study \(as on unfriending\).

Replying to @kfitz

@calamityjake: Hey, thanks! I didn't realize the review was up. It's a great book -- my favorite of Lessig's, I think...

Fri Apr 24 17:04:54 +0000 2009

q to Anne Wolpert: given malleability, is archive of digital archives still an archive? #MiT6

Fri Apr 24 17:06:17 +0000 2009

Fri Apr 24 17:09:02 +0000 2009

Wolpert: persistence in digital world does not happen by luck; happens by intentional investment #MiT6

docs.text:

Wed Aug 26 22:25:45 +0000 2009

Wed Aug 26 22:39:58 +0000 2009

Replying to @briancroxall

Thu Aug 27 00:48:22 +0000 2009

Whenever I need roof access \(e\.g\. for a/c service\), I have to give $50 dep to HOA for a key. Currently have a key, and am tempted to copy.

Thu Aug 27 20:42:38 +0000 2009

@mariabustillos Hey- finished Dorkismo on trip to Norway & LOVED it. Posted rev on Amazon. Can't wait to find out what the next book holds.

Fri Aug 28 16:54:20 +0000 2009

Fri Aug 28 18:49:37 +0000 2009

Fri Aug 28 18:53:59 +0000 2009

Fri Aug 28 20:38:54 +0000 2009

Fri Aug 28 20:53:52 +0000 2009

Wait, what? That's... unexpected.

Two essays from the same issue of VLT \(58\.1\), in fact: @jmittell's and @mznewman's, both of which are perfect for the class.

Okay, all backed up; have checked for app compatibility & updated a couple. Am about to begin upgrade process. Wish me luck.

Fri Aug 28 22:31:19 +0000 2009

Okay, first load & restart seems good; msg says 33 mins to go.

Fan running like crazy, but otherwise seems okay. 14 mins to go.

Post-installation restart. Fingers crossed.

docs.title: 2009 09 01 tweets
docs.text:
Replying to @midwinter_

I got mine a couple of weeks ago; took it to Norway with me. Super convenient!

Tue Sep 01 05:25:42 +0000 2009

Replying to @midwinter_

I'd pre-ordered from Amazon - I can't imagine it wouldn't be shipping from Kensington!

Tue Sep 01 15:02:18 +0000 2009

The air here is filled with fine ash - 30 miles from the fires.

Tue Sep 01 15:07:21 +0000 2009

Just asked by dean's office whether a post on a serious academic blog should be included among faculty publications. I'm so proud. #headway

Tue Sep 01 20:52:04 +0000 2009

Replying to @TimMcDonaldPhD

By my estimation \(a rough one fer sure\), one primarily focused on the field or other professional concerns of the author\(s\).

Tue Sep 01 21:06:35 +0000 2009

@alechosterman My dean doesn't; I was presented with a specific case that happened to be a serious academic blog.

Tue Sep 01 22:30:11 +0000 2009

Replying to @academicdave

Sure, though the question here was about a cv-level inclusion of a specific blog post as comparable to an article.

Tue Sep 01 22:30:48 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

I hope you & all the other east coasters will forgive me if I say I don't want to hear about it? [1/2]

Wed Sep 02 02:11:30 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

Forecast has been only 3 more days over 100 for 8 days now. Was 109 on Saturday; a mere 100 today. With a light rain of ash.

Wed Sep 02 02:14:10 +0000 2009

Wow, that sounded pissy. Wasn't going for pissy, but for "la la la, I can't hear you!" \(I blame the heat & smoke for my irritableness\.\)

Wed Sep 02 02:19:10 +0000 2009

Replying to @d_kompare

Don't worry about me - we're 20 miles from the nearest fire - but the smoke has permeated the area & apparently made me whiny. :)

Wed Sep 02 03:49:49 +0000 2009

Replying to @chutry

Hey, you write about movies, they sell machines on which you can watch movies. What's not to love?

Thu Sep 03 01:47:54 +0000 2009

Looked up thinking, how long until noon meeting? Answer: 24 minutes. And I was still at home in pajamas. Showered & out the door in 13 mins.

Thu Sep 03 19:11:57 +0000 2009

Which is to say, I rock.

Thu Sep 03 19:12:37 +0000 2009

Replying to @veek

Hey, cool! I'd absolutely dig it...

I stayed there last time it was in Philly, and it was great. The only downside was having to carry a coat around.

Sun Sep 06 20:08:03 +0000 2009

New blog post: Ick http://bit.ly/JHQ5O

Mon Sep 07 15:21:32 +0000 2009

After a sleepless night spent coughing in LA, I coughed my way across the country and now hope to stop coughing long enough to sleep in NYC.

Thu Sep 10 03:46:36 +0000 2009

Which reminds me: dear fellow passengers on CO50 today: I swear it's a bronchial infection, not H1N1. You can all relax.

Thu Sep 10 03:47:38 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

Better than I expected, thanks! Spent the morning in a series of mtgs at NYU & was sorry not to have time to pop in & say hi.

Thu Sep 10 18:03:36 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

Hey, cool! How late do you think you'll be there? I've got a 6pm dinner, but if we're done early enough I'd love to swing by.

Thu Sep 10 19:38:58 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

don't know if you're still at the bar - just wrapping up dinner in union sq, so would be abt 30 mins...

Fri Sep 11 00:24:13 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

have a great one. since my last post I figured out I'm getting sicker, so I'm going to go crash. will try to catch you tmw.

Fri Sep 11 00:37:50 +0000 2009

Ugh. Sick. And feeling pretty whiny about it, actually.

Fri Sep 11 01:58:15 +0000 2009

Replying to @koralesky

Thank you! I could certainly use it.

Fri Sep 11 11:31:32 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

Hope you guys had a great time last night. I collapsed & am feeling even rougher this am. Here's hoping for recovery today...

Fri Sep 11 11:33:24 +0000 2009

Day 1 of MLA Program Comm meeting was fabulous \(if with much coughing from me\). Aside from wifi, anything you'd like to see at future conv?

Fri Sep 11 11:55:30 +0000 2009

Replying to @academicdave

You'll be happy to know that formal panels at night are ending! \(And everybody expects the interview aspect is on the decline\)

Fri Sep 11 12:10:53 +0000 2009

Replying to @academicdave

Video is a great idea, but I can imagine that with that many panels, it would be $$$. Maybe we shd start grassroots flip mvmt.

Fri Sep 11 12:13:00 +0000 2009

Replying to @amndw2

Great idea! I hope there'll be more of that forthcoming.

Fri Sep 11 13:17:53 +0000 2009

Shameless self-promotion: I'm in Humanities Magazine this month, being questioned impertinently: http://bit.ly/fMXru

Fri Sep 11 13:29:13 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

Oh, no! I'm so sorry to hear you're sick, too. Probably just as well I didn't make it; we would have just wheezed together.

Fri Sep 11 13:30:29 +0000 2009

WTF, AT&T? I've got 5 bars on 3G and all my calls are failing!

Fri Sep 11 16:24:28 +0000 2009

Replying to @triproftri and @briancroxall

Lots of cool stuff coming - very exciting conversation today. Yay for a 21st century MLA!

Fri Sep 11 20:42:20 +0000 2009

Replying to @nickmirzoeff

Me too! Thanks for the visit, and I'll look forward to keeping you posted on our progress.

Sat Sep 12 02:34:54 +0000 2009

At the point of seriously hoping that my cough has turned into acute bronchitis and not pneumonia. :(

Sun Sep 13 01:02:28 +0000 2009

Replying to @alechosterman

Got appt w/doc for Tues afternoon, but only by freaking out on the phone. Thank goodness we don't have socialized medicine!

Sun Sep 13 01:10:29 +0000 2009

Also starting to wonder whether it's irresponsible of me to try to teach Monday. It's not H1N1, but should I still keep my germs to myself?

Sun Sep 13 01:12:00 +0000 2009

Replying to @amandafrench

I hope to spend tomorrow that way. And may whether I want to or not.

Sun Sep 13 01:40:12 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

energy level is near zero. I'm going to spend today pondering alternatives from a prone position.

Sun Sep 13 15:03:21 +0000 2009

Okay, still with the cough and the shortness of breath, and now low-grade fever and abdominal cramps? I guess it's time for urgent care.

Sun Sep 13 18:24:19 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

I've got a call in; waiting for a reply. Thank goodness we don't have to deal with all that rationing that you guys put up with. :P

Sun Sep 13 18:52:30 +0000 2009

On-call dr says go to urgent care/er. Now to figure out which one will actually take my insurance. *sigh*

Sun Sep 13 19:03:48 +0000 2009

I think it's me & one other dude in the urgent care. Slightly creepy it's so quiet. Through initial screening & waiting on the doc.

Sun Sep 13 19:39:47 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

I'll only tweet long enough so that someone knows I'm there.

Sun Sep 13 19:51:23 +0000 2009

And I'm out. Xray shows no pneumonia, but acute bronchitis. And PA thinks I may have H1N1 too. Nice. Scrip for zpak & codeine. Back to bed.

Sun Sep 13 20:11:05 +0000 2009

PS: I'll begin my official apologies to everyone I've come in contact with over the last three days shortly. Except whoever gave me this.

Sun Sep 13 20:12:25 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

No kidding. Though there's a small part of me that's thinking, well, at least I'll have it over with...

Sun Sep 13 21:07:39 +0000 2009

FWIW, if this is H1N1, it sucks. I never run a fever - my temp is usually low if anything - and I'm now over 100. I hate this.

Sun Sep 13 23:05:55 +0000 2009

And am sorry to be whining to you poor people, but... well, here I am, and there you are.

Sun Sep 13 23:06:58 +0000 2009

Replying to @nancybaym

Ugh, that's awful. Okay, I'm waving the white flag - serves as a convenient handkerchief besides! Here's hoping I'm up soon.

Sun Sep 13 23:27:30 +0000 2009

Replying to @brettbobley

Perversely, that is precisely what I'm hoping for at this stage. Wish me luck!

Mon Sep 14 00:13:27 +0000 2009

Replying to @christateston

Should know by Thurs at the latest, sooner if it's +. Have also been told I'll be contacted by "federal officials" if it's +.

Mon Sep 14 00:35:09 +0000 2009

Replying to @christateston

So unless they drag me off to the camps, I'll let you all know as soon as I do.

Mon Sep 14 00:35:37 +0000 2009

Replying to @christateston

Indeed! Net-based instruction, here I come.

Mon Sep 14 00:41:06 +0000 2009

Replying to @nickmirzoeff

Yes, the deadline's tomorrow. I think the app itself has gone in; your ltr can follow. No problem!

Mon Sep 14 15:56:53 +0000 2009

Sickbed update: sweated out the fever overnight; now back to my usual 98.2. Breathing better. Makes me think it's just bronchitis after all.

Mon Sep 14 16:24:17 +0000 2009

Go, zpack, go!

Mon Sep 14 16:24:34 +0000 2009

Replying to @mariabustillos

I'm hoping so, too - though I've got Skylight down for next Tuesday. Am I wrong?

Mon Sep 14 17:00:57 +0000 2009

Replying to @GeorgeOnline

Don't get me started on this. I have an essay coming out in a volume on teaching w/tech that introduces "weblogs" to lit profs

Mon Sep 14 19:36:55 +0000 2009

Replying to @GeorgeOnline

Wrote the essay, what, four years ago? Based on a class taught three years before that?

Mon Sep 14 19:37:27 +0000 2009

About to begin my first distance-ed experience - though not the way I might have expected it would happen.

Mon Sep 14 20:10:59 +0000 2009

Classes seem to have gone well. So grateful to my colleagues for all their help yesterday & today.

Mon Sep 14 23:42:19 +0000 2009

Gee, NBC4 is reporting that Jay Leno's first show was a "rousing success." I'm stunned. Thanks for the hard-hitting critical take.

Tue Sep 15 01:15:51 +0000 2009

Replying to @d_kompare

Ah, it's NBC4 LA, conveniently located in Burbank. In the same complex as... hey...

Tue Sep 15 01:53:13 +0000 2009

Replying to @inactinique

Wow - that *is* cool! #zotero

Tue Sep 15 07:19:32 +0000 2009

@zotero 2b7 Mac is gorgeous- but a sync error: Component returned failure code: 0x804b000a \(NS\_ERROR\_MALFORMED\_URI\) [nsIXMLHttpRequest.open]

Replying to @inactinique

Aha! Thank you!

Tue Sep 15 17:50:41 +0000 2009

Tue Sep 15 17:56:20 +0000 2009

Tue Sep 15 18:31:08 +0000 2009

Good grief, but I feel terrible. I keep feeling like I'm getting over this thing, but every time I think I'm out, it pulls me back in.

Wed Sep 16 01:25:41 +0000 2009

Replying to @mariabustillos

Thanks so much; I could use it!

Wed Sep 16 03:09:13 +0000 2009

Day 2 of teaching via Sakai's chatroom client. My students are together in our classroom, and so it's like peeking through a keyhole for me.

Wed Sep 16 20:24:38 +0000 2009

Which is to say, not entirely satisfying, and yet I'm grateful to get any glimpse of what's going on I can.

Wed Sep 16 20:25:05 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

Heh. The fever's gone, though the rest of the symptoms are lingering. I'm mostly at home out of a desire not to infect everyone...

Wed Sep 16 20:59:28 +0000 2009

Replying to @emilynussbaum

Super cool. I'll look forward to reading more.

Wed Sep 16 21:08:36 +0000 2009

Wow - awesome line from my class's online discussion: "the entire history of authorship is about fan fiction."

Wed Sep 16 22:48:06 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

It's an updating of the Roland Barthes line: Every text is a tissue of quotations. The specific ref: Chauc/Shakes Troilus&Cressida.

Wed Sep 16 22:53:44 +0000 2009

~@plragde But so many other possibilities. I love supplanting Bloom's anxiety of influence with fan fiction...

Wed Sep 16 22:55:09 +0000 2009

~@plragde I'm less sure there's that great a divide between borrowing/quotation and other forms of appropriation...

Wed Sep 16 23:03:46 +0000 2009

~@plragde A Thousand Acres/Clueless are exactly the kind of thing I'm trying to get at. There's a deep relationship btw Clueless & fanfic...

Wed Sep 16 23:05:07 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

But that's a pretty fine distinction. The point is that the "author" is no more original than the writer of fanfic... [1/2]

Wed Sep 16 23:30:18 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

All authorship is borrowing, in some form or another. [2/2]

Wed Sep 16 23:30:34 +0000 2009

Replying to @nancybaym

That's fantastic -- I hadn't heard that. Thanks for passing it on!

Wed Sep 16 23:35:26 +0000 2009

@kfitz Michael Chabon has said all his writing is fan fiction. Another reason to love him. \(via @nancybaym\)

Wed Sep 16 23:35:46 +0000 2009

Replying to @mikejolk

That's just plain awesome.

Thu Sep 17 01:05:02 +0000 2009

re fanfic: http://bit.ly/15O0Ad Next Tarantino Movie Homage To Beloved Tarantino Movies Of Director's Youth \(via @mikejolk\)

Thu Sep 17 01:06:04 +0000 2009

~@annehelen methodology = nil; have you read the description of my blog? These lists are just link farms trying to produce google juice...

Thu Sep 17 16:51:18 +0000 2009

Replying to @nickmirzoeff

Thank you so much! I'm increasingly excited about the possibilities...

Thu Sep 17 16:52:03 +0000 2009

H1N1 results are back - negative. So we're back to bronchitis, which is not getting better. I feel, in fact, like I cracked a rib coughing.

Sat Sep 19 18:46:06 +0000 2009

And not to whine, but: all this, and no freaking immunity to show for it?

Sat Sep 19 18:46:55 +0000 2009

Replying to @2xlp

Yup. Everything hurts, in one very specific spot.

Sat Sep 19 18:51:26 +0000 2009

Replying to @wpwend42

Glad it's working for you. I absolutely love it - the one service I cannot do without. #dropbox

Sat Sep 19 19:11:27 +0000 2009

The one on Hollywood Blvd? Sounds good!

Sat Sep 19 21:56:23 +0000 2009

Sheesh. Nothing to see here; moving on.

Sat Sep 19 21:58:24 +0000 2009

New blog post: The Flu and You http://bit.ly/ruP1L

Sat Sep 19 22:21:14 +0000 2009

Texas Tech needs a new chin strap contractor. I'm just saying.

Sun Sep 20 03:35:17 +0000 2009

@nowviskie I send recovery & immunity wishes your way, as one who hasn't recovered or cashed in on the immunity. :(

Sun Sep 20 18:40:03 +0000 2009

Replying to @nowviskie

No, no - what's the internet for, if not whining? Just sending you wishes for a speedy recovery, and wishing I'd gotten immunity!

Sun Sep 20 21:14:15 +0000 2009

Replying to @brettbobley

Mon Sep 21 14:15:19 +0000 2009

@CapitolClio Somebody did -- and it worked!

Mon Sep 21 14:51:56 +0000 2009

Home from a return trip to the urgent care. Bruised rib is excruciating. Got steroids plus more codeine to STOP THE COUGH. Wish me luck.

Tue Sep 22 03:59:58 +0000 2009

Replying to @nancybaym

They did an xray so at least I know it's not cracked, but I think the treatment is the same: wait six weeks. :(

Tue Sep 22 04:13:11 +0000 2009

Replying to @kwazana

Yup. It's been pretty awful. Hopefully on the mend, though!

Tue Sep 22 04:55:12 +0000 2009

Replying to @plragde

I think that's where it all started - irritation from the smoke led to bronchial infection, etc. etc.

Tue Sep 22 14:33:26 +0000 2009

Replying to @mariabustillos

Laudanum would be just the thing, as I'm feeling mightly consumptive...

Tue Sep 22 17:56:20 +0000 2009

In Los Feliz for dinner and the end of Infinite Summer at Skylight Books. #infsum

Wed Sep 23 00:54:15 +0000 2009

Replying to @mariabustillos

Wed Sep 23 01:06:21 +0000 2009

Replying to @mariabustillos

okay, inside. see you soon!

Wed Sep 23 01:12:54 +0000 2009

Replying to @mariabustillos

cool beans. I'm here.

Wed Sep 23 01:19:42 +0000 2009

Wed Sep 23 14:18:36 +0000 2009

hahahahahahahaha!

Also on writing in public: until we get over fears of talking w/the broader culture, we'll never convince them that what we do is important.

Ha!

Replying to @jsench

which made me think it was Alexandrian poets & their propensity for allusion. And perhaps less the New Testament? But I dunno. [2/2]

Replying to @plragde

It's one of 3 possibilities I can see: the library, the poets \(who loved allusion\), or the text-type of some New Testament mss.

Tue Feb 09 01:16:26 +0000 2010

Replying to @plragde

Perhaps. But is hermeticness really the thing we associate with the library of Alexandria, rather than its destruction?

R's gone, and I'm headed out in the morning. So it's me, leftovers, and whatever's piled up on the DVR tonight.

Looking forward to a last three hours and thirty-six minutes as department chair. Oh, did I say thirty-six? :)

docs.title: 2010 07 01 tweets
docs.text:
This has NOT been my day.

Thu Jul 01 05:07:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @zaynk

I'm sure I'll work it out. It's just way more tiresome than I needed!

Thu Jul 01 05:32:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @profhood

I really, really hate the "dark side" label. Somebody's got to be chair, and trust me when I say you want it to be someone good.

Thu Jul 01 05:37:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @profhood

Well, the good news is that I got to do that, too. No course reductions for chairing here.

Thu Jul 01 05:45:45 +0000 2010

@jcmeloni My goals for today: getting 17 days worth of stuff in one small suitcase; not missing flight; not having a total meltdown.

Thu Jul 01 13:45:24 +0000 2010

Replying to @GeorgeOnline

Early August to late June, both flexible.

Thu Jul 01 14:24:52 +0000 2010

July is not starting as I'd hoped. But then, June didn't end as I'd hoped, either.

Thu Jul 01 17:23:43 +0000 2010

@amandafrench Hey - happy birthday there! I hope it's a great one.

Thu Jul 01 17:48:20 +0000 2010

There are days when the best part of getting upgraded is the preflight drink. Hey, it's after noon.

Thu Jul 01 19:20:06 +0000 2010

Hey, a quick word of thanks to everyone helping out with the apt crisis. Suspect it will work out. \(Perhaps the preflight drink talking\.\)

Thu Jul 01 19:27:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @captain_primate

That one's been pushing my buttons for a while now. However, are we sure that responding is NOT a violation of FERPA? :)

Thu Jul 01 23:10:38 +0000 2010

Replying to @captain_primate

Appropriate? Probably not. But hilarious? Certainly.

Thu Jul 01 23:22:13 +0000 2010

Thanks, travel goddesses. I'll take that \(utterly unexpected & basically impossible upgrade\).

Thu Jul 01 23:34:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

Heh.

Thu Jul 01 23:38:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @ryancordell and @captain_primate

I think I got a discount on Coda bc I already had Transmit...

Thu Jul 01 23:52:34 +0000 2010

This is now officially hilarious: the travel goddesses give and the travel goddesses take away.

Fri Jul 02 00:01:49 +0000 2010

Not only bumped out of my upgrade by a computer snafu but bumped out of my good coach seat too.

Fri Jul 02 00:02:42 +0000 2010

But have a shiny $50 travel certificate waiting for me at LGA if I'm willing to stick around and ask for it at 11.30 pm.

Fri Jul 02 00:04:20 +0000 2010

How shocked am I to discover that the promised travel voucher was not in fact waiting at LGA? Shocked, I tell you!

Fri Jul 02 04:10:03 +0000 2010

Replying to @moncia

Thanks. See you... um, soon! \(Guess I should go to sleep\.\)

Fri Jul 02 05:49:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @mariabustillos

Some of it's actually kind of funny. Most of it's just whining. A couple of things really sorta suck. Ah, well.

Fri Jul 02 06:08:29 +0000 2010

Ending what has been a difficult day by changing my title on my various websites. Take that!

Fri Jul 02 06:11:26 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

Ooh, I like that.

Fri Jul 02 12:18:19 +0000 2010

RT @ericzinner: NYUPress in HuffPo: Independence Day: 15 Feisty Small Presses+Books You're Going To Want From Them http://huff.to/caWfia

Fri Jul 02 16:53:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

I'm so sorry, Mark.

Fri Jul 02 18:17:45 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

I'm a big fan of the JQuery rollover note script @clioweb wrote for me to use with Planned Obsolescence...

Fri Jul 02 18:19:31 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

Okay, so only 10 hours later, finally in front of a computer again. I'm happy to share if you'd like!

Sat Jul 03 04:51:43 +0000 2010

Hey, so, thanks all for your good apt-hunting vibes: problem solved. A most awesome place in the most awesome location. A bit $$, but YAY!!!

Sat Jul 03 22:05:11 +0000 2010

Replying to @therefore

I've thought exactly the same thing. Also, had the entire staff of a restaurant last night wanting to play with it.

Sat Jul 03 22:13:25 +0000 2010

Replying to @TheRepoRat

Alas, "a bit $$" is relative to the already insane $$ I was expecting \(i\.e\., this is more\).

Sat Jul 03 22:54:44 +0000 2010

My iMac at home is asleep. My Time Capsule is not. I can remote admin my wifi network via the TC, but I cannot persuade it to wake the iMac.

Sun Jul 04 17:44:58 +0000 2010

Massively unfocused today. Have spent hours goofing around with something that did not need goofing around with. Dragging my heels on work.

Sun Jul 04 19:09:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @plragde

Yeah, which I thought I had on. Apparently not.

Sun Jul 04 20:00:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Yay!

Sun Jul 04 22:19:34 +0000 2010

Had a fantastic dinner tonight with an amazing view of the East River. Of course the fireworks were on the Hudson. But no matter.

Mon Jul 05 05:22:17 +0000 2010

Heading to London this evening for #dh2010. Mildly concerned about the fact that after 4 days in NYC I'm still on California time.

Mon Jul 05 13:57:45 +0000 2010

There is a certain presentation that I should be busily preparing this morning. I'm hoping motivation will strike shortly.

Mon Jul 05 14:25:39 +0000 2010

Replying to @2xlp

Ambien gives me bad bounceback - if I take one tonight I won't sleep at all tomorrow. But I do have Restoril & am unafraid to use it.

Mon Jul 05 14:44:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @2xlp

Restoril's pretty old - temazepam is the generic. A distant relation of Valium, et al. Best used sporadically to avoid tolerance.

Mon Jul 05 15:12:12 +0000 2010

New blog post: On the Road \(Again\) \(and Again\) http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/on-the-road-again-and-again/

Mon Jul 05 16:31:51 +0000 2010

MTA to NJT to AirTrain to EWR to LHR. See you there.

Mon Jul 05 19:30:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @nycdlq

Dude, if I saw LBJ on the IRT, I'd be pretty darn sure I'd accidentally dropped LSD.

Mon Jul 05 20:28:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @ncecire

Life in SoCal has made me public transit compulsive; if I *can* use it, I *will* use it.

Mon Jul 05 20:29:32 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

Hey, excellent. The weather in NYC has been awful for the last two days, so I look forward to a little SoCal style sunny & 72.

Mon Jul 05 21:29:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

\(But with much better curry\.\)

Mon Jul 05 21:29:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @nycdlq

I did catch the reference, of course! But the image of you listening to it at 7 is pretty priceless.

Mon Jul 05 22:47:32 +0000 2010

Sitting in club lounge at Marriott Grosvenor Square, waiting for our room to be ready. 100% delirious. Happy to have a day before #DH2010.

Tue Jul 06 09:24:38 +0000 2010

Replying to @karikraus

Thanks! Looking forward to seeing you tomorrow, once I've recovered a bit more!

Tue Jul 06 17:56:55 +0000 2010

Replying to @kdettmar

Be careful what you ask for, my friend. 105 degrees is just around the corner.

Wed Jul 07 05:39:25 +0000 2010

Good morning, London. Coffee has been had. Online catching up has been accomplished. Now perhaps a bit more coffee and some actual work.

Wed Jul 07 06:54:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Hey, you too! I mean, have a great night. I think.

Wed Jul 07 07:02:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

Ooh. Sorry not to be there this morning. If you guys come up with the answer, would you fill me in later today? #thatcamp

Wed Jul 07 08:26:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

I'm not sure Wave did fail, but if it did the primary reason is mislabeling: it isn't a social app, but groupware. #thatcamp

Wed Jul 07 09:03:03 +0000 2010

Ugh, body. You're letting me down. One episode of jet-lag too many?

Wed Jul 07 15:03:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

So sorry not to have made it this afternoon; hoping to recover enough for tomorrow morning. #dh2010

Wed Jul 07 16:27:24 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

I am familiar with that word, but not in that context.

Wed Jul 07 16:44:43 +0000 2010

Replying to @sherah1918

There's one in my town I see at least twice a week; always makes me think "is this 1982 again?"

Wed Jul 07 20:44:57 +0000 2010

Asleep by 10pm; awake at 3am. Out of bed by 5am. Only coffee around: McDonald's. *sigh*

Thu Jul 08 04:54:40 +0000 2010

New blog post: Five Years Post-Tribble http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/five-years-post-tribble/

Thu Jul 08 06:55:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

Ooh, excellent! Very much looking forward to #sci8, in the meantime.

Thu Jul 08 08:10:05 +0000 2010

Have at last made it to #dh2010, just in time for the panel on building the humanities lab. Very, very happy to be here.

Thu Jul 08 08:10:47 +0000 2010

Starting out with notetaking etc on the laptop, but will wind up on the iPad before long; MBAir battery life isn't what it used to be.

Thu Jul 08 08:30:06 +0000 2010

@nowviskie on founding assumptions/environment of NINES: peer review as "core function"

Thu Jul 08 08:32:15 +0000 2010

@nowviskie on founding assumptions/environment of NINES: peer review as "core function" #dh2010 \(this time with hashtag\!\)

Thu Jul 08 08:32:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

Indeed! Am hoping to play the outlet-search game as little as possible. \(PS: Hi\!\)

Thu Jul 08 08:35:42 +0000 2010

Have hit the wall of jet lag. The big question: 40-minute walk or 9-minute tube ride back to my hotel?

Thu Jul 08 14:20:32 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

Thank you.

Thu Jul 08 14:21:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @janaremy

Ooh, conference nap room. I could certainly get behind that.

Thu Jul 08 14:27:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Yes, feel better! So sorry that you're sick...

Thu Jul 08 20:19:14 +0000 2010

SEVEN HOURS. I slept for seven hours in a row. For the first time in over a week. I feel like I could do ANYTHING.

Fri Jul 09 04:53:27 +0000 2010

Think I completely wore myself out with the 40min walk to & from #dh2010 yesterday. Going to do it again today, but carrying less stuff.

Fri Jul 09 06:46:25 +0000 2010

Also, dressed more weather-appropriately. Was utterly drenched by the time I got back to the hotel yesterday evening.

Fri Jul 09 06:47:01 +0000 2010

In the basement of the Strand Building for session on Teaching/Managing; Anouk Lang on the edu potential of social networking sites. #dh2010

Fri Jul 09 10:02:58 +0000 2010

Incidentally, the basement of the Strand Bldg is the site of the craziest conf I ever attended, involving embezzlement & academic fraud.

Fri Jul 09 10:04:56 +0000 2010

Very, very odd being back on the scene.

Fri Jul 09 10:05:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @janaremy

Appropriately, it was a Pynchon conference; completely surreal.

Fri Jul 09 10:21:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @tla and @mkirschenbaum

Except that the pious huffiness is focused on a second-hand mischaracterization of a speaker's point. #dh2010

Fri Jul 09 11:14:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @tla

I'm not saying the mischaracterization should stand! In fact, the responses to the initial tweet perpetuated the misreading.

Fri Jul 09 11:22:15 +0000 2010

Dying of the heat in K.240.#dh2010

Fri Jul 09 13:45:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @KathrynTomasek

Nope; upstairs where the ACH AGM was. At probably 65% capacity, but sweltering.

Fri Jul 09 13:49:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

I wouldn't either. It's pretty cushy compared with the heat in NYC before I left. Not to mention actually being at #dh2010.

Fri Jul 09 13:54:15 +0000 2010

Third presenter's a no-show. Sigh. At least I can escape the room. #dh2010

Fri Jul 09 13:58:11 +0000 2010

Replying to @jasonaboyd

If you see @karikraus's most recent tweets, you'll see that that was not at all her point. #dh2010

Fri Jul 09 14:57:02 +0000 2010

Oh, holy moly, am I ready to get back to writing already.

Sat Jul 10 09:27:27 +0000 2010

Very interesting analysis of backchannel use at DH conferences being presented by @clairey_ross. #dh2010

Sat Jul 10 10:11:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @dougreside

Completely agree: Buzz should have been brilliant. Other prob tho was redundancy btw Buzz/Gmail/Google Reader. #dh2010

Sat Jul 10 11:10:32 +0000 2010

Replying to @sgsinclair

Ooh, interesting q! My sense is that trad review inhibits innovation, promotes safety, but would be fun to explore. #dh2010

Sat Jul 10 11:15:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @jamescummings

Yes, absolutely. #dh2010

Sat Jul 10 11:18:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @dougreside

Sat Jul 10 11:19:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @ernestopriego

Thank you!

Sat Jul 10 11:19:28 +0000 2010

Replying to @sgsinclair

Yes! Interpretation of metrics is key; just b/c there might only be a few ppl in a subfield doesn't mean impact is low. #dh2010

Sat Jul 10 11:26:01 +0000 2010

Replying to @sgsinclair

Also, impact develops over time, which can be taken into consideration in an open process, but not in a closed one. #dh2010

Sat Jul 10 11:27:16 +0000 2010

Yes, I just poured 1/4 cup of sparkling water right on the keyboard of my MBAir. No, I did not do it on purpose. Happily, it wasn't juice.

Sat Jul 10 14:00:30 +0000 2010

Replying to @fraistat

See you again soon, I hope!

Ha. I don't leave until tomorrow morning. But I'm pretty sure folks will be happy for me to shut up already about the travel.

Fri Jul 16 22:09:36 +0000 2010

#sci8 was completely amazing, but I hit the wall during lunch afterward. Came back to the hotel & slept for three hours. Now, a dinner plan.

Fri Jul 16 22:16:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @mariabustillos

Did you ever read Brill's Content? Had an ongoing feature, the CharlieRose-o-meter, recording how many times he interrupted.

Fri Jul 16 23:58:49 +0000 2010

After 17 days, 4 stops, 2 conferences, and 1 adventure, my suitcase and I are headed home this morning. Here's hoping for a dull travel day.

Sat Jul 17 12:42:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @captain_primate

They can take my suitcase from me when they pry it from my cold, dead hand.

Sat Jul 17 13:01:43 +0000 2010

Replying to @captain_primate

In fact, I'm thinking of starting NCA, the Nat'l Carry-on Association. Protecting your right to bear suitcases since 2010.

Sat Jul 17 13:03:01 +0000 2010

Replying to @CapitolClio

You & me both. My suitcase's wandering days are over!

Sat Jul 17 13:05:41 +0000 2010

Okay, self: I said boring. \(I'm usually so good about departure time math that I didn't double\-check & am now cutting it \*rilly\* close\.\)

Sat Jul 17 13:34:55 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

Thank you! It was great getting to be here. I'll hope to talk more soon.

Sat Jul 17 13:41:17 +0000 2010

Okay, that went ridiculously well. Told cab would take 10 mins to arrive; took 5. Told ride would be 25 mins; was 18. \(1/2\)

Sat Jul 17 13:54:51 +0000 2010

No one in line at check-in; no prob at the counter. Line at security was me. & flight is 15 mins late, so I was still an hour ahead. \(2/2\)

Sat Jul 17 13:57:11 +0000 2010

It is only mildly ridiculous how much I'm looking forward to getting home and properly updating and synchronizing all the electronics.

Sat Jul 17 14:13:17 +0000 2010

Okay, here we go: CHO to IAD to IAH to ONT. To home. At last.

Sat Jul 17 14:33:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

You rock, in all ways. Here's to a fantastically productive weekend!

Sat Jul 17 15:07:16 +0000 2010

One of those moments I wish I were traveling with someone: I have a perfect seat at the gate- one of two near an outlet- but want caffeine.

Sat Jul 17 16:52:29 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

That's brilliant. It may come to that.

Sat Jul 17 16:55:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @patrickgmj

Completely agree!

Sat Jul 17 17:10:37 +0000 2010

Appears my IAD-IAH flight will be taking off 9min late. And arriving 53min late. 'Splain that. \(Also, hope it's not true; will miss connex\.\)

Sat Jul 17 17:12:50 +0000 2010

Just talked with utterly unhelpful @continental elite agent, who told me the next flt is full, & effectively said "gee, I hope you make it."

Sat Jul 17 17:14:02 +0000 2010

Gee, I hope so, too.

Sat Jul 17 17:14:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @patrickgmj

Yes, it must be some sort of space-time warp in which you lose 50 minutes and 1 crucial checked bag.

Sat Jul 17 17:26:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @parezcoydigo

I'm beginning to wonder.

Sat Jul 17 17:26:40 +0000 2010

Made my connection. I'm getting home tonight. #whew

Sat Jul 17 22:53:38 +0000 2010

Replying to @nycdlq

That is the $64 question.

Sat Jul 17 23:06:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Indeed. My cats will appreciate it, as will everyone around me when I don't have a total meltdown in a public place.

Sat Jul 17 23:11:59 +0000 2010

RT @mkgold: Go @chutry! RT @henryjenkins: Chuck Tryon discusses how digital media is "reinventing cinema" http://bit.ly/csVzx0

Sat Jul 17 23:23:35 +0000 2010

I am terrified of everything in my refrigerator.

Sun Jul 18 03:35:06 +0000 2010

I mean, seriously; there's milk in there that *claims* it'll be okay until July 31. I left here July 1. How is that possible?

Sun Jul 18 03:35:39 +0000 2010

In related news: I'm home.

Sun Jul 18 03:36:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @kdettmar

Sadly, it's far more - well, not *pedestrian*, per se, but - transportational than that.

Sun Jul 18 03:37:18 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Sooooo glad to be back here. And don't worry; the milk is a goner. As are the avocados and the unidentifiable leftovers.

Sun Jul 18 03:52:03 +0000 2010

Replying to @ryanhealy

Actually, it's whole, but organic & "ultra-pasteurized." I don't use milk but my partner swore it lasted past the date last time.

Sun Jul 18 04:30:12 +0000 2010

Replying to @mattthomas

Actually, kinda yes and kinda no. It's organic but "ultra-pasteurized." My partner said it lasted past the date last time.

Sun Jul 18 04:40:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @pronetolaughter

Ack! I'm so sorry to hear that. Everything of mine seems to have made it - or I haven't yet figured out it's missing.

Sun Jul 18 04:44:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @jamescummings

Actually, this is organic, so it's preservative-free. But the higher-temp pasteurization no doubt does it.

Sun Jul 18 15:12:57 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

You know, I get how that works, and still the no-refrig milk/aseptic packaged freaks me out.

Sun Jul 18 15:15:18 +0000 2010

It's computer hygiene day here at home: ensuring backups and software are current, cleaning old caches, fixing bad filenames, etc.

Sun Jul 18 18:47:32 +0000 2010

Replying to @ProfHacker

I'll ponder. I'd agree if I'd gone at it in some smart or systematic manner, rather than stupidly backing in due to problems.

Sun Jul 18 19:15:59 +0000 2010

Replying to @jenterysayers

Hello, Jentery!

Sun Jul 18 21:35:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

Congrats - that's amazing! \(I felt much the same after the two marathons I ran \- took a day or so to be able to think again\.\)

Mon Jul 19 00:23:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @wpwend42

Cover letter for a job application? Yes, provided you have that much of substance to say. Keep it as tight as possible, though.

Mon Jul 19 15:03:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @jbj

Fair enough. Once I can figure out how to narrativize my stupid flailing \(or at least what lessons I've learned from it\) I'll schedule.

Mon Jul 19 15:04:38 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

Hmmm. Not a bad idea at all.

Mon Jul 19 15:10:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Worry not.

Mon Jul 19 15:21:00 +0000 2010

My Twitter stream is making me hungry.

Mon Jul 19 17:50:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I'll be right there.

Mon Jul 19 17:57:45 +0000 2010

I have caved, 100%: I now have MS Office on both of my machines & am guiltily enjoying the non-crapped-up formatting of docs I get sent.

Mon Jul 19 17:58:24 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

I'd say yes, but I should probably try to keep a bit more loca- in my -vore.

Mon Jul 19 18:02:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Excellent.

Mon Jul 19 18:03:04 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

I hear that. SoCal produce isn't bad, though...

Mon Jul 19 18:06:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

Not yet - I'll be there by the end of the first week of August. Still got to pack & move yet.

Mon Jul 19 18:12:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

Oh, but had passed through there twice in the last couple of weeks, before & after DH2010, so I see how you thought that.

Mon Jul 19 18:13:30 +0000 2010

Just finished reviewing proofs for an article that may not run, because I can't sign the copyright form. Curious how this will go.

Mon Jul 19 18:20:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @joncgoodwin

Ha. No, my "can't" is about non-medical conditions, and not just an objection: I can't sign because I can't abide by its terms.

Mon Jul 19 18:46:21 +0000 2010

Replying to @TheRepoRat

The latter, most definitely. Particularly in that I've already violated the terms as written. Thus "can't" rather than "won't."

Mon Jul 19 18:47:30 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

Can't. Wait.

Mon Jul 19 18:59:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

What @tmcphers said.

Mon Jul 19 21:57:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

Man, you know how to do a vacation up *right*!

Mon Jul 19 22:58:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I am alas on something akin to that pace. Which is why it took so long for this reply to appear.

Tue Jul 20 01:15:44 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

Aw, man, my undergrad library was like that - caught in transition between Dewey & LOC. I'm somewhat nostalgic for it!

Tue Jul 20 14:41:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

Spent a lot of time trying to decide whether there was rhyme or reason to the shuffle. Made clear how arbitrary each was.

Tue Jul 20 14:42:34 +0000 2010

New blog post: Where Am I Going, Where Have I Been http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/where-am-i-going-where-have-i-been/

Tue Jul 20 15:59:21 +0000 2010

How badly do I not want to face the next task I have to take on? SO badly.

Tue Jul 20 18:55:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni and @dancohen

But would that devalue links to @ProfHacker articles or links by @ProfHacker contribs? Bc not all our links are to PH...

Tue Jul 20 19:05:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen and @jcmeloni

What @cforster said.

Tue Jul 20 19:06:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Ah, okay. Stress makes me literal, apparently.

Tue Jul 20 19:10:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Actually, looking at the posts in my stream, a match for the string "New at ProfHacker" might do it; that's the most commonly RTd.

Tue Jul 20 19:12:06 +0000 2010

Hmm. Some runaway process on the iMac had eaten up 60GB worth of disk memory. Tried to restart; machine hung. What gives?

Tue Jul 20 19:38:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

*sigh*

Tue Jul 20 19:38:32 +0000 2010

Okay, I take it back. After restart, the 60GB of hd space is still gone. And I am puzzled.

Tue Jul 20 19:44:31 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

et al: do folks publishing in DHQ really want to use a paper analogy just for T&P? There are better ways of making the arg

Tue Jul 20 19:54:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @sgsinclair

Thanks! But ugh. One culprit appears to be kernel.log, which is FILLED with errors being thrown by disk4s2. My Time Capsule?

Tue Jul 20 20:15:05 +0000 2010

The bad news is that I think my Time Capsule died this morning, sending >23GB of error messages to kernel.log in the process.

Tue Jul 20 20:36:04 +0000 2010

The good news is that my Time Capsule's serial number is in the range that's been mentioned for Apple replacement.

Tue Jul 20 20:39:10 +0000 2010

Would be nice, however, if I could actually find some information about the Time Capsule replacement program from, say, Apple.

Tue Jul 20 20:49:48 +0000 2010

Ugh; found the info. It's for faulty power supplies, not for failing hard disks. So I may be stuck.

Tue Jul 20 20:57:32 +0000 2010

Wait: the TC mounted; whatever its problem, it's not the one throwing errors. TC=disk3s2; errors coming from disk4s2. Which is what disk?

Tue Jul 20 21:02:09 +0000 2010

Replying to @captain_primate

Since March 2008, apparently.

Tue Jul 20 21:10:21 +0000 2010

Okay, nearly 60GB worth of logs, which popped up in about an hour, deleted. Still can't figure out which disk was throwing the errors, tho.

Tue Jul 20 21:38:44 +0000 2010

Hey, remember when I said I didn't want to face the next task on my list, like two hours ago? Guess what? I haven't!

Tue Jul 20 21:44:09 +0000 2010

Replying to @billiehara

WOW - that's some serious walking!

Wed Jul 21 03:13:03 +0000 2010

Replying to @ryancordell

Have you gotten ahold of a copy? I'd be happy to send you mine.

Wed Jul 21 23:27:13 +0000 2010

Found out today that my passive-aggressive downstairs neighbor hired the woman who cleans my apt in an attempt to use her to spy on me.

Thu Jul 22 00:13:11 +0000 2010

She refused. And of course told me the story.

Thu Jul 22 00:14:13 +0000 2010

I am unbelievably tickled by this. A nice bit of information to tuck away for a rainy day.

Thu Jul 22 00:15:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Indeed.

Thu Jul 22 00:17:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @TheRepoRat

Alas, we both own. At least what she wanted to know was totally benign, but that she wouldn't just ask me is a scream.

Thu Jul 22 00:24:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

She wanted S to turn on the sound system here to see if the bass was making her ceiling vibrate. That she wouldn't ask me is a riot.

Thu Jul 22 00:25:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

But then, she did ask me about it 5 yrs ago, and we picked the subwoofer up off the floor. Now, she says, the vibration's back.

Thu Jul 22 00:26:20 +0000 2010

What my neighbor wanted to know: if I'd moved my subwoofer back onto the floor, as she claims our soundsystem is making her ceiling vibrate.

Thu Jul 22 00:27:55 +0000 2010

I hadn't. In fact, I picked it up at her behest 5 years ago. That she doesn't want to ask me about it directly is hysterically funny to me.

Thu Jul 22 00:28:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

Oho. So this whole thing about my subwoofer is really a screen for Wiley's plan to ensure my book never sees the light of day?

Thu Jul 22 00:37:37 +0000 2010

Why is AT&T emailing me about their new store in Niles, MI?

Thu Jul 22 02:43:52 +0000 2010

Replying to @sherah1918

Definitely begins to sound like a scam.

Thu Jul 22 03:01:21 +0000 2010

Replying to @unsworth

Nice. It looked phishy, but I couldn't spot the hook. Thanks, John.

Thu Jul 22 03:10:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @unsworth

It's quite clever; I could easily have fallen for it, as I have a habit of unsubbing from random stuff like that.

Thu Jul 22 03:10:53 +0000 2010

As @unsworth points out to me, the AT&T Niles, MI email is phishing; the hook is in the unsubscribe link!

Thu Jul 22 03:12:01 +0000 2010

Replying to @unsworth

I got that one, too. Is it animus toward MI, or an assumption that MI won't raise suspicions?

Thu Jul 22 05:09:04 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

I got the Angola one overnight!

Thu Jul 22 15:06:51 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Woo-hoo! Need a test subject?

Thu Jul 22 15:07:30 +0000 2010

Two days ago I searched for a particular product on the site of a particular internet discounter. [1/2]

Thu Jul 22 17:40:57 +0000 2010

Since then, ads for that discounter featuring that item have popped up EVERYWHERE. Perhaps it's time to clear my caches. [2/2]

Thu Jul 22 17:41:39 +0000 2010

Today's massive lack of productivity is sending me out to run errands. I may even go to a movie! It's been that kind of day.

Thu Jul 22 21:55:46 +0000 2010

Okay, now I feel productive. Got the car smogged, went to the PO, renewed my registration & insurance, & am now at the movies. Much better.

Thu Jul 22 23:34:18 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Inception.

Thu Jul 22 23:49:01 +0000 2010

Replying to @kdettmar

Actually, what you want is the future anterior, my favorite tense. How great it will be having done it!

Fri Jul 23 03:32:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @nickmirzoeff

I'm in Claremont, probably until Aug 7 or 8. Finishing up some stuff here & packing. Glad you're enjoying the workshop!

Fri Jul 23 03:56:12 +0000 2010

@ryancordell Hey, knock 'em dead, Ryan!

Fri Jul 23 13:57:24 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Yikes! I'm so sorry to hear about this - I hope the kitty's okay.

Fri Jul 23 14:46:54 +0000 2010

Rilly, rilly not with the program yet this morning. Or this summer, quite frankly. What say we back the calendary up a bit & take a do-over?

Fri Jul 23 14:50:39 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Gads, the things they can get into. It never fails to surprise me, either.

Fri Jul 23 15:17:52 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

It does still happen! They're just called something like "electronic roundtables." They use laptops w/large external montors.

Fri Jul 23 15:40:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

Problem is no one knows what an "electronic roundtable" is. I wish we could decide that "poster session" is not a pejorative."

Fri Jul 23 15:43:33 +0000 2010

Now wondering if the energy of the DH poster session would be transferable to MLA if we were to create a specific campaign... #mla11

Fri Jul 23 15:47:13 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

Fri Jul 23 15:48:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @nickmirzoeff

Fri Jul 23 17:20:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @ryancordell

Woo-hoo! Congrats!

Fri Jul 23 18:25:47 +0000 2010

Twitter's "thanks for noticing" when something has gone wrong technically always strikes me as insincere, if not downright sarcastic.

Fri Jul 23 20:39:21 +0000 2010

RT @lizlosh: Rosenbloom says that experimentation may need to be added to analysis in humanities methods #critcode // brilliant!

Fri Jul 23 23:18:20 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni and @mkirschenbaum

And an expansion thereof beyond DH to the humanities-in-general.

Fri Jul 23 23:53:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @profhood

Ah, you must have missed the joyous reunion.

Sat Jul 24 00:07:06 +0000 2010

I will finish that peer review. I will finish that peer review. I will finish that peer review. Um. After I get back from a run.

Sat Jul 24 16:05:23 +0000 2010

Okay, what's with Chrome suddenly allowing all these pop-ups even though I've got pop-ups disallowed, huh?

Sat Jul 24 17:16:46 +0000 2010

PS: This running thing is starting to kick back into place. So yay.

Sat Jul 24 17:17:43 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

Soooo good. It's been eons since I've been able to get ahold of it.

Sat Jul 24 18:52:32 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

I'm so glad to hear that!

Sat Jul 24 19:47:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @billiehara and @rachaelsullivan

Leslie Stahl used to work out at the gym I belonged to in NYC back in the late 90s. She'd be dropped off [1/2]

Sat Jul 24 19:49:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @billiehara and @rachaelsullivan

at 5.30 am by her driver and work out in full 60 Minutes hair and makeup. It was super unnerving. [2/2]

Sat Jul 24 19:49:20 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

Happens to me every time I go get my hair cut. I see the gossip rag covers and think "who?"

Sat Jul 24 20:54:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

iAnnotate PDF. It's not perfect, but I like the annotation capacity.

Sun Jul 25 14:13:22 +0000 2010

The peer review of death is at last done & in. Now beginning the horrific project of cleaning out closets & dressers preparatory to packing.

Sun Jul 25 18:04:18 +0000 2010

The piles: to go to Goodwill; to be stored in the garage; to be stored in my office; to stay put; to be shipped to NY; to come with me to NY

Sun Jul 25 18:05:46 +0000 2010

I have approximately 10 days to decide which pile EVERY SINGLE ITEM IN MY HOUSE goes into.

Sun Jul 25 18:06:21 +0000 2010

Oh, forgot the "direct to dumpster" pile.

Sun Jul 25 18:07:03 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Trust me; odd corners are stacked with piles of old boxes & shopping bags & stuff I "might use someday." Ah, the joy of purging.

Sun Jul 25 21:00:44 +0000 2010

Replying to @2xlp

Yes! Furnished studio on perfect block in west village for only mildly insane $$$. July 4th weekend Craigslist FTW.

Sun Jul 25 21:04:33 +0000 2010

RT @academicdave: Significant ruling on DRM: http://bit.ly/b0lHeR // Whoa: LOC allows cracking CSS on DVDs, calls jailbreaking fair use.

Mon Jul 26 16:33:42 +0000 2010

Holy cow, if I'm reading that right, not only jailbreaking but unlocking is now considered fair use. Go LOC! http://bit.ly/b0lHeR

Mon Jul 26 16:35:40 +0000 2010

Also breaking DRM on "literary works distributed in ebook format" in order to enable read-aloud or to convert to format of screen reader.

Mon Jul 26 16:37:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

No, actually, that is new: the previous allowance was strictly for classroom use; this is for *critical* & documentary use.

Mon Jul 26 16:38:12 +0000 2010

Breaking CSS now legal "when circumvention is accomplished solely in order to accomplish the incorporation of short portions [1/2]

Mon Jul 26 16:39:25 +0000 2010

of motion pictures into new works for the purpose of criticism or comment" - no longer just restricted to classroom use. [2/2]

Mon Jul 26 16:39:50 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

The ruling seems to indicate that cracking for purposes of inclusion in critical commentary falls under fair use!

Mon Jul 26 16:49:24 +0000 2010

Replying to @BGCDML

Hmm. That doesn't seem to have come up, though cracking DRM on video games for "good faith testing" purposes is now fair use.

Mon Jul 26 16:50:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @JeffatSCC

Indeed: no longer restricted to film & media studies profs; includes students!

Mon Jul 26 16:51:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @jmittell

Yes, good point; "fair use" is nebulous, and this is not: cracking for purposes of critical commentary now legal, period.

Mon Jul 26 16:59:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @jmittell

\(With the non\-insignificant caveat that if there are other measures than cracking available, one has to take them\.\)

Mon Jul 26 17:00:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

Exactly. c.f. In Media Res.

Mon Jul 26 17:03:49 +0000 2010

New blog post: Fair Use http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/fair-use/

Mon Jul 26 18:19:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

Not a bad idea; thanks!

Mon Jul 26 18:23:11 +0000 2010

Replying to @jmittell

Excellent! I'll ponder.

Mon Jul 26 18:28:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @zota

That's certainly what it looks like to me. I wonder why everyone has latched on the jailbreaking clause rather than the unlocking one.

Mon Jul 26 19:55:40 +0000 2010

Replying to @jbj

But I can't not go out that way!

Mon Jul 26 20:02:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @boonebgorges

Is that a contented sigh or a cry for help? #oneweek

Mon Jul 26 20:23:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @boonebgorges

I get it. #oneweek

Mon Jul 26 20:26:31 +0000 2010

Replying to @digitalhumanist

Hi, Dave's family, from pleasantly sunny Southern California.

Tue Jul 27 00:50:59 +0000 2010

Replying to @escapegrace

Well, when you put it that way...

Tue Jul 27 01:31:10 +0000 2010

Very excited that SQ's open review is getting notice today - though extremely sorry that MediaCommons's role in the process got no play.

Tue Jul 27 14:13:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Oh, hey, thanks!

Tue Jul 27 14:14:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

Just spotted that! Many thanks to @NEH_ODH, for the tweet and for making these experiments possible!

Tue Jul 27 14:21:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @pmhswe

Oh, I have no worries about that! Katherine's been fabulous to work with.

Tue Jul 27 14:30:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @billiehara

Oh no! I'm so sorry!

Tue Jul 27 16:08:27 +0000 2010

Tue Jul 27 16:28:25 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall and @foundhistory

Tue Jul 27 16:40:33 +0000 2010

@briancroxall @foundhistory Also the @NEH_ODH funded MC profile system: http://bit.ly/bvbTow #oneweek \(now with hashtag\!\)

Tue Jul 27 16:41:24 +0000 2010

Replying to @foundhistory

Yes, of course! But there might be a utility \(i\.e\., shared resources\) in building on existing models, no? #oneweek

Tue Jul 27 16:47:07 +0000 2010

All of the #oneweek ideas are fantastic; I'm having a hard time finding a preference. Looking forward to watching it unfold...

Tue Jul 27 16:52:03 +0000 2010

Replying to @amandafrench and @foundhistory

Ooh, 1 with footnote support would be great; see my comment on that WP-as-book-platform post abt footnote pain.

Replying to @dancohen

*exhausted sigh*

docs.title: 2010 08 01 tweets

Insta-poll: If you were going on sabbatical for a year and could bring one cookbook with you, which one would it be?

Sun Aug 01 18:25:21 +0000 2010

Really excellent cookbook choices! I'm leaning toward the five of you who said some variant of "internet, doofus." I think that's where I am

Sun Aug 01 19:37:51 +0000 2010

Though if I were to bring one print cookbook, @edmj and @brettbobley, it would be Bittman.

Sun Aug 01 19:38:48 +0000 2010

Okay, back to packing.

Sun Aug 01 19:40:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Yeah, that's one of my favorite apps, especially standing in the grocery store thinking "what could I do with *that*?"

Sun Aug 01 19:41:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @mikejolk

Ooh, really? I'll go look for that; thanks!

Sun Aug 01 20:48:39 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

You know, my landlord showed me this weird little alcove in my studio, called it a "kitchen." Thought I'd see how it works.

Sun Aug 01 21:37:39 +0000 2010

Replying to @edmj

Someone once asked me if I cooked. I said, well, if by that you mean do I heat food in the kitchen, sure.

Sun Aug 01 22:35:09 +0000 2010

Replying to @cforster

The Oxford Dictionary of English was auto-delivered to the Kindle app on my iPad yesterday. Surprise!

Was in the middle of sthg & thought, "oh, goodness, don't forget to do [sthg else]," but 30 seconds later had already forgotten what it was.

Here's the good news: by the time I get to NYC, all but three of my boxes should already be there waiting for me. So I can get set up ASAP.

Wed Aug 04 16:46:57 +0000 2010

Replying to @jsench

Yes, totally. Thanks for awakening the wrath of the delivery gods, man.

Wed Aug 04 17:10:24 +0000 2010

Have just shut off my land line and my cable. Cable \(or sthg like it\) will return when I do; land line probably won't. Feel oddly liberated.

Amazing day - it appears Prop8 has been shot down! http://bit.ly/dunLDL

Wed Aug 04 20:44:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @GeorgeOnline

Yeah, over 4th of July weekend, of all times!

Wed Aug 04 20:44:43 +0000 2010

RT @jwolman: Glad to hear that California is once again merely financially, as opposed to morally, bankrupt.

Wed Aug 04 20:45:57 +0000 2010

Wed Aug 04 20:53:02 +0000 2010

New blog post: Justice http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/justice/

Wed Aug 04 21:09:39 +0000 2010

The glee with which Google's announcement \(http://bit\.ly/akHmQU\) that it's canceling Wave development has been greeted depresses me. \(1/2\)

Wed Aug 04 21:29:52 +0000 2010

It's an imperfect technology with a bad rollout and an incorrect sense of its niche - but I used it in classes with great success. \(2/3\)

Wed Aug 04 21:30:59 +0000 2010

Witness my ProfHacker post: http://bit.ly/abr5Iq. I'll be sorry to see it go. \(3/3\)

Wed Aug 04 21:32:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @jwolman

That would make me quite happy, in fact; as with Buzz, I always wanted to see a better integration with the rest of the Googleplex.

Wed Aug 04 21:38:38 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

As I said, bad rollout & bad sense of the technology's purpose. But still a powerful tool, once you figure out what it's for.

Wed Aug 04 21:52:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @cscannella

Very likely you wouldn't. It's really not a personal tool, but rather groupware.

Wed Aug 04 21:58:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @cscannella

Of course! But unless your whole group wanted to use it...

Wed Aug 04 22:13:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @clioweb

I honestly believe that you could solve *any* problem using JQuery.

You go!

Huh. Same crew IAH to LGA as was on ONT to IAH. Less fancy plane, though. Sounds about right.

Sat Aug 07 17:58:01 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkgold

Dude, that sounds like being a runner to me.

Sat Aug 07 17:58:36 +0000 2010

See you in 3 hours, NY.

Sat Aug 07 18:21:49 +0000 2010

Hello, LGA.

My suitcase showed up!

Sat Aug 07 23:32:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

I have an apartment, and have even put some food in it. Now to begin unpacking.

Sat Aug 07 23:34:26 +0000 2010

Okay, everything that was here when I arrived, or that arrived with me, is unpacked and put away. Three more boxes due on Monday. Phew.

Sun Aug 08 03:23:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

Sorry - I crashed right after I finished! I'm in the west village, in a fantastic \(if tiny & $$\) studio.

Sun Aug 08 12:40:40 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

Hi Vika! A very small if lovely studio in the west village. Super happy with it so far!

Rechargeable batteries in my mouse just died. And the extras plus the charger are in one of the three boxes that's not here yet. Sigh.

Sun Aug 08 16:15:11 +0000 2010

In better news, took a run in Hudson River Park. Absolutely gorgeous out there today. I'm still in lousy shape but have inspiration now.

Sun Aug 08 16:16:28 +0000 2010

Replying to @nancybaym

I'm in NYC on sabbatical, for the academic year. I still can't believe it.

Run, breakfast, post office box, university ID card, library access. Now a late late lunch, and maybe a little actual writing.

We do that every day!

Mon Aug 09 19:44:52 +0000 2010

Now that's timing: the last three boxes just arrived. Fantastic!

Tue Aug 17 23:18:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @BryanAlexander

Kafka, definitely. The pharmacy told me the dr had to call the ins co. The dr said the pharmacy had to fax him.

Wed Aug 18 00:17:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @BryanAlexander

The insurance company, of course, was silent, with an utterly labyrinthine website which provided zero information.

Wed Aug 18 00:18:12 +0000 2010

Replying to @nancybaym

The likelihood that you're willing to hand over your password in exchange for a random meaningless number?

Wed Aug 18 02:27:18 +0000 2010

Replying to @amndw2

The ones that kill me are the KFs who register for stuff using one of my gmail addresses. You'd think you'd know your own email.

Wed Aug 18 13:37:41 +0000 2010

Only took me 4 days to manage to lock my keys in my office. And of course my office is the one for which there is only one key. Oops.

Wed Aug 18 17:46:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @2xlp

I might have been able to manage that, but the office manager needed to get a master for the floor anyhow, so all's good now.

Wed Aug 18 18:40:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @kylebeachy

Hey, happy birthday! Mine's in five days; I'm hoping to spend it reading something equally awesome.

Thu Aug 19 13:59:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @kylebeachy

\(Make that four days\. Not so much with the math today, apparently\.\)

Thu Aug 19 13:59:52 +0000 2010

One of the most painful parts of having written a book may well be filling out the author questionnaire. \(The most painful part? Indexing\.\)

Thu Aug 19 16:19:28 +0000 2010

Replying to @sgsinclair

Whoa, brilliant!

Thu Aug 19 16:32:23 +0000 2010

Happy birthday, @mkirschenbaum! I had no idea ours were so close!

Thu Aug 19 18:10:27 +0000 2010

If you'd written a book on the future of schol publishing & were asked to name the most impt journals for pub purposes, what would you list?

Thu Aug 19 18:26:51 +0000 2010

Replying to @nancybaym

It's excruciating.

Thu Aug 19 18:39:13 +0000 2010

Replying to @nancybaym

Phew! So glad to hear that. I've been getting mine religiously since 35 \(family history, etc\).

Thu Aug 19 19:04:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @sivavaid

Impact, probably; it's for publicity/review purposes.

Thu Aug 19 19:04:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @sivavaid

But yes: the irony is thick.

Thu Aug 19 19:05:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

Monday!

Thu Aug 19 19:30:13 +0000 2010

Have finished the dreaded author questionnaire. Have requested the two permissions I need to request. Am almost ready to turn the book in.

Thu Aug 19 20:48:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @katealaurel

I've got a shorter piece on OA: http://bit.ly/4KKCj1. You might also look at D Salo's "Who Owns Our Work?" http://bit.ly/cQIHWl

Fri Aug 20 11:33:39 +0000 2010

Thank you, @JenHoward, for this: "Although the Rice experiment got a lot of attention when it began, its failure doesn't..." \(1/2\)

Fri Aug 20 11:43:39 +0000 2010

"necessarily say much, if anything, about the future of digitally based university-press publishing." Like the Nature open review \(2/2\)

Fri Aug 20 11:44:13 +0000 2010

experiment, this has me worried about an inevitable "it didn't work for Rice! Digital publishing is too expensive" response, an excuse \(3/2\)

Fri Aug 20 11:45:59 +0000 2010

to avoid innovating. \(4/2\)

Fri Aug 20 11:46:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I'll see that, and raise you this: http://bit.ly/aIGxmA

Fri Aug 20 12:29:09 +0000 2010

The European Union owes me a pretty hefty reimbursement, and they're now six weeks overdue. I begin to fear I'm in line behind Greece.

Fri Aug 20 13:10:02 +0000 2010

Hey, @nowviskie - happy birthday! I hope it's a great one.

Fri Aug 20 15:52:11 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum and @nowviskie

I'm completely cuspy; we moved from Leo to Virgo at 10.30pm the night I was born, and I arrived just after.

Fri Aug 20 16:08:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Absolutely! The last thing we need is the digital press version of the Nature open review experiment: "oh, that doesn't work."

Fri Aug 20 16:10:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni and @nowviskie

Those of us who are madly clinging to the idea of our early 40s salute you!

Fri Aug 20 17:52:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @amandafrench and @JenHoward

All true. Tho NAP has managed to eke out a viable POD scheme. Part of the difference is scale:they had a huge \(1/2\)

Fri Aug 20 17:54:55 +0000 2010

Replying to @amandafrench and @JenHoward

backlist to mine. But part of it is mission. MJensen has said NAP's goal is to give away as much as possible \(2/2\)

Fri Aug 20 17:55:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @amandafrench and @JenHoward

while breaking even. They have no illusions about making $. I'd like to know more about Rice's expectations...\(3/2\)

Fri Aug 20 17:56:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @amandafrench

I always start out thinking I can do it in 2, and figure visible signs of error are better than attempts to cover it up. :)

Fri Aug 20 18:06:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @shanakimball

Yes, exactly: they're thinking about the digital on its own terms, rather than as an offshoot of a print-based model.

Fri Aug 20 18:07:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward, @amandafrench and @shanakimball

I agree - particularly if more university presses partner with their libraries...

Fri Aug 20 18:16:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

You know, you can't read an online journal in the bathtub.

Sun Aug 22 15:27:51 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality and @nowviskie

Was joking! Srsly! A play on the #bookinthebathtub ridiculousness.

Sun Aug 22 15:38:06 +0000 2010

Stormy day + R. leaving = me not exactly motivated here.

Sun Aug 22 18:55:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @parezcoydigo

Hey, you know, when my travel karma's good, it's very very good. When it's bad, though, look out. \(Don't check your bag\.\)

Sun Aug 22 20:32:28 +0000 2010

Thanks for the birthday wishes, all! Here's hoping this year measures up to the awesomeness of the last one.

Mon Aug 23 13:53:24 +0000 2010

Replying to @cforster

Thanks so much, Chris; this totally made my morning. I may put "A Force for Good" on my business cards.

Mon Aug 23 13:56:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @phdaisy

Hey, happy bday to your momma! \(Also, you're totally right about the fairy reveal\. This season's revisions aren't pleasing me\.\)

Mon Aug 23 13:57:12 +0000 2010

Replying to @jbj

Have discovered from @ProfHacker this morning that not only am I middle-aged, but I've been so for 3 years. \(Now where are my keys?\)

Mon Aug 23 13:58:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @phdaisy

Yes on all three counts! My feeling? What they invent whole-cloth works well. Much of what they revise, not so much.

Mon Aug 23 14:03:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @phdaisy

Ugh, for real.

Mon Aug 23 14:07:24 +0000 2010

Now have so many streams open \(writing blog post, FB chat, composing tweet, three other things\) that my \(middle\-aged\) brain is overclocked.

Mon Aug 23 15:10:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @BGCDML

I'd love to! Things are pretty flexible on my end, so let me know what might work for you.

Mon Aug 23 15:20:21 +0000 2010

New post: This Year http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/this-year/

Mon Aug 23 15:22:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah and @JenHoward

But a whole class can't ILL a book, while they can all rent it for a month.

Mon Aug 23 18:10:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Yeah, there's little appeal there; rentals would have to be significantly cheaper to make much difference, of "e-books" anyhow.

Mon Aug 23 20:04:03 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

But format: short-term licensing of born-digital content might have some appeal...

Mon Aug 23 20:05:05 +0000 2010

Hey, anything happen while I was out at dinner? #wow

Tue Aug 24 03:15:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @amandafrench

I am *dizzy*, and it's not just the bubbles.

Tue Aug 24 03:26:51 +0000 2010

Replying to @halavais

I'd have chosen the same, so I'm glad your partner is good - I hope she's okay, but that fall could kill an 85 year old lady!

Tue Aug 24 03:34:52 +0000 2010

RT @dancohen: Yes, @kfitz and I are storming the @nytimes to bring you the digital future of peer review: http://nyti.ms/bzPDjE

Tue Aug 24 03:39:50 +0000 2010

Absolutely agreed: "We have never done it this way before" where "never" = not since 1950.

Tue Aug 24 03:41:31 +0000 2010

I guess I missed that feature!

Tue Aug 24 03:52:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

Okay, must call a halt to this day. It's been awesome, but there's stuff to do tomorrow.

Replying to @nancybaym

Replying to @nowviskie

Replying to @amandafrench

Tue Aug 24 14:14:50 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Tue Aug 24 14:33:34 +0000 2010

\(Now to go buy newspapers\.\)

Tue Aug 24 14:34:02 +0000 2010

Replying to @redwards7

Thanks! And thanks for tweeting the article.

Tue Aug 24 15:42:33 +0000 2010

RT @JenHoward: If your French is up to it \(mine barely is\), Le Monde refs NYT open peer review story. Lively comments: http://bit.ly/9s7zrA

Replying to @dancohen

Are any of those comments public/blogged?

Replying to @dancohen

Tue Aug 24 18:23:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Whoa.

Tue Aug 24 18:45:54 +0000 2010

Dear facilities: It's 69 degrees and rainy out there today. The airconditioning is probably not necessary. Just a thought! Love, K.

Tue Aug 24 18:54:44 +0000 2010

Replying to @xina

It's pretty amazing. And it's New York. But it won't last; we're looking at 90 by Sunday.

Tue Aug 24 19:43:43 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

You & me both. When on earth did the daily hit $2?

Wed Aug 25 02:22:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @tanyaclement

Thanks!

Wed Aug 25 02:23:21 +0000 2010

Wed Aug 25 03:47:25 +0000 2010

@captain_primate I'm so sorry, Ethan. Sending you and your family good thoughts.

Wed Aug 25 19:18:57 +0000 2010

Replying to @GeorgeOnline

Wed Aug 25 19:23:20 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Wed Aug 25 20:44:48 +0000 2010

Wed Aug 25 23:38:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @JasonParkhill

Wed Aug 25 23:51:11 +0000 2010

Replying to @JDKun

Thu Aug 26 18:48:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @phdaisy

Thu Aug 26 21:59:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @theorymeg

Congratulations!
