Cranky response to open review in my comments. I continue to be surprised by "we have never done it this way before." http://bit.ly/9NynSZ

Fri Aug 27 15:16:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @RepoRat

Heh. I like "banninate." Sounds like disemvoweling, except with bananas. \(And I've seen the crank elsewhere\. Sigh\.\)

Fri Aug 27 15:25:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @crsbecker

LOL, most literally.

Fri Aug 27 15:26:18 +0000 2010

RT @crsbecker: @kfitz All caps and an extensive personal bibliography. Peer commentary would have graciously suggested that he not do that.

Fri Aug 27 15:26:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @jtheibault

But that's precisely why it's so dismaying. To have pioneered in one area but reflexively reject experimentation in another?

Fri Aug 27 15:30:37 +0000 2010

Someday I will not screw up the double DM reply. Stupid Tweetie.

Fri Aug 27 16:07:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @tanyaclement

Congratulations!

Fri Aug 27 20:55:32 +0000 2010

@jcmeloni Just home from a lovely dinner with colleagues in visiting department; now going to finish Shteyngart's Super Sad True Love Story.

Sat Aug 28 02:21:29 +0000 2010

Replying to @ibogost

Number 1: footnote/endnote support, or the failures thereof. It's sad; they undoubtedly won't fix it.

Sat Aug 28 15:10:56 +0000 2010

There are days where things conspire to take the wind right out of your sails.

Sat Aug 28 15:11:19 +0000 2010

It's such a small thing, but imagine: a key project of yours makes the front page of a major national publication! Your institution \(1/2\)

Sat Aug 28 16:09:14 +0000 2010

proudly posts a story about the story! And gets your name wrong in the headline! After working there for 12 years! \(2/2\)

Sat Aug 28 16:10:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @RepoRat

True. Have written for correction, and I'm sure it'll be fine. But it's a good ego deflater, in case I needed one.

Sat Aug 28 16:23:21 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

Yup. How'd you guess?

Sat Aug 28 16:23:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @kdettmar

Front page of the college website, baby! \(Have written for correction; all will be well\. But a nice ego deflater if I needed one\.\)

Sat Aug 28 16:24:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @pronetolaughter

Fitzgerald. Sigh.

Sat Aug 28 16:25:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

I love it.

Sat Aug 28 16:27:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @kdettmar

Or at least for a descendant of his illegitimate son.

Sat Aug 28 16:35:44 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Thus far today the main thing I have done is systematically getting out of bed at 7am and then falling back asleep on my sofa.

Sun Aug 29 14:24:52 +0000 2010

Compelling thinking from @JenHoward on continued reasons for hope in academic publishing: http://bit.ly/aHN2Cu.

Mon Aug 30 11:11:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @Vaguery

In brief: experimental failures are individual, not general. If you send me an address I can email the article.

Mon Aug 30 11:23:11 +0000 2010

Letters to NYTimes about open review article, including one from A.R. Gurney! http://tinyurl.com/2bulu3l //via @mlaconvention

Mon Aug 30 12:52:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @sramsay

Pretty awesome, huh? Particularly coupled with the "rough justice" of academic publishing. But several thoughtful ones, too.

Mon Aug 30 15:24:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @marcruppel

Wow: that's absolutely amazing.

Mon Aug 30 16:53:38 +0000 2010

RT @marcruppel: Absolutely incredible use of Google Chrome + Arcade Fire: http://www.thewildernessdowntown.com/ We need more of this.

Mon Aug 30 16:53:55 +0000 2010

Replying to @ProfHacker

"Pleads for help in" might be more accurate than "suggests" in this case! :) http://bit.ly/avKf2L

Mon Aug 30 20:09:54 +0000 2010

I have had "Hey Ya" stuck on repeat in my head all day. Not the whole song, mind you; just the "hey ya" part.

Mon Aug 30 20:14:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @kdettmar

Indeed!

Mon Aug 30 20:23:13 +0000 2010

Replying to @PhDeviate

True. It was only getting it stuck in my head for days & not being bothered by it that uncovered my love for "Sister Christian."

Mon Aug 30 22:30:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @billwolff

You go!

Mon Aug 30 23:33:06 +0000 2010

iPad reading crisis: both Amazon and the iBooks store offer the next book I was planning on reading, at the same price. Must... decide...

Mon Aug 30 23:56:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Hmmm. That's a good thought!

Tue Aug 31 00:04:42 +0000 2010

Decision on book went to iBooks, mostly for the jailbreakability @briancroxall reminded me of & future data portability of epub standard.

Tue Aug 31 00:57:59 +0000 2010

Replying to @billwolff

Ha - this had me thinking about Spalding Gray & Swimming to Cambodia...

Tue Aug 31 01:06:22 +0000 2010

Replying to @betajames

You know, in the long term, I bet that more or less equals out.

Tue Aug 31 01:09:40 +0000 2010

Replying to @captain_primate

I was remembering the ad campaign and thinking whatisthe.

Tue Aug 31 01:55:18 +0000 2010

Reading @NealStephenson's Anathem on the iPad and wishing iBooks would let me redirect word lookups to the book's glossary.

Tue Aug 31 02:23:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @jmittell

The non-fetishist in me says yes: the book is the content, not the container. But there is something particular about such a tome.

Tue Aug 31 02:33:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality and @jmittell

I'd agree with that; HOL is largely about its own materiality in a way that most novels \(even tomes\) are not.

Tue Aug 31 03:16:20 +0000 2010

Replying to @melissaterras

This is the approach I've been working on. Went up for full last year w/all dig portfolio \(& 2nd book published online\)...

Tue Aug 31 12:47:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @melissaterras

...and now hope to be someone others can point to as precedent. & to direct their chairs/deans/cmtes to: http://bit.ly/zjXhV

Tue Aug 31 12:48:45 +0000 2010

Replying to @melissaterras

Thanks! It took a bit of persuasion but I had some senior colleagues willing to argue against their peers' print fetish.

Tue Aug 31 13:02:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @melissaterras

And I had lots of data about how the online text has been used and the responses it's generated, which they couldn't dispute.

Tue Aug 31 13:03:57 +0000 2010

Replying to @johnmjones

Not without a proper security clearance, you wouldn't.

Tue Aug 31 13:07:17 +0000 2010

RT @FrostDavis: #NITLE launches digital humanities initiative for small liberal arts colleges: http://bit.ly/aFh90E #digitalhumanities /Yay!

Tue Aug 31 13:19:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @FrostDavis

My pleasure! I'm really excited about it.

Tue Aug 31 13:23:35 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Agreed. http://bit.ly/aK1F0v \(The chunk from PO in which I focus on that issue; there's a bit more earlier in the chapter\.\.\)

Tue Aug 31 13:52:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

UC and UMich are both returning to this mission by offering their faculties a range of publishing services. \(1/2\)

Tue Aug 31 13:58:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Catherine Mitchell is brilliant on this. http://bit.ly/9ICvT8 and http://bit.ly/dlzLjb \(2/2\)

Tue Aug 31 14:01:21 +0000 2010

New post: Past and Future http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/past-and-future/

Tue Aug 31 14:46:42 +0000 2010

It's a blogging kinda day! New post: To Read: How Not to Run a University Press. http://bit.ly/bfBUnW

Tue Aug 31 17:45:44 +0000 2010

Have a bad feeling about this disturbance in my visual field...

Tue Aug 31 20:41:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @kdettmar

Tis what I'm doing. Just trying to wrap up last details before this thing hits, if it's going to...

Tue Aug 31 21:25:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @tmcphers

It's only a migraine, but thanks for the concern! \(And I'll add, not for the first time, yay Maxalt\!\)

docs.title: 2010 09 01 tweets
docs.text:
Replying to @theorymeg

You'll be great!

Wed Sep 01 16:53:12 +0000 2010

Replying to @janaremy

Ugh, so sorry to hear this! I've had it happen a couple of times and found the waiting part to be the hardest. Sending good vibes.

Wed Sep 01 16:54:21 +0000 2010

Hey, @thatcamp: did I see a tweet go by in the last day or so about THATCamp NYC? Looking for dates...

Wed Sep 01 17:47:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @thatcamp

Aw, dude. It was WordCamp NYC. Rats.

Wed Sep 01 17:53:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkgold

Yup; that was it exactly.

Wed Sep 01 17:53:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @thatcamp

Undoubtedly! Alas, October would be the ideal moment for me to talk with a bunch of DH nerds about a *Drupal* based project...

Wed Sep 01 17:58:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Who, me? \(Uh, yeah, actually\.\)

Wed Sep 01 18:21:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

Your feet are going to be on the ground.

Wed Sep 01 20:25:24 +0000 2010

Okay, what gives? The Weather app on my iPhone keeps changing my New York entry to Hoboken.

Wed Sep 01 20:31:02 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum and @nowviskie

Wasn't really trying; just wondering who else here is as suggestible as I am.

Wed Sep 01 20:33:31 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

I carry a compass. It helps me along.

Wed Sep 01 20:40:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @GeorgeOnline

Forward.

Wed Sep 01 20:42:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @utmediaresearch

I doubt that's it; there is definitely a weather station in NYC \(in Central Park\), and this is a new problem...

Wed Sep 01 20:54:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @utmediaresearch

The Apple discussion pages have other folks pointing to the same issue; may be a problem in Yahoo's feed, or in iOS 4.02.

Wed Sep 01 20:54:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

This just started today; for the last three weeks, it's said "New York." My Paris entry changed, too. Might be a Yahoo prob.

Wed Sep 01 21:03:28 +0000 2010

I do not feel at all ready to start writing this article yet, but I must force myself. Tomorrow. There Will Be Sentences.

Wed Sep 01 21:23:51 +0000 2010

By the by, the 1st goal of my sabbatical has been met: I ran 3mi today without feeling like I was going to die. It's the first time in 5yrs!

Wed Sep 01 21:25:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @nmhouston

Calling me a marathoner would seriously over dignify it, but I have run 2. Blew an arch in training for the 2nd; hence the 5yrs!

Wed Sep 01 21:47:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @plragde

I'd say that's a good question, except that I've been breathing August Manhattan air for the last month, and that can't be better.

Thu Sep 02 02:08:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

You. Go.

Thu Sep 02 02:09:09 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Eek! Even if you mean minutes per mile, you sorely overestimate me. I'm running just under 11 right now, aiming for 10.

Thu Sep 02 02:10:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @nmhouston

Not just the arch that's healing, but the desire to run. So nice to have it back. No more marathons for me; I'm happy with my 3.

Thu Sep 02 02:15:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

That's great, though! We'll definitely do it. My secondary goal this year will be motivating others. http://bit.ly/dc0aVw

Thu Sep 02 02:28:20 +0000 2010

Replying to @amandafrench

What I find myself astonished by are the conferences that use campus facilities and still charge hundreds.

Thu Sep 02 13:23:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Yes, but surely campuses don't charge hotel conv center rates? Or perhaps not *don't* but *shouldn't*.

Final sentences are really hard. And they get harder as a project gets longer; it's hard to balance an entire book on such a little point.

Wed Oct 06 19:16:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Ooh, no. I just looked: it was "blues." \(Sort of\. I ended with a quotation, which was followed by a citation\. Bad dissertator\!\)

Wed Oct 06 19:27:14 +0000 2010

What I really want to end with is "do it, dammit."

Wed Oct 06 19:28:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I wish I could take credit. A favorite quotation: "One need not have suffered to sing the postmodern blues."

Wed Oct 06 19:30:03 +0000 2010

I think I managed to avoid ending this thing with the phrase "into the future." Whew.

Wed Oct 06 19:58:47 +0000 2010

That final sentence? "Change is coming, with or without us, and the choice is ours: we can work to create a scholarly communication [+]

Wed Oct 06 20:25:09 +0000 2010

environment that will help new ideas thrive, or we can watch our current publishing system die, allowing the profession to become not [+]

Wed Oct 06 20:25:54 +0000 2010

just obsolete, but irrelevant, silenced." [-]

Wed Oct 06 20:26:19 +0000 2010

My feeling: the rhythm is still off. It's got too many phrases, and yet the final one is one item too short.

Wed Oct 06 20:27:43 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkgold

Hmmm. Good idea!

Wed Oct 06 20:37:59 +0000 2010

Replying to @swarthmoreburke

Perhaps. I'm striving for exhortation but it makes me nervous, esp in the last sentence of the book.

Wed Oct 06 20:39:29 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Yeah, I think I'm attached to ending on the negative, too. It's the "or else" that feels most motivating, for better or for worse.

Wed Oct 06 20:43:32 +0000 2010

Replying to @swarthmoreburke

Except that in this case the future I'm projecting doesn't exist yet. What I'm basically arguing is "build it or die."

Wed Oct 06 20:44:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @swarthmoreburke

I hope that's what the whole book has done! And the thrust of the last few paragraphs has been not change-in-this-way [+]

Wed Oct 06 20:48:02 +0000 2010

Replying to @swarthmoreburke

but instead change-is-the-only-constant. Embrace change!

Wed Oct 06 20:50:50 +0000 2010

Replying to @swarthmoreburke

Perhaps it's that analogy I need. I'll ponder.

Wow. Went to bed at 10, and woke up at 2.30, thinking, oh no. And then woke up again at 4, at 5.30, and at 8.30. Am actually up now.

Mon Oct 25 13:06:01 +0000 2010

Now waiting for tea to steep so that I can be awake as well.

Mon Oct 25 13:08:02 +0000 2010

New post: Peer-to-Peer Review and Its Aporias http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/peer-to-peer-review-and-its-aporias/

Mon Oct 25 14:25:13 +0000 2010

Replying to @mamamusings

I find it terrifying. And realize that I need to make much more religious use of my VPN.

Mon Oct 25 15:56:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @sivavaid

Congratulations! So sorry not to be there to raise a glass with you.

Mon Oct 25 16:36:10 +0000 2010

Am right on the cusp of making the decision to attend DH2011 without presenting. It's not as though I'd be able to get it paid for, anyhow.

Mon Oct 25 16:56:21 +0000 2010

Replying to @drbrake

Thanks! I'll look forward to reading.

Mon Oct 25 17:14:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

I'm still not 100% convinced that they're no longer meaningful, but I do think they've become banal, which is worth noting.

Mon Oct 25 17:56:05 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

If the zombie is a figure for the narcotized subject of late capitalism, its banality reflects that we are all that subject.

Mon Oct 25 17:56:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

Which is in its own way a really important thing to note.

Mon Oct 25 17:57:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

http://www.lacan.com/zizdazedandconfused.html

Mon Oct 25 18:00:28 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

Ha. Zizek has always already written an essay on the zombie.

Mon Oct 25 18:01:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @zota

Does it work if you're using a VPN?

Mon Oct 25 22:08:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @zota

I will hope. It's the kind of thing that really makes me rethink how casual I've become about wireless network use...

Mon Oct 25 22:17:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @striphas

Thanks, Ted!

Tue Oct 26 13:39:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @mcalamelli

Works perfectly; thanks!

Tue Oct 26 13:45:54 +0000 2010

For those of you who used BackType Connect to pull Twitter posts into your blog comments, there's an excellent new fork: http://is.gd/gkfXc

Tue Oct 26 13:49:03 +0000 2010

Replying to @shanakimball

Yay! Congratulations to all!

Tue Oct 26 14:02:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

Yay! Looking forward to it.

Tue Oct 26 14:06:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @mamamusings

Safe travels!

Tue Oct 26 19:37:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Thank you! So glad to hear it. Now MAKE IT HAPPEN, Goog.

Tue Oct 26 19:39:04 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Damn. The pressure's on. Wait! Now more pressure!

Tue Oct 26 19:41:06 +0000 2010

I will use my 5000th tweet to say thanks to all of you: This community of scholars and smarty-pants folks continues to inspire me every day.

Tue Oct 26 19:48:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Oh, crap. So sorry!

Tue Oct 26 20:22:47 +0000 2010

I may or may not have installed firesheep today in order to see whether anything was visible over NYU's closed wifi. \(It wasn't\.\)

Tue Oct 26 20:48:22 +0000 2010

Just discovered that \(a\) the pay network in this tea shop is totally firesheepable, and [+]

Tue Oct 26 22:20:40 +0000 2010

\(b\) I didn't have it configured properly before, so need to test the NYU network again. \(PS: this thing is scary\.\)

Tue Oct 26 22:22:41 +0000 2010

Interesting fact: used Boingo to log onto tea shop pay network; fired up VPN; lost connection to wifi. When I reconnected, my VPN [+]

Tue Oct 26 22:23:59 +0000 2010

automatically, and though I'm now logged off of Boingo, I'm still online.[-]

Tue Oct 26 22:24:29 +0000 2010

Wait! I was using VPN & watching firesheep, & my own Google id \(running in Chrome\) came up! Was it captured in the machine or over the air?

Tue Oct 26 22:32:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @xina

Yeah, not that, unfortunately. It's the Firefox plugin announced yesterday that basically lets you grab anyone's info off open wifi.

Tue Oct 26 22:49:02 +0000 2010

Firesheep somehow just captured my Google id even though \(a\) I'm on VPN, and \(b\) I have nothing Google open. Freaked out; going offline.

Tue Oct 26 22:51:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @moncia

Basically it sniffs your login info as you use FB, Twitter, etc. Lets them log in as you. \(Am now on iPhone 3G, not wifi\.\)

Tue Oct 26 22:55:18 +0000 2010

Replying to @cscannella

Hmmm. I wonder if Ff has my Google acct saved somewhere. I'll delete cookies...

Tue Oct 26 23:00:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

How's your knee? You holding up?

Tue Oct 26 23:05:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @cscannella

Must have been the cookies; deleted & no sign of me. Still unnerved that my sessions are captured when I'm logged into VPN, tho.

Tue Oct 26 23:14:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @cscannella

I think. What I need is two machines side by side, one logged into VPN, to see what the other can capture.

Tue Oct 26 23:25:06 +0000 2010

Ugh. Also need to test out using iPad while monitoring Firesheep.

Tue Oct 26 23:27:20 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I'm so sorry. I'd send Vicodin if it would get there in time. Or, you know, if I had any. Sending good thoughts instead...

Tue Oct 26 23:28:50 +0000 2010

Replying to @cscannella

I want to say that I may have looked at it at some point, but I could sure use a refresher!

Tue Oct 26 23:36:11 +0000 2010

Replying to @zota

Exactly what I was afraid of. Is there a VPN client for iPad?

Wed Oct 27 01:36:46 +0000 2010

Where are you now, @jcmeloni? Are you at least partaking of adulterated whisky to get you through?

Wed Oct 27 02:14:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Ach. Airborne. I forget that airlines other than mine have that fancy in-air wifi. Will you be able to get comfortable in SEA-TAC?

Wed Oct 27 02:22:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @mamamusings

Figured out that it was google.com that was in http rather than https; if yr logged in & google sthg yr acct cd be open.

Wed Oct 27 03:47:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

You said it; it's sticky down here, too. I did request actual fall crispness for Friday's trip, so...

Wed Oct 27 14:22:57 +0000 2010

Two nights of stress dreams. Feeling overwhelmed by my to-do list. And I'm supposed to be on sabbatical! How did I get myself into this?

Wed Oct 27 16:25:34 +0000 2010

In happier news, the 1Password Chrome plugin has made a huge advance as of today.

Wed Oct 27 16:27:52 +0000 2010

Also, one of those good-news/bad-news situations: the good news is that my property taxes have dropped almost $1K over the last two years.

Wed Oct 27 16:44:21 +0000 2010

The bad news is that there's a reason why my property taxes have dropped almost $1K over the last two years.

Wed Oct 27 16:44:44 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

Oh, good lord! I'm glad to know you're fine, but how terrifying!

Wed Oct 27 17:19:24 +0000 2010

Okay, figured out a crucial part of how to manage a project with a very impending due date. Now to do the actual managing.

Wed Oct 27 17:41:13 +0000 2010

Replying to @dougreside

Alas, I think "manage" was misleading. What I figured out is specific to *this* project. Oh, if it were only transferable!

Wed Oct 27 17:58:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Must figure out how to do that. But YES, absolutely.

Wed Oct 27 19:50:12 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

There's always a catch, isn't there?

Wed Oct 27 20:05:23 +0000 2010

RT @mlaconvention: NYU grads get another chance to vote to unionize: http://chronicle.com/article/Labor-Board-Gives-NYU-Graduate/125135/

Thu Oct 28 20:51:24 +0000 2010

@mkgold Just catching up here -- but wow! Congratulations!

Thu Oct 28 20:57:48 +0000 2010

Home from all-day meeting at MLA. Need to go run. Need to finish slides for tomorrow. Need to take nap. Guess which one is winning?

Thu Oct 28 21:14:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Sadly, it did not work out that way. Decided it was too late to nap, so goofed around for an hour instead. Now to work!

Thu Oct 28 22:43:08 +0000 2010

Futzing with slides goes better with a nice bit of Jameson.

Fri Oct 29 01:37:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @loganpoppy

Boy, I should have clarified. Yes, the whisky, thank goodness.

Fri Oct 29 01:43:28 +0000 2010

Replying to @midwinter_

I wonder how the Chron would feel about that?

Fri Oct 29 02:57:30 +0000 2010

Replying to @jbj and @midwinter_

I think you meant to say Irish.

Fri Oct 29 02:58:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @jbj

We can certainly meet up where bourbon is concerned. And possibly over a Lagavulin.

Fri Oct 29 03:07:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @jbj

Ooh nice.

Fri Oct 29 03:22:18 +0000 2010

Replying to @sramsay

Whoa.

Fri Oct 29 03:22:51 +0000 2010

Have finished reworking tomorrow's talk. Now, packing and sleep.

Fri Oct 29 03:24:39 +0000 2010

And with that, I'm down to three overdue items on my to-do list, and eleventy-billion upcoming deadlines.

Fri Oct 29 03:25:51 +0000 2010

Why is Gowalla convinced that I'm at CLT instead of LGA?

Fri Oct 29 13:58:58 +0000 2010

On the shuttle to Boston. See some of you there!

Fri Oct 29 14:44:08 +0000 2010

The view from my hotel room in Boston. No kidding. http://yfrog.com/emmmndj

Fri Oct 29 16:52:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @cliotropic

So sorry you weren't able to make it! I hope you \(metaphorically\) caught that truck.

Sat Oct 30 00:22:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

@jwacooks A wonderful dinner, indeed. Thanks so much for it & for your hospitality today. I'll look forward to the next opportunity!

Sat Oct 30 01:18:13 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Funny thing is I just went downstairs & grabbed a Jameson, whereupon a waiter nearly ran into me, causing me to spill part of it.

Sat Oct 30 01:30:31 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

For a packed bar in a fancy hotel, I think it's the closest outcome.

Sat Oct 30 01:31:53 +0000 2010

Thought of both @mlaconvention and @samplereality when I added this image to the slides for today's talk: http://is.gd/gtcYi

Sat Oct 30 01:37:53 +0000 2010

Wow, another huge interface leap for @1Password for Chrome. Nice!

Sat Oct 30 01:39:49 +0000 2010

In contrast with last week's room in Sweden, the hotel room I'm currently in is bigger than my NYC apartment. Alas, only one night here.

Sat Oct 30 01:42:04 +0000 2010

Pondering costume for tomorrow night. Torn between "academic on sabbatical," "woman four weeks overdue for a haircut," and [+]

Sat Oct 30 01:54:09 +0000 2010

"hey, it's finally cool enough to wear my black leather jacket!" [-]

Sat Oct 30 01:54:25 +0000 2010

Replying to @CapitolClio

That's kinda what I'm thinking.

Sat Oct 30 01:56:31 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

It's actually a bit nicer now. They've implemented most of the FF/Safari features. A few issues yet, but it's pretty cool.

Sat Oct 30 03:41:32 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality and @brettbobley

Oh, drag. Sorry about that! I'm sure it'll be coming, though.

Sat Oct 30 03:43:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @cliotropic

Thanks for the offer; I have breakfast included with my room, & then am off. Next time, though!

Sat Oct 30 03:44:45 +0000 2010

Replying to @ibogost

I was thinking about the other day, sadly enough. Also, that the post-pushback video shows you how to store your carryon bags.

Sat Oct 30 13:37:09 +0000 2010

Goals for today: read. Sleep. Maybe run. That is pretty much all.

Sat Oct 30 14:12:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

Yes! My flight's at 2; I'll probably show up there about 12.30.

Sat Oct 30 14:18:48 +0000 2010

Just had my first chance to make the choice between the intrusive body scan & the intrusive pat down. Went for the scan. Enjoy the pics, TSA

Sat Oct 30 16:22:19 +0000 2010

I have run. I have obtained a serious haircut. That is all I intend to accomplish today; now back to my scheduled lolling about.

Sun Oct 31 18:36:27 +0000 2010

docs.title: 2010 11 01 tweets
docs.text:
RT @mediacommons: Call for participation in a forthcoming cluster on The New Everyday focused on the Tea Party: http://bit.ly/c8EUpA

Mon Nov 01 14:27:21 +0000 2010

FYI: a call from the subletters/catsitters beginning "I hate to be the bearer of bad news" is not an optimal turn of events.

Mon Nov 01 19:42:01 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

Small cat was allowed to escape last night. She was found but may be injured. Theyre taking her to the vet now. I'm trying to breathe.

Mon Nov 01 20:18:23 +0000 2010

Small cat apparently got in a fight while she was out; being held overnight for surgery tomorrow.

Mon Nov 01 22:27:29 +0000 2010

If I wind up being arrested for assault on my renters, I hope you'll consider testifying on my behalf.

Mon Nov 01 22:28:53 +0000 2010

There is a category of justified assault, right?

Mon Nov 01 22:29:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Appears to be just cleanup, though the description sounds serious enough. Grrr.

Mon Nov 01 23:29:07 +0000 2010

Thanks for the good thoughts, all. Small cat will certainly be fine, though I'm devastated not to be there with her.

Mon Nov 01 23:30:26 +0000 2010

Replying to @GeorgeOnline

Thanks. I may be giving you a call.

Tue Nov 02 01:55:21 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

Aww. Thanks!

Tue Nov 02 01:56:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Thanks! That helps a lot. I'm sure she'll be better in short order.

Tue Nov 02 01:58:56 +0000 2010

Replying to @nowviskie

Whoa.

Tue Nov 02 03:19:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

True. But a compelling enough image that I was overcome by the spirit of Keanu.

Tue Nov 02 03:41:10 +0000 2010

I #voted by mail three weeks ago - happily in a state in which the choices, if not necessarily the outcomes, are clear.

Tue Nov 02 13:43:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

As I am fond of saying, we perfectly well have seasons; they're just more subtle, and require more careful attention.

Tue Nov 02 14:30:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

No news yet; vet won't open for another hour or so. Surgery today; I'll call for updates in a bit.

Tue Nov 02 14:36:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @karikraus

Thanks so much, Kari; I'll definitely update as soon as I have more info.

Tue Nov 02 15:22:08 +0000 2010

Small cat just headed into surgery. Doc can't tell what got her; if it was another cat, it was a big one, he says. [+]

Tue Nov 02 16:41:16 +0000 2010

Signs of infection which did not clear up with antibiotics overnight. And they suspect there may be other wounds they haven't found yet. [+]

Tue Nov 02 16:41:59 +0000 2010

Grrr. [-]

Tue Nov 02 16:42:20 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Me too, trust me. Plus, major tenant throttling.

Tue Nov 02 16:45:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

You're the best. I'll let you know if that becomes necessary. Am employing mode "Fear of God" first.

Tue Nov 02 17:28:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

I'm pretty sure but no longer as positive as I was. 4 deep lacerations+2 punctures on side; serious infection on leg. I'm just sick.

Tue Nov 02 17:57:31 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Honestly? Makes me wonder if they lied to me about how long she was missing.

Tue Nov 02 19:12:52 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

It's pure negligence - they left the door open while taking out the trash. & said "it was just for a minute!" My cats [+]

Tue Nov 02 19:19:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

have never tried to get out, so I guess they thought they would never try? But how many cats can resist a wide-open door? [-]

Tue Nov 02 19:19:55 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I completely missed that your cat was sick. I'm glad s/he's doing better!

Tue Nov 02 19:30:35 +0000 2010

Small cat is out of surgery & doing ok. Several lacerations, a couple of drains, many sutures. Wounds fit the timeline, so I wasn't lied to.

Tue Nov 02 20:13:58 +0000 2010

They're keeping her again tonight for observation, & she'll probably go home tomorrow. Which means my tenants may survive.

Tue Nov 02 20:14:45 +0000 2010

Replying to @janaremy

Poor kitteh! My thoughts \(and small cat's meows\) are with her.

Tue Nov 02 23:01:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

Side and front, I think. I suspect it attacked and then clawed her as she ran past.

Tue Nov 02 23:04:16 +0000 2010

Just got another call from the vet. Small cat's labs had gotten lost last night, and they just now came in. She's in early kidney failure.

Wed Nov 03 01:21:56 +0000 2010

This is apparently the cause of the weight loss issues from earlier this year. They're keeping her until Friday.

Wed Nov 03 01:22:44 +0000 2010

I am way less happy about leaving her with the tenants than you might think.

Wed Nov 03 01:23:14 +0000 2010

The vet will walk the tenants through the new regime - drugs, new food, possible subcutaneous fluids. But... am thinking about heading back.

Wed Nov 03 01:24:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I'm going to hang tight for a day or so and hear how she's doing before I make a plan here. Will keep you posted.

Wed Nov 03 01:25:28 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

I would feel a lot better about that if I were there with her. I'm not at all sure how I'm going to handle this.

Wed Nov 03 01:45:50 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Possibly the latter; definitely not the former. Ugh.

Wed Nov 03 01:59:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

The surgery seems to have gone quite well. They put in a couple of drains and a bunch of sutures, but she seems to be doing fine.

Wed Nov 03 02:06:52 +0000 2010

Replying to @morganmundum

@sshreeves That's really good to know; thanks so much!

Wed Nov 03 02:21:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

She's coming up on 11. You are incredibly kind to offer!

Wed Nov 03 02:34:11 +0000 2010

This is shaping up to be a thoroughly depressing night.

Wed Nov 03 02:36:50 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Pretty much, yeah. It's like watching a train wreck you've seen coming for six months...

Wed Nov 03 02:47:50 +0000 2010

Breaking down and making coffee for the first time in months. \(A depressing night has given way to a pancake\-flat morning\.\)

Wed Nov 03 13:22:57 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

No updates yet. Will send as I have them!

Wed Nov 03 14:37:05 +0000 2010

Replying to @foundhistory

Yes, and not a moment too soon. \(In fact, at least a week too late\.\)

Wed Nov 03 14:49:57 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkgold

Aw, man. That would be tomorrow, as in Thursday, right? I made plans with my sister. Will see what I can do.

Wed Nov 03 20:05:30 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkgold

Yes, definitely, another time!

Wed Nov 03 20:34:05 +0000 2010

Was seriously regretting being out of cookies. Right up until I found the hidden bar of dark chocolate with a touch of sea salt...

Thu Nov 04 01:04:11 +0000 2010

Replying to @mamamusings

Woo-hoo!

Thu Nov 04 01:45:52 +0000 2010

Replying to @BGCDML

Hey, thanks - and back atcha!

Thu Nov 04 04:13:41 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

All I got out of the vet assistant yesterday was "she's fine." So I'm hoping the same thing.

Thu Nov 04 12:22:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen and @JenHoward

I think "free rider" = unis that require faculty to publish but don't have a press. Riding on labor of few uni presses.

Thu Nov 04 13:47:04 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

@JenHoward Perhaps so; I obvs don't have context. But key to the problem is uneven distribution of presses. If every uni had [+]

Thu Nov 04 13:50:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen and @JenHoward

its own publishing system, there would be no "free riding" involved. Everyone would be contributing. [-]

Thu Nov 04 13:50:57 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward and @dancohen

Exactly: unis w/o presses are tenuring faculty based on investments of few unis with presses.

Thu Nov 04 13:51:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

It's not an atom/bit problem: not about how the object of publishing gets distributed. It's about how it gets produced [+]

Thu Nov 04 13:57:50 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

and what it counts for. Unis w/o presses that require books for tenure are relying on investment/labor of unis w/presses. [+]

Thu Nov 04 13:58:55 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

And that's where the "free riding" comes in: tenuring your own faculty at the expense of another institution. [-]

Thu Nov 04 14:00:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

I agree, but that's not how they see it; they see it as other unis free-riding on their investment.

Thu Nov 04 14:03:22 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

Again, agreed, but original comment was about presses' sense that other unis are freeriding. I am explaining, not endorsing.

Thu Nov 04 14:04:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

I will say, however, that every uni that requires its faculty to publish must develop its own scholarly communication plan.

Thu Nov 04 14:06:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

If for no other reason than that the presses aren't going to be there \(or be available\) for much longer.

Thu Nov 04 14:07:04 +0000 2010

Replying to @sivavaid

Not a problem I identified; I'm only explicating the Esposito comment tweeted by @JenHoward.

Thu Nov 04 14:16:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @sivavaid

That said, it is a problem: every institution has got to think about its scholarly comm program. Might include consortial [+]

Thu Nov 04 14:18:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @sivavaid

arrangements with unis that do have presses. Should def include digital publishing. But every institution needs a plan.

Thu Nov 04 14:19:39 +0000 2010

Without solid schol comm plans on the part of ALL unis that require their faculty to publish, commercial pubs will continue to gain ground.

Thu Nov 04 14:23:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @aasher

Yes, precisely. But unis won't innovate in pub forms until they're required to take responsibility for it.

Thu Nov 04 14:25:45 +0000 2010

Giving serious thought to bagging today's brown-bag lunch meeting, and instead staying home and reading all day. #sabbatical #dammit

Thu Nov 04 14:43:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

Not sure what "constricting" would mean in this context. Such a plan should be flexible, but unis must take responsibility [+]

Thu Nov 04 15:41:40 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

for the dissemination as well as the production of knowledge. [-]

Thu Nov 04 15:42:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @BGCDML and @briancroxall

Agree w/you w/r/t design. The port could be on the bottom w/o interfering with lines...

Thu Nov 04 16:27:01 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

I always have to look, too. Super annoying. And many cords aren't *quite* long enough for free movement when plugged in.

Thu Nov 04 16:30:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

I think I missed a verb there. It'll *leave* someone out? Or something else?

Thu Nov 04 16:39:52 +0000 2010

Replying to @tanyaclement and @triproftri

But there are discussion groups - Media & Lit and Computer Studies in Lang & Lit. It's just that divisions are [+]

Thu Nov 04 17:47:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @tanyaclement and @triproftri

still nationality/century-bound. An outdated model for many scholars; there are plans to reconsider soon. [-]

Thu Nov 04 17:49:09 +0000 2010

Replying to @triproftri

I sure hope so!

Thu Nov 04 20:51:56 +0000 2010

I know there are several DailyMile users out there among my tweeps; are there any RunKeeper users?

Thu Nov 04 20:52:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

Excellent!

Thu Nov 04 20:58:09 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

I've heard this talk; I wouldn't hold your breath.

Thu Nov 04 21:39:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

o. m. g.

Thu Nov 04 21:48:22 +0000 2010

Replying to @karikraus and @mkirschenbaum

Never mind abusing its workforce and lying to its students while driving them into debt. For profit.

Thu Nov 04 21:52:40 +0000 2010

Replying to @karikraus

Just terrifying.

Thu Nov 04 21:59:18 +0000 2010

Replying to @mamamusings

I almost added "other than Liz" to the tweet! :)

Fri Nov 05 12:59:22 +0000 2010

Replying to @wynkenhimself

Libraries are increasingly negotiating persistent access for materials released during a digital subscription period.

Fri Nov 05 13:01:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

The kitty is "fine," according to the vet assistant. I'm fine, too, if a little battered by this week. And you? And yours?

Fri Nov 05 13:39:59 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

There's a little cognitive dissonance for you, right there.

Fri Nov 05 15:24:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

Indeed. Choose your ship wisely. \(And watch out for fog\.\)

Fri Nov 05 15:39:21 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Dude, I'm two hours late on the twitters, but I'm totally with you on the September thing.

Sat Nov 06 00:15:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I'm in for one. After that, I'm probably out for the day.

Sat Nov 06 17:40:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Perfect.

Sat Nov 06 17:41:35 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Finished revising one letter of rec; got a good way into revising a second.

Sat Nov 06 18:31:57 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

@voncookie @literarychica @newkidonthehall I'm in.

Sat Nov 06 18:40:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Read part of an article, responded to several bits of email backlog. Which feels better.

Sat Nov 06 19:18:41 +0000 2010

Un-freaking-believable: Small cat is FINE. As in, they rechecked her renal panel, and it's within normal limits.

Sat Nov 06 19:59:42 +0000 2010

They think she may just have been srsly dehydrated after the escape and fight.

Sat Nov 06 20:00:12 +0000 2010

I. Am. Stunned. It's the first time my phone has brought me good news in weeks.

Sat Nov 06 20:00:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @academicdave

Having a drink with @amandafrench \(whose phone is out juice; she says hi\) prior to the @sivavaid/@anya1anya smackdown at Baruch.

Thu Nov 18 21:54:39 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid-@anya1anya smackdown starts... NOW.

Thu Nov 18 23:16:04 +0000 2010

Hashtag for @sivavaid-@anya1anya is #blsci.

Thu Nov 18 23:16:57 +0000 2010

.@anya1anya's book was required reading for CUNY provosts' retreat. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:21:46 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid: Events like this are part of the value added that universities provide. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:25:27 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid: universities are a national treasure at a moment when all our other national institutions have let us down. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:27:41 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid listing the key aspects of contemporary culture that originated in universities: sendmail, stents, open-source, Google. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:29:30 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid defines education as exploration and transformation, when done right. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:30:51 +0000 2010

.@anya1anya: I don't really care about the future of the university; I care about the future of learners. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:32:21 +0000 2010

.@anya1anya: universities don't have a lock on innovation, and the university as an institution is becoming obsolete. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:34:10 +0000 2010

.@anya1anya: issue with institution is partly debt, partly that teaching methods haven't changed. How to foster informal learning? #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:36:27 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid taking issue with @anya1anya's assertion that teaching methods haven't changed. not fair to blame the secondary victim [+] #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:42:03 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid primary victims are definitely students, but faculty suffer along with them, esp in consumerist mentality in education. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:43:32 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid: Many ways to gain knowledge and skills; doesn't necessarily equate to a liberal education, which is a specialized thing. #blsci

Thu Nov 18 23:47:11 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid: my job is not to give a set of skills or quantity of information, but to help you see what you dont know; unquantifiable. #blsci

Fri Nov 19 00:01:50 +0000 2010

.@sivavaid: @anya1anya is the best evidence for the success of my argument \(about the importance of a liberal education\). #blsci

Fri Nov 19 00:03:32 +0000 2010

Very good question from audience about whether the benevolent dictator model of education might lead to more egalitarian outcomes #blsci [+]

Fri Nov 19 00:10:41 +0000 2010

than the market model of peer-to-peer education, which can subtlely exclude. #blsci

Fri Nov 19 00:11:32 +0000 2010

Great comment from the audience from a "College Unbound" student: the future university is a synthesis of these ideas. #blsci

Fri Nov 19 00:24:12 +0000 2010

the first time I got irritated that a business didn't have a web site with its hours & I realized I would have to call them to find out. [+]

Quick poll: If someone were to post an article draft online for comment, would you be more likely to read and comment: [+]

Thu Dec 02 15:34:55 +0000 2010

if that draft were a standard \(if very, very long\) blog post, or if it were in CommentPress? [-]

Thu Dec 02 15:35:05 +0000 2010

\(The above assumes both pre\-existing interest and available time, of course\.\)

Thu Dec 02 15:35:47 +0000 2010

Replying to @swarthmoreburke

Good point.

Thu Dec 02 15:39:45 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

I do take your point about the apparent complexity of CP. But I worry about the tl;dr factor of a very long column of text. [+]

Thu Dec 02 15:48:02 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

I'm also not sure that paragraph-level permalinks are less alienating/more helpful. But the standard blog post is certainly so.[-]

Thu Dec 02 15:49:18 +0000 2010

Replying to @BGCDML

The newest CP actually has a nice "general comments" feature; hasn't yet been fully tested to see if it gets that thorough response.

Thu Dec 02 15:50:04 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

No, I suppose it's not. I mostly was curious what the state of thinking about platform and discussion is right now. [+]

Thu Dec 02 15:58:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

But I think @swarthmoreburke is right: the key factor \(as always\) is social rather than technological - community not platform.[-]

Thu Dec 02 16:00:01 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen and @swarthmoreburke

Still plugging away at #reverb10, though a little behind and a little abbreviated. http://bit.ly/hrXusX

Fri Dec 17 18:19:21 +0000 2010

I've been experimenting with Echofon for the last several days and am really starting to like it. Contemplating making it my primary client.

Fri Dec 17 18:48:22 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

I'll be there.

Fri Dec 17 19:37:54 +0000 2010

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

Now *that* would be interesting.

Fri Dec 17 19:39:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @briancroxall

It was a screenshot you posted of the interface that made me check it out.

Fri Dec 17 19:40:05 +0000 2010

Replying to @ddchamberlain

I've only poked at Osfoora for iPad, but can't remember what it was that made me stop using it. Something, though.

Fri Dec 17 19:41:35 +0000 2010

Replying to @ddchamberlain

I'll try to remember.

Fri Dec 17 19:41:42 +0000 2010

The deal breaker on a Twitter client for me is automatic scrolling-to-top on update. Keep my place, please!

Fri Dec 17 19:46:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @jmittell

No, I haven't; I'll check it out!

Fri Dec 17 19:50:07 +0000 2010

Replying to @utmediaresearch

That's what I've used for the last year-plus, but there are things about it that frustrate me, & little sign of updates.

Fri Dec 17 20:58:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @utmediaresearch

Honestly, I wish Tweetie for Mac worked more like Tweetie for iPad.

Fri Dec 17 21:11:29 +0000 2010

Have fun, #thatcampva! Very sorry not to be there.

Sat Dec 18 14:54:25 +0000 2010

RT @maddow: 65-31. It's dead. #DADT.

Sat Dec 18 20:44:07 +0000 2010

It's fat! No, it's carbs! Wait, it's fat! No, it's carbs: http://lat.ms/esV8w3

Sat Dec 18 20:46:04 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 17: Lesson Learned http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-17-lesson-learned/

Sun Dec 19 04:26:05 +0000 2010

Thirty seconds ago there was something incredibly pressing I wanted to post. I have no idea what it was.

Sun Dec 19 04:28:59 +0000 2010

Replying to @brettbobley

You, sir, are a mind reader. Or have secretly funded a SUG for a mind-reading device and are holding out on the rest of us.

Sun Dec 19 04:43:43 +0000 2010

The good news is that we should make it out of Newark this evening. The bad news is that I'm not sure how much further we'll be able to go.

Sun Dec 19 21:16:03 +0000 2010

Have boarded flight from EWR to DUB. Have rebooked DUB-FRA-PRG on a direct Aer Lingus flight. Not a cheap proposition but at least it'll go.

Sun Dec 19 23:44:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @mariabustillos

I will need it!

Sun Dec 19 23:53:04 +0000 2010

Unbelievably enough, we made it to Prague half an hour early. Required buying yet another ticket, but we did it. Christmas may now begin.

Mon Dec 20 21:19:01 +0000 2010

After two nights of minimal sleep, 4 hours seems utterly insufficient. And yet. I'm awake!

Tue Dec 21 03:29:00 +0000 2010

Replying to @JenHoward

Oh, no! I'm so sorry to hear that, Jen!

Tue Dec 21 03:46:02 +0000 2010

New post: A Brief Technical Aside http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/a-brief-technical-aside/

Tue Dec 21 04:41:00 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 18: Try http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-18-try/

RT @mediacommons: Announcing online discussion of Ch6 of Tom Streeter's brilliant The Net Effect: Romanticism, Capitalism & the Internet ...

Tue Dec 21 21:05:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I did indeed! The real thing is even more worth seeing.

Tue Dec 21 21:06:25 +0000 2010

Morning, folks.

Wed Dec 22 05:53:56 +0000 2010

Let's see: 2hrs sleep Saturday night; 3ish hrs dozing on planes Sunday; 4hrs sleep Monday night. Managed 5hrs last night. Better, at least.

Wed Dec 22 05:55:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Definitely morning here. 8 am, in fact. How's life, what, 9 hours in the past?

Wed Dec 22 07:01:04 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

You have clearly not seen the sky here. Total cloud cover with intermittent snow. Europe's fairly well blanketed, in fact.

Wed Dec 22 07:09:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

That seems appropriate. I hope there's some sleep to go along with it.

Wed Dec 22 07:11:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Yeeks. Then sleep? On the ferry? Once you're home? Sometime?

Wed Dec 22 07:14:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I am becoming tired on your behalf. Good luck with it!

Wed Dec 22 07:17:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

East enough to fuck up a travel day. The diff is that eastern Europe has what they call "snow removal equipment." Amazing invention.

Wed Dec 22 07:19:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

How much rain have you guys gotten this week, anyhow?

Wed Dec 22 07:19:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

That sounds like a celebration, indeed.

Wed Dec 22 07:38:45 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

An air mattress may be a good short-term investment. Bought one when I moved to SoCal; has since come in handy.

Wed Dec 22 07:43:19 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Should have known. :)

Wed Dec 22 07:44:02 +0000 2010

Thanks to everyone who commented on my Infinite Summer article; your input was enormously helpful as I revised!

Wed Dec 22 09:01:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Someday I'll tell you about my deep relationship with the writing vacation. It's produced some cool stuff \(plus plenty of fun\).

Wed Dec 22 09:12:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

In fact, I wrote the essay that was the seed of both MediaCommons & PlannedObs on such a vacation 5yrs ago. http://bit.ly/fyUr3V

Wed Dec 22 09:18:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

There's something to be said for a degree of wandering around in a daze.

Wed Dec 22 09:23:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

We were just saying yesterday that connectivity has gotten better and better as long as we've been doing this, but someone [+]

Wed Dec 22 09:36:13 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

has GOT to come up with an affordable international data roaming plan already. [-]

Wed Dec 22 09:36:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Yeah, the iPhone is nicely global but AT&T... well, 'nuff said.

Wed Dec 22 10:05:18 +0000 2010

This has been a ludicrously productive morning. I've more than earned this evening's Pilsner Urquells.

Wed Dec 22 10:06:40 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 20: Beyond Avoidance http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-20-beyond-avoidance/

Wed Dec 22 10:32:45 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Unthwarting ourselves required purchasing a last-second ticket from DUB to PRG and cancelling the DUB-FRA-PRG flight we already had.

Wed Dec 22 15:36:51 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

But we were Determined, not least because the hotel in PRG was prepaid...

Wed Dec 22 15:37:32 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Whoa.

Wed Dec 22 15:37:47 +0000 2010

In case you missed it yesterday...

Wed Dec 22 15:43:03 +0000 2010

We're happy to announce an online discussion of Ch6 of Tom Streeter's brilliant The Net Effect at MediaCommons: http://bit.ly/fc4428

Wed Dec 22 15:44:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Children, schmildren. Lazy little buggers should get a job.

Wed Dec 22 15:48:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Have I told you lately that you rock? Especially for a suit. :)

Wed Dec 22 15:50:06 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

That is a major issue, indeed. It's a lot easier for lightweight conferences to break even.

Wed Dec 22 15:54:30 +0000 2010

Replying to @ibogost and @mlaconvention

You joke, but the last couple of MLAs have been among my favorite conference experiences.

Wed Dec 22 16:02:24 +0000 2010

Replying to @ibogost and @mlaconvention

A fantastic argument for separating the convention from the job market, that.

Wed Dec 22 16:06:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Good lord. Get to work on that ark already!

Wed Dec 22 16:34:37 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Here's hoping you get to stay in there all day!

Wed Dec 22 16:41:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Killer day. Ludicrously productive, with a good run to boot. Now there shall be beer.

Wed Dec 22 16:51:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Last I heard, doing swell. Honestly, I'd like to know more.

Wed Dec 22 16:52:16 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

No, won't be vehicular or have time enough, alas. Plus I don't really want to see what the tenants have done to the condo.

Wed Dec 22 16:59:55 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Yeah, he's writing up a storm!

Wed Dec 22 17:00:10 +0000 2010

This, I will say, has been a seriously kick-ass day.

Wed Dec 22 20:50:37 +0000 2010

Morning, folks.

Thu Dec 23 06:42:37 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 21: Future Self http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-21-future-self/

Thu Dec 23 07:02:47 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 22: Travel http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-22-travel/

Thu Dec 23 07:46:27 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 23: New Name http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-23-new-name/

Thu Dec 23 08:31:29 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I hope you got some sleep - I was worried when I saw that you'd hit the wall last night!

Thu Dec 23 08:42:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Thu Dec 23 08:50:01 +0000 2010

Today did not kick quite as much ass as yesterday did, but it was still pretty awesome, on the whole.

Thu Dec 23 15:39:21 +0000 2010

Replying to @noradio

Thu Dec 23 23:40:14 +0000 2010

Morning, folks.

Fri Dec 24 06:49:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Fri Dec 24 07:09:15 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 24: Everything's OK http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-24-everythings-ok/

Fri Dec 24 07:33:02 +0000 2010

Fri Dec 24 07:56:10 +0000 2010

Need QTPro to rotate; only have that on my desktop computers. Grrr.

Fri Dec 24 07:56:42 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

Safe flying, Vika - and then safe driving after that!

Fri Dec 24 10:13:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Fri Dec 24 15:02:32 +0000 2010

Among the things we saw last night: http://bit.ly/eRreib

Fri Dec 24 15:33:41 +0000 2010

Fri Dec 24 15:34:05 +0000 2010

New post: Among the Things We Saw Last Night http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/among-the-things-we-saw-last-night/

Fri Dec 24 16:36:25 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Sat Dec 25 07:27:15 +0000 2010

Sat Dec 25 07:28:14 +0000 2010

Replying to @mmwwah

Ugh, so sorry to hear about Kev's Christmas - but happy you're home. I hope the rain has stopped!

Sat Dec 25 07:38:45 +0000 2010

New post: Christmas Eve in Prague http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/christmas-eve-in-prague/

Sat Dec 25 08:39:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

Sat Dec 25 08:40:00 +0000 2010

Hey, you're allowed to tweet again. Enjoy the downtime, and safe driving tomorrow. Um, today? You know.

Sat Dec 25 08:47:45 +0000 2010

Sat Dec 25 15:09:43 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 25: Photo http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-25-photo/

Sat Dec 25 15:27:45 +0000 2010

You know what's awesome? When you gripe on Twitter about a book's lack of Kindleness, get a response from the ed, and poof: Kindle edition.

Sat Dec 25 17:14:59 +0000 2010

Which is to say: thanks, @gkiely! \(Alan Liu's The Laws of Cool, now available in a Kindle edition\.\)

Sat Dec 25 17:16:59 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Oh, no! Go get checked out!

Sat Dec 25 17:19:58 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Ugh, I get that. But promise me you'll go on Monday if you're not better...

Sat Dec 25 18:58:34 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

I take it @veek is driving. :)

Sat Dec 25 22:49:17 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

*sigh* I'm on your side one this one. \(Though I'm happy to see the wasabi pea win ascendancy\.\)

Sat Dec 25 22:50:54 +0000 2010

Alright, folks. It was a fantastic Christmas; I hope you had a great one, too.

Sat Dec 25 23:11:15 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

Yay! I hope things continue so fabulously. \(And that you win the no\-tweeting\-while\-driving battle\.\)

Sun Dec 26 07:49:03 +0000 2010

Morning, folks. A good hour-plus later than usual here; we actually SLEPT IN. It's a Boxing Day miracle!

Sun Dec 26 07:49:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @newkidonthehall

My niece was reading those when I saw her last week, and just raving about them. Glad to have confirmation!

Sun Dec 26 09:27:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @newkidonthehall

I've stayed far from the Twilight series, so this is another good bit of endorsement. :)

Sun Dec 26 09:32:56 +0000 2010

New post: Soundtrack http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/soundtrack/

Sun Dec 26 13:28:02 +0000 2010

Replying to @ayjay

Actually, Echofon does better than Tweetie for Mac - shows convs backward & forward in time.

Sun Dec 26 17:44:40 +0000 2010

Replying to @ayjay

Yeah, I miss some of Tweetie's polish, though I actually like the drawer. What I really want is a desktop version of Tweetie 4 iPad.

Sun Dec 26 17:51:33 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

How are you feeling today? Any better?

Sun Dec 26 18:41:49 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Ugh - I'm so sorry to hear that, on all counts. I hope you're getting lots of fluids and rest...

Sun Dec 26 19:30:39 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

Indeed. Just make sure you're making with the fluids and Tylenol too

Sun Dec 26 19:33:46 +0000 2010

Replying to @ayjay

I find I have to tell my Python scripts to "open with..." Python Launcher; otherwise, the Mac seems to assume I want to edit them.

Sun Dec 26 20:04:08 +0000 2010

Replying to @ayjay

Heh. The same Python scripts I was tinkering with. Except I wanted mine in ePub.

Sun Dec 26 20:04:43 +0000 2010

Morning, folks.

Mon Dec 27 05:30:43 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Good night! Glad you two are doing well - safe driving tomorrow.

Mon Dec 27 05:39:17 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 26: Soul Food http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-26-soul-food/

Mon Dec 27 05:56:31 +0000 2010

Replying to @iantrevor

I haven't taught it in a while, alas. I've thought about possible switches, but am still fairly attracted to those four.

Mon Dec 27 20:22:48 +0000 2010

Replying to @iantrevor

My pleasure!

Mon Dec 27 21:12:52 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Woo-hoo!

Tue Dec 28 05:59:10 +0000 2010

Replying to @veek

Yay!

Tue Dec 28 06:07:09 +0000 2010

Oh, yeah: morning, folks.

Tue Dec 28 06:07:20 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 27: Ordinary Joy http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-27-ordinary-joy/

Tue Dec 28 06:26:39 +0000 2010

There's an irony of sorts in publishing this one in the middle of the night. I'll have to reannounce when folks are awake. But... [+]

Tue Dec 28 07:59:04 +0000 2010

New post: On the Scholarly Press, the Manual of Style, and Intellectual Property. http://bit.ly/gulBRU [-]

Tue Dec 28 07:59:50 +0000 2010

A quick self-RT for those of you who were \(sensibly\) asleep six hours ago... [+]

Tue Dec 28 14:22:03 +0000 2010

New post: On the Scholarly Press, the Manual of Style, and Intellectual Property. http://bit.ly/gulBRU

Tue Dec 28 14:22:36 +0000 2010

Replying to @dancohen

I like that. "Hey, here's what you missed while you were out, Australia!"

Tue Dec 28 14:25:27 +0000 2010

Replying to @sshreeves

That's very interesting, esp since use of publisher PDF is one of the things the style manual seems worried about.

Tue Dec 28 14:32:21 +0000 2010

@jcmeloni Hey, congrats. Good luck with all of it! I'll look forward to catching up in LA.

Tue Dec 28 21:26:11 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 28: Achieve http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-28-achieve/

Wed Dec 29 08:24:28 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 29: Defining Moment http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-29-defining-moment/

Wed Dec 29 08:59:01 +0000 2010

Hey, @mlaconvention - how are you feeling?

Wed Dec 29 21:00:28 +0000 2010

Replying to @mlaconvention

That's great, I guess! And the fever? Gone, I hope?

Wed Dec 29 21:44:11 +0000 2010

Boy, the stuff you people get into while I'm sleeping.

Thu Dec 30 09:04:40 +0000 2010

Oh yeah: morning, folks.

Thu Dec 30 09:04:53 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Are you still on the east coast?

Thu Dec 30 09:10:25 +0000 2010

Replying to @jcmeloni

Oh, hey; I see you merged my DUB checking.

Thu Dec 30 09:11:34 +0000 2010

@jcmeloni check-in, that is.

Thu Dec 30 09:11:46 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 30: Gift http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-30-gift/

Replying to @jcmeloni

Sad indeed. By the time I got a signal we were in the cab & the real site wdn't come up. I'll get the note when I'm outbound, tho!

Thu Dec 30 12:13:55 +0000 2010

Replying to @samplereality

Fri Dec 31 08:13:39 +0000 2010

Morning, folks.

Fri Dec 31 08:13:53 +0000 2010

New post: #reverb10, day 31: Core Story http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/reverb10-day-31-core-story/

Fri Dec 31 09:38:23 +0000 2010

Replying to @HASTAC

Late NYE lunch, with a pint of Harp. I love this place.

The definition of old: sitting at the bar at 9.30 on NYE and struggling to stay awake.

docs.title: 2011 01 01 tweets
docs.text:
The one day that everyone was still awake when I'd normally have gotten up, I slept until 9. Ah well - happy new year, all

Sat Jan 01 09:31:36 +0000 2011

I have just spent a very pleasant hour reorganizing my Chrome bookmarks. Now I think I'll read a novel. Ah, holidays.

Sat Jan 01 13:04:32 +0000 2011

Replying to @jcmeloni

Hey, happy new year. I hope it's starting well for you!

Sat Jan 01 13:37:34 +0000 2011

New post: Twenty-Eleven http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/twenty-eleven/

Sat Jan 01 13:41:05 +0000 2011

2011 ate my blog archives. Not really, but it apparently hosed the WP Collapsing Archives plugin; all previous years are now inside 2011.

Sat Jan 01 13:48:13 +0000 2011

I take it back; it's not the Collapsible Archives plugin's fault. It looks like WP. I've switched plugins but have the same problem.

Sat Jan 01 13:57:16 +0000 2011

Looks like there's yet another WP release that'll hit soon; plugin pages describe compatibility with WP3.1.

Sat Jan 01 13:58:03 +0000 2011

Never mind; was a collapsing archives problem after all, coupled with a cache that wouldn't clear. All's well with new plugin.

Sat Jan 01 14:07:13 +0000 2011

Replying to @jcmeloni

I love that this is all stuff that falls into the category of "important enough to fit into the car for the crosscountry drive."

Sat Jan 01 15:51:28 +0000 2011

Replying to @jcmeloni

That sounds about right to me.

Sat Jan 01 15:54:37 +0000 2011

Hey, @goodreads doesn't block non-US IP addresses, does it? I can't get the site to load, but http://bit.ly/e1OaB6 says it's just me...

Sun Jan 02 11:25:28 +0000 2011

Replying to @finnarne

Hmm. Maybe it's the ISP here in Dublin. Thanks!

Sun Jan 02 11:32:37 +0000 2011

Replying to @lddurbin

Hmm. I'm in Dublin. Maybe it's an ISP thing?

Sun Jan 02 11:45:36 +0000 2011

Replying to @lddurbin

Interesting. I never get a response, in any browser.

Sun Jan 02 11:48:01 +0000 2011

Replying to @nowviskie

Yikes! Please feel better soon!

Sun Jan 02 14:06:38 +0000 2011

Replying to @nowviskie

There's also Friday morning, of course. The good news is that the time zone should work in your favor.

Sun Jan 02 14:08:25 +0000 2011

Morning, folks.

Mon Jan 03 06:40:14 +0000 2011

New post: Homeward Bound, At Least Sorta http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/homeward-bound-at-least-sorta/

Mon Jan 03 10:01:17 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention

NO! And I'm bummed about it. I have seen pictures though, and they both look good.

Mon Jan 03 12:06:20 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention

\(The pictures, though\.\.\. I'm trying not to focus too much on the questions they raise\. Like "where's my dining room table?"\)

Mon Jan 03 12:07:05 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention

I'm not all that worried about it. Mostly just curious about its whereabouts. It's a pretty big table & wd usu be in the pix.

Mon Jan 03 12:17:54 +0000 2011

Hey, @jcmeloni: you would not BELIEVE what I'm about to drink.

Mon Jan 03 15:58:24 +0000 2011

Replying to @jcmeloni

There was adulteration. It's pretty good!

Mon Jan 03 16:29:19 +0000 2011

Replying to @nowviskie

Oh no! Feel better, Bethany!

Mon Jan 03 17:24:15 +0000 2011

Replying to @jcmeloni

Woo-hoo! Congrats, at last!

Mon Jan 03 21:23:43 +0000 2011

Morning, folks. About to start the long journey: DUB-EWR-LAX-#MLA11. See some of you there.

Tue Jan 04 06:10:49 +0000 2011

Replying to @triproftri

Likewise!

Tue Jan 04 06:11:34 +0000 2011

Replying to @jcmeloni

Thanks & will do!

Tue Jan 04 06:27:49 +0000 2011

Replying to @nowviskie

Wow, you're awake early. Regular insomnia or pneumomnia?

Tue Jan 04 09:29:26 +0000 2011

Replying to @nowviskie

Ugh - I'm so sorry. I hope the meds kick in quickly, and that all of you are well soonest!

Tue Jan 04 10:01:46 +0000 2011

New post: Nothing to Be Done http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/nothing-to-be-done/

Tue Jan 04 10:02:26 +0000 2011

EWR.

Tue Jan 04 17:40:49 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlmcgill

No, 1055 in about 3 hrs. Safe travels!

Tue Jan 04 18:04:40 +0000 2011

Will be arriving at LAX for #mla11 at 7.30pm; anybody else showing up around then and want to share a cab?

Tue Jan 04 18:24:49 +0000 2011

On plane for LAX and #mla11. Sneaking suspicion that there's a nap in my future.

Tue Jan 04 20:47:05 +0000 2011

Attempting to make a correction to a blog post via the WP mobile app \(bc the iPhone is my only connection\) hosed all the formatting. Thanks!

Tue Jan 04 21:03:38 +0000 2011

Well, that post will be borked for six hours, as I can't fix it until I can connect with the laptop.

Tue Jan 04 21:16:43 +0000 2011

LAX.

Wed Jan 05 03:27:29 +0000 2011

Srsly annoyed to discover that while Marriott hotels are Boingo hotspots, the JW Marriott is not. [+]

Wed Jan 05 04:20:13 +0000 2011

So now the dance of the ridiculously expensive hotel wifi begins. [-]

Wed Jan 05 04:20:49 +0000 2011

Replying to @jsench

Yup. There will be wifi at the conf, but in room it's $$.

Wed Jan 05 04:22:15 +0000 2011

Replying to @mmwwah

$12.95/day.

Wed Jan 05 04:37:25 +0000 2011

Replying to @jcmeloni

You are SO RIGHT.

Wed Jan 05 04:37:39 +0000 2011

Time to commit some alterations to the phone, I think.

Wed Jan 05 04:37:58 +0000 2011

Replying to @nowviskie

I'm so sorry, Bethany! It's the right choice, though. I hope you start feeling better soon.

Wed Jan 05 13:30:38 +0000 2011

Replying to @nowviskie

That would be fabulous; it would be great to have your voice present. Will get someone to keep an eye on the Twitter stream, too.

Wed Jan 05 13:33:58 +0000 2011

Replying to @nancybaym

Have had several friends whose email has been hacked "send" such messages. Almost certainly not true, but I can see why it works!

Wed Jan 05 13:47:56 +0000 2011

Replying to @BryanAlexander

Actually, the connectivity has been pretty good so far, but then the MLA masses have not yet arrived...

Wed Jan 05 14:17:42 +0000 2011

Replying to @BryanAlexander

Both of the hotels I stayed at in Europe, however, were a disaster of exactly that variety. Insane prices and awful connex.

Wed Jan 05 14:18:23 +0000 2011

Yo, #MLA11 folks: this conference uses both the Marriott and the JW Marriott hotels. If you want people to meet in the JW, please be clear!

Wed Jan 05 15:30:13 +0000 2011

New post: <rant> http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/rant/

Wed Feb 02 17:12:30 +0000 2011

Replying to @BGCDML

I've got little sympathy for Amazon \(and zero for Sony\), but taking 100% of the profit margin on book sales from them makes [+]

Wed Feb 02 17:13:37 +0000 2011

Replying to @BGCDML

the device way more locked-down than I'm willing to live with. [-]

Wed Feb 02 17:14:19 +0000 2011

At the NYU Humanities Initiative to hear @dancohen & Alexander Provan on digital scholarly communications.

Thu Apr 07 22:02:36 +0000 2011

.@dancohen beginning "Scholarly Communication the Web Way" by discussing Paleofuture.

Thu Apr 07 22:09:25 +0000 2011

.@dancohen interested in tracking folks who are unsatisfied with conventional ways of doing scholarly work, and how they're working around.

Thu Apr 07 22:12:08 +0000 2011

Layer tennis, digital journals as examples of work that can't be done in print. Desire for direct communication, interactivity. @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:13:36 +0000 2011

What might we do if we had this kind of DIY work take place in the academy? What would academic layer tennis look like? @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:14:49 +0000 2011

Part of problem: AAUP survey a year ago about digital publishing strategies stuck in conventional forms. Online work as "companion" sites.

Thu Apr 07 22:17:04 +0000 2011

Need to think about new, unconventional forms as actual scholarly work, not companions to "real" work. @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:17:56 +0000 2011

Examples of scholarly blogs driving conversation within a field. Shout out to @MediaCommons and The New Everyday. @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:18:54 +0000 2011

First question that gets raised: what about review? It's the wild west! @dancohen says this is a misunderstanding of how review works online

Thu Apr 07 22:19:48 +0000 2011

Online review is "recursive review" - cycles of commenting that are often more critical than traditional blind peer review. @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:20:36 +0000 2011

When you're out there on the open web, different but equally critical form of reviewing takes place recursively. @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:22:06 +0000 2011

Replying to @mamamusings

I was actually asked to tweet. You may want to unfollow or mute for the next hour. Sorry about that! :)

Thu Apr 07 22:23:25 +0000 2011

Aggregation and curation as key aspect of sorting out most important material for a community at any moment. @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:25:53 +0000 2011

Replying to @mamamusings

I'm sorry to overwhelm your stream! I'll be as judicious as possible.

Thu Apr 07 22:26:25 +0000 2011

Examples of blog aggregation and curation: PLoS Blogs, The Browser, Digital Humanities Now. @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:27:49 +0000 2011

Thoughts don't come in either 8K or 100K words; need to experiment with the full range of sizes of scholarship. See Tyler Cowen. @dancohen

Thu Apr 07 22:30:20 +0000 2011

.@dancohen showing CIBER UCL survey of importance attached to modes of scholarly communication; users of social media have radically +

Thu Apr 07 22:33:31 +0000 2011

different senses of the significance of those forms. This is with 7% of scholars using \(or 1991 email usage levels\). What will happen when +

Thu Apr 07 22:34:52 +0000 2011

we reach 50% usage? What experimentation will become possible? -

Thu Apr 07 22:35:30 +0000 2011

CIBER survey mentioned by @dancohen: http://www.ucl.ac.uk/infostudies/research/ciber/social-media-report.pdf, see esp. Figure 31.

Alexander Provan of Triple Canopy discussing the publication's use of digital affordances and genealogy in zines & arts magazines.

Thu Apr 07 22:56:03 +0000 2011

Anna McCarthy opens discussion by asking Provan about choice not to have comments on Triple Canopy. Provan sees value in controlled space.

docs.text:
Replying to @wgthomas3

Thank you! I'm quite excited about it.

Just back from fantastic brunch at the Brooklyn home of some old friends. I could once eat brunch without needing a nap after, but no more.

Folks, do you remember which study it was that ranked the reasons scholars choose their publication venues? \(Audience, prestige, etc\.\)

Sun May 01 22:46:09 +0000 2011

**brain explodes**

Mon May 02 00:13:21 +0000 2011

Replying to @shanakimball

$8385 for a departmental license \(up to 10 users in one office\)!

Mon May 02 00:14:53 +0000 2011

Boy, do I stink at final sentences.

Mon May 02 02:18:12 +0000 2011

Replying to @Ed_Raso

Maybe that is how I should end the article!

Mon May 02 02:22:26 +0000 2011

Any bets on what we're not going to be allowed to carry on airplanes tomorrow? #nationalsecurityannouncement

Mon May 02 02:23:41 +0000 2011

Okay, I have now turned on my television for the first time since the Oscars. Please don't make me listed to Wolf Blitzer for long.

Mon May 02 02:29:06 +0000 2011

Listen, that is. But you get the point.

Mon May 02 02:29:30 +0000 2011

Replying to @surlyF

No kidding.

Mon May 02 02:30:32 +0000 2011

Oy, with the speculating. I wouldn't want to speculate, but there's been a lot of speculation. As has been widely speculated.

Mon May 02 02:31:35 +0000 2011

Replying to @jmittell

I know, right. The set in my apt this year is awful enough I'd rather download & watch on my computer.

Mon May 02 02:32:27 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention

I still have very fond memories of Wolf from Gulf War I. But he's a shadow of that rugged former self, alas.

Mon May 02 02:33:30 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention

Oh, man, you and me both.

Mon May 02 02:34:54 +0000 2011

The White House is saying that I have behaved SO responsibly by not speculating. Other Twitterers are wildly speculating, but not me.

Mon May 02 02:37:45 +0000 2011

Replying to @surlyF

As long as I have multiple sources to go with this. The world will know very soon.

Mon May 02 02:39:03 +0000 2011

John King, on the other hand, not so much afraid of the speculating. Poor Wolf!

Mon May 02 02:44:28 +0000 2011

Replying to @surlyF

So curious about the choice to let John King say it and keep Wolf Blitzer pure...

Mon May 02 02:45:01 +0000 2011

And now Wolf gets to say it out loud? What's that all about?

Mon May 02 02:45:52 +0000 2011

Yeah, I'm not sure I'm going to remember that I was sitting in front of my computer when John King announced that Osama bin Laden was dead.

Mon May 02 02:47:44 +0000 2011

Wolf apparently pretty upset about having his evening interrupted.

Mon May 02 02:50:21 +0000 2011

Replying to @budtheteacher

You are not kidding.

Mon May 02 02:50:34 +0000 2011

Replying to @jeanburgess

I know, right. A little spoiler alert might have been nice.

Mon May 02 02:51:08 +0000 2011

Poor Barack. He's now going to come in and say "look, forget it. It was gonna be a surprise, but it's ruined now."

Mon May 02 02:53:24 +0000 2011

Ah, Wolf. They must already be plotting retaliation -- because CNN must have something to freak us out about.

Mon May 02 02:55:14 +0000 2011

So is this a lot of Blackberry product placement on CNN, or what?

Mon May 02 03:00:40 +0000 2011

Replying to @jeanburgess

Indeed.

Mon May 02 03:02:17 +0000 2011

Actionable: John King, I do not think that word means exactly what you think it means.

Mon May 02 03:07:27 +0000 2011

CNN may be infuriating, but at least they're surreal.

Mon May 02 03:08:31 +0000 2011

Replying to @hollykruse

This is true.

Mon May 02 03:09:07 +0000 2011

Replying to @hollykruse

True. And I should probably switch. But it's like watching a slow-motion car crash. I'm horrified, but I can't quite turn away.

Mon May 02 03:12:19 +0000 2011

RT @McLemee: It sure seems like Obama's job as secret Muslim operative imposing Sharia law on the US just got a whole lot harder.

Mon May 02 03:12:30 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention

Indeed. He needs a much better stage manager.

Mon May 02 03:21:21 +0000 2011

Replying to @jasonrhody and @mlaconvention

Absolutely - but those contacts should have happened before the announcement. Really badly mistimed.

Mon May 02 03:24:46 +0000 2011

Mon May 02 03:25:31 +0000 2011

Replying to @jasonrhody and @mlaconvention

Wolf had some weird story about Obama being out somewhere this morning and getting called back to the WH...

Mon May 02 03:26:29 +0000 2011

Dude, if the New York Times has already published it, this announcement has taken too long. http://nyti.ms/ldiAZg

Mon May 02 03:28:06 +0000 2011

Apparently the Fox News crawl says that "Obama Bin Laden" is dead. Nice.

Mon May 02 03:33:11 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention

Friend posted a shot of it on FB.

Mon May 02 03:34:15 +0000 2011

RT @acavender: I can't say I'm sorry to see him gone. But celebration doesn't sit right either. A necessary evil may be the best descrip ...

Mon May 02 03:39:27 +0000 2011

RT @CapitolClio: Thank you Mr. President for not turning announcement into a xenophobic pep rally.

Mon May 02 03:46:18 +0000 2011

Mon May 02 03:49:34 +0000 2011

Replying to @jeanburgess

Me too.

Mon May 02 03:51:05 +0000 2011

Okay, horrible television turned off again. Feeling better already.

Mon May 02 03:52:21 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention and @cjprender

Oy. I had to shut it off about 5 mins ago.

Mon May 02 03:59:00 +0000 2011

You know, I never did finish writing that last sentence. Dammit.

Mon May 02 04:06:05 +0000 2011

Friend of mine standing in an airport not long after 9/11, next to a guy staring at news reports showing ground zero. Guy shook +

Mon May 02 04:20:26 +0000 2011

Replying to @roxieblog

his head and said "First Dale [Earnhardt], and now this."

Mon May 02 04:21:14 +0000 2011

Mon May 02 04:22:36 +0000 2011

Alright folks. I do have the MLA Program Committee starting tomorrow at 9, so I'm off to force myself to sleep.

Mon May 02 04:29:21 +0000 2011

Replying to @jasonaboyd

Thanks! I'm looking forward to getting started!

Mon May 02 13:42:47 +0000 2011

Tue May 03 22:26:22 +0000 2011

Replying to @moncia

Ooh, I hadn't thought of it that way!

Tue May 03 22:33:16 +0000 2011

Replying to @mlaconvention
