Tue Jun 25 21:41:14 +0000 2013

Instant tears: Equal protection, not states’ rights. #scotus #doma

Wed Jun 26 14:07:14 +0000 2013

From @SCOTUSblog: “DOMA is unconstitutional as a deprivation of the equal liberty of persons that is protected by the Fifth Amendment.”

Wed Jun 26 14:09:15 +0000 2013

Indeed. // RT @katinalynn: Overjoyed about DOMA. Heartsick about VRA. What a crazy couple of days.

Wed Jun 26 14:28:50 +0000 2013

Replying to @surlyF

The ruling is not just that SCOTUS doesn’t have standing, it’s that the 9th didn’t have standing.

Wed Jun 26 14:32:52 +0000 2013

Replying to @surlyF

At least if I’m following the logic, which is not a cinch.

Wed Jun 26 14:33:21 +0000 2013

Replying to @JMarkOckerbloom and @surlyF

Yes, that.

Wed Jun 26 14:36:11 +0000 2013

Replying to @nicolaz and @kelleyeskridge

Happy anniversary!

Wed Jun 26 14:59:05 +0000 2013

Replying to @ernestopriego

Sunday, noonish. Very much looking forward!

Wed Jun 26 15:47:51 +0000 2013

Me too! // RT @ernestopriego: Really looking forward to the #OpenAccess monographs in HSS conference @britishlibrary https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/oabooksconf/OAbooksprogramme/

Thu Jun 27 09:55:56 +0000 2013

RT @gwenifill: This. MT @agolis: Within 24 hrs of VRA strike down, 6 of the 9 affected states are pushing new voter ID laws: http://t.co/w…

Thu Jun 27 12:38:20 +0000 2013

Replying to @tezcatlipoca

My naming system started when I got a 2nd monitor at work & named the computer “starbase.” My home desktop became “homebase.”+

Thu Jun 27 12:50:51 +0000 2013

Replying to @tezcatlipoca

My laptop became “voyager.” And so when I got my iPhone it was “rover.”

Thu Jun 27 12:51:38 +0000 2013

RT @lkonstan: Check out @LAReviewofBooks's "Distant Reading" symposium, featuring @kfitz, @JimEnglishPenn, & Alexander Galloway. http://t.c…

Thu Jun 27 13:47:47 +0000 2013

Replying to @veek

Evidence is all anecdotal, as pubs don’t much share sales info. Also, hard to know what sales would have been otherwise. +

Thu Jun 27 14:33:41 +0000 2013

Replying to @veek

That said, sales of PO were a good bit higher than I think NYUP expected, and I’ve heard the same from other authors/presses.

Thu Jun 27 14:34:10 +0000 2013

Replying to @veek

I haven’t heard that about books. I have heard claims that going OA with journal articles has resulted in declining subscriptions.

Thu Jun 27 14:36:42 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley and @sramsay

I’m going to assume that you checked that tweet and the baggage handlers have only just found it.

Thu Jun 27 21:05:33 +0000 2013

To all my friends who are currently moving \(e\.g\., @msbonn @ayjay @xina, etc\), oh, I feel ya. Sending good vibes and fast friendly movers.

Thu Jun 27 21:29:11 +0000 2013

Replying to @katinalynn and @mkgold

Mind. Blown.

Thu Jun 27 22:48:23 +0000 2013

How am I only now figuring out that NYU is an eduroam member?

Fri Jun 28 07:35:55 +0000 2013

Replying to @nancybaym and @maximolly

Now I feel like I fell down on the job: I’ve been in at least one room with both of you! Glad you’ve finally met.

Fri Jun 28 13:55:05 +0000 2013

Replying to @nancybaym and @maximolly

Apparently! I was clearly not thinking.

Fri Jun 28 13:57:51 +0000 2013

RT @Jisc: Free 2 day conference next week at @britishlibrary - Open Access Monographs in Humanities & Social Sciences http://t.co/cp0FeaNJN…

Fri Jun 28 14:06:07 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall

No one will miss “of.”

Fri Jun 28 14:45:26 +0000 2013

Headed back in for day 2 of Cultures of Obsolescence, including my own talk first thing: http://www.uni-goettingen.de/de/419609.html

Sat Jun 29 06:40:56 +0000 2013

Afterward, quick dinner and a train to Frankfurt. Tomorrow morning, a flight to London. Monday & Tuesday, #OAbooks: https://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/oabooksconf/OAbooksprogramme/

Sat Jun 29 06:42:34 +0000 2013

Wednesday, a flight to Prague, with no plan other than to be still and get a ton of reading and writing done. #vacation #allieverwanted

Sat Jun 29 06:43:26 +0000 2013

Replying to @ahacker

Hi! I’m on the 9.55 am Lufthansa flight.

Sat Jun 29 12:07:08 +0000 2013

Replying to @ahacker

Thanks -- you too!

Sat Jun 29 12:55:13 +0000 2013

Running on 3 nights in a row of 4 hours or less sleep. \(Not by choice\.\) Thank goodness for European hotel breakfasts.

Sun Jun 30 05:23:31 +0000 2013

Today, FRA > LHR. Tomorrow and Tuesday, @britishlibrary for #OAbooks. http://www.jisc-collections.ac.uk/JISC-Collections-events/oabooksconf/

Sun Jun 30 05:39:19 +0000 2013

Hello, London! You're very shiny and warm today.

Sun Jun 30 11:55:39 +0000 2013

My room is on the back side of the hotel \(& so is quiet\!\), but the view by the elevators on my floor looks like this.

Sun Jun 30 15:17:57 +0000 2013

Replying to @ernestopriego

Why, thank you! It’s very London-y around here. \(Except for all the sun and warmth, I guess\.\)

Sun Jun 30 15:19:25 +0000 2013

Replying to @ernestopriego

Seriously cool!

Sun Jun 30 15:19:51 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

Ooh, do tell. Could do with a good dinner.

Sun Jun 30 15:33:21 +0000 2013

Replying to @Ed_Raso

It is inspiring, isn’t it! I’m here for a conference at the BL.

Sun Jun 30 15:37:00 +0000 2013

Replying to @Ed_Raso

You know it.

Sun Jun 30 15:41:35 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

OOH. Sold.

Sun Jun 30 15:43:27 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

Indeed! I hope things are swell where you are.

Sun Jun 30 15:47:53 +0000 2013

docs.text:
Replying to @shanakimball

I missed you arriving here. Quite the crowd!

Mon Jul 01 10:30:03 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

Yay, welcome! I hope the trip was okay.

Mon Jul 01 10:31:34 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

Promise. I finally got a decent night’s sleep last night, so am beginning to emerge from zombiedom myself.

Mon Jul 01 10:33:59 +0000 2013

Replying to @carenmilloy

Works out very nicely indeed! #OAbooks

Mon Jul 01 10:40:30 +0000 2013

RT @ernestopriego: If ECRs don't risk, how will scholarship ever change? Replication of cons methods won't get us there. Risk should be rew…

Mon Jul 01 11:10:55 +0000 2013

LS rep at #oabooks says it’s not realistic for societies to run repositories. My response: societies must explore partnering with libraries!

Mon Jul 01 11:34:52 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself

Say it isn’t so.

Mon Jul 01 13:12:02 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself

I have a family full of Italian Americans. Might they count?

Mon Jul 01 13:16:09 +0000 2013

Frances Pinter on @KUnlatched model: consortium lowers risks for all; “you have no idea how expensive it is to keep things closed.” #oabooks

Mon Jul 01 13:28:49 +0000 2013

Replying to @ernestopriego

You are the BEST.

Mon Jul 01 15:53:15 +0000 2013

RT @KUnlatched: The Mellon-funded report on open review @kfitz presented about is available at http://mediacommons.futureofthebook.org/mcpress/open-review/files/2012/06/MediaCommons_Open_Review_White_Paper_final.pdf #oabooks

Mon Jul 01 15:55:50 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

Awwww!

Mon Jul 01 15:56:16 +0000 2013

Replying to @researchremix

I was sorry to miss you at #OAI8, but I understand you had other awesome places to be!

Mon Jul 01 15:57:48 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball, @LibSkrat and @researchremix

Indeed! Someday soon, I hope.

Mon Jul 01 16:01:24 +0000 2013

Replying to @pomonacollege

Very nice! The white background opens things up, the menus/sliders are less complex, and I like the use of the new mark.

Mon Jul 01 16:34:37 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball, @researchremix and @LibSkrat

I like this idea.

Mon Jul 01 16:36:30 +0000 2013

Wait, what? // RT @TheAtlantic: First-ever human head transplant is now possible, says neuroscientist http://theatln.tc/15bcjfN via @qz

Mon Jul 01 16:41:51 +0000 2013

Replying to @ekansa, @TheAtlantic and @qz

But I guess we’d finally answer the question of whether identity is resident in the brain or the body.

Mon Jul 01 16:47:16 +0000 2013

Replying to @RLUK_Mike

Very nice -- I like that framing of the question.

Mon Jul 01 16:50:15 +0000 2013

Replying to @j_w_baker and @tmccormick

A very fair point. Expectations for participation in any community of practice need to be established. #oabooks

Mon Jul 01 16:52:38 +0000 2013

Replying to @tmccormick

But at least in open review communities any homophily that crops up is visible and can be challenged. #oabooks

Mon Jul 01 16:53:58 +0000 2013

Hear, hear! // MT @jfwinters: Great first day of #OAbooks… Congratulations to @carenmilloy & colleagues for putting it all together.

Mon Jul 01 16:56:46 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley

Yeah, it’s pretty mind-blowing. And I’m not trying to be punny.

Mon Jul 01 17:01:18 +0000 2013

The thing I can’t wrap my head around \(ha ha\) is who you would be after the transplant. We’d finally know where selfhood is located I guess.

Mon Jul 01 17:02:35 +0000 2013

@IntarchEditor Yes -- we’ve definitely found that authors have to participate in the process in very different ways when it’s open.

Mon Jul 01 17:03:36 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

No, it’s attachment at the spinal cord. o.O

Mon Jul 01 17:04:19 +0000 2013

Replying to @IntarchEditor

Some are, it’s true. But it would be great to get the community in that subject area really working together openly! #oabooks

Mon Jul 01 17:13:06 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley

Will do -- should see one or the other shortly.

Mon Jul 01 17:13:22 +0000 2013

Replying to @ivovolt

How did we get people to participate? Twitter, FB, blog posts, email lists - everything we could think of! #oabooks

Mon Jul 01 17:16:58 +0000 2013

Replying to @plragde

But some recent arguments have suggested that identity inheres in the body rather than strictly in the brain \(e\.g\. muscle memory\).

Mon Jul 01 17:18:35 +0000 2013

Replying to @plragde

Such a transplant would at least let us know for sure. Wake the patient up & ask “who are you now?”

Mon Jul 01 17:19:10 +0000 2013

Replying to @plragde

True! Though in that case only the spinal cord has been severed; other systems remain connected, if some function with assistance.

Mon Jul 01 17:21:51 +0000 2013

Replying to @plragde

\(You realize of course I’m being somewhat tendentious here\. My own personal feeling is that I am in my brain\.\)

Mon Jul 01 17:22:33 +0000 2013

Replying to @plragde

\(But I would say that, wouldn’t I?\)

Mon Jul 01 17:22:40 +0000 2013

Replying to @plragde

Indeed.

Mon Jul 01 17:27:25 +0000 2013

Replying to @ivovolt

That’s a huge challenge; we talk about it a bit in the full report. Something serious to consider. #oabooks

Mon Jul 01 21:32:02 +0000 2013

Replying to @ivovolt

It’s downloadable at http://mediacommons.futureofthebook.org/mcpress/open-review/

Mon Jul 01 22:43:01 +0000 2013

Replying to @ivovolt

It got tweeted, but I totally failed to mention it - so you only missed it by paying attention. :)

Mon Jul 01 22:50:07 +0000 2013

Replying to @crsbecker

I once had one with a telephone-booth-style door, which opened by folding inward. I almost didn’t make it out.

Tue Jul 02 11:15:58 +0000 2013

Replying to @crsbecker

The best part was when I had your bottle-drop moment, and I had to open the door to bend over, and couldn’t.

Tue Jul 02 12:42:24 +0000 2013

You know what I want? A hashtag resolver that tells you what a cryptic acronym stands for.

Tue Jul 02 14:15:57 +0000 2013

Replying to @savasavasava

Okay, so then what I want is an API and a Twitter client that pulls up the def on rollover.

Tue Jul 02 14:30:02 +0000 2013

Replying to @martin_eve

Oh! Sorry I missed you.

Tue Jul 02 14:30:58 +0000 2013

Replying to @warnick

Hmm. I really want it client-scrapeable, so that I can rollover a hashtag & have the def appear...

Tue Jul 02 14:32:20 +0000 2013

Replying to @savasavasava

Exactly. Or a tooltip on the desktop.

Tue Jul 02 14:32:47 +0000 2013

Replying to @savasavasava

Yes! As you get when you click on a username.

Tue Jul 02 14:34:06 +0000 2013

Replying to @warnick

It’s true. Wikipedia-style disambiguation would not be out of the question. \(Groups using \#MLA13 include…\)

Tue Jul 02 14:36:03 +0000 2013

Replying to @warnick

ON IT.

Tue Jul 02 14:37:19 +0000 2013

Replying to @jbj

People who subtweet deserve what they get. #youknowwhoyouare

Tue Jul 02 14:39:00 +0000 2013

Replying to @WmGermano

Nice. Messy, but nice.

Tue Jul 02 14:40:34 +0000 2013

@ahacker Re your question this morning: http://academicblogs.org might be a good place to find some worthy examples!

Tue Jul 02 15:04:15 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall and @billwolff

Right. But what I’m really after is a client that could scrape that data & on clicking on a hashtag display both +

Tue Jul 02 15:05:07 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall and @billwolff

tweets & info about the tag, as many clients do for users.

Tue Jul 02 15:05:33 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall and @billwolff

My feed is full of them today, I know that for sure.

Tue Jul 02 15:07:20 +0000 2013

Now up at #oabooks: @shanakimball on MPublishing, library-based publishing, and library-press collaborations.

Tue Jul 02 15:09:04 +0000 2013

Replying to @triplingual, @briancroxall and @billwolff

Exactly. Wikipedia-style: #MLA13 is being used by...

Tue Jul 02 15:10:29 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley and @shanakimball

is on another call right now. Can I take a message and have her get back to you?

Tue Jul 02 15:14:16 +0000 2013

Replying to @savasavasava and @shanakimball

:)

Tue Jul 02 15:21:31 +0000 2013

Wow. Just discovered that my former work email account was deleted July 1 on the dot. Am having a bit of a moment here. #endofanera

Tue Jul 02 15:32:12 +0000 2013

Replying to @captain_primate

It has been for temporary folk. I know of no 15-year faculty whose accounts have been summarily cut off like this.

Tue Jul 02 15:34:47 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

Who the hell knows? All I got was a form letter, and no indication that the cutoff would be immediate.

Tue Jul 02 15:35:18 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

(Frankly, all I’ve been getting there for the last year is stuff I really don’t want, so it’s all good. But there’s a bit of +

Tue Jul 02 15:36:28 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

don’t let the door hit you in the ass on the way out that’s a little surprising.)

Tue Jul 02 15:37:02 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall and @captain_primate

I’ve been picking up via my gmail acct for a while, which is how I found out authentication was failing.

Tue Jul 02 15:37:43 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall and @captain_primate

“User unknown.” Snif.

Tue Jul 02 15:37:57 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

I suspect it’s not forwarding; hasn’t appeared yet, anyhow. Let me know if you get an error response.

Tue Jul 02 15:41:34 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

Things have been great here. Didn’t make it to StP for bubbles, but am having dinner tonight at a friend’s club.

Tue Jul 02 15:42:56 +0000 2013

RT @shanakimball: Really admiring the chutzpah and grace of @CameronNeylon in speaking off the cuff from a deck of 60 randomized slides #OA…

Tue Jul 02 15:47:00 +0000 2013

RT @ernestopriego: .@CameronNeylon: |the point of the book, the tweet, the blog post is to engage people, to make people think" #oabooks

Tue Jul 02 15:47:57 +0000 2013

Replying to @stephharves

I’ve been picking up the PO mail via my Gmail acct for a while, so I have the old stuff. +

Tue Jul 02 15:50:02 +0000 2013

Replying to @stephharves

And for the last while, the only mail I’ve gotten there was stuff I didn’t want to get anyway. +

Tue Jul 02 15:50:28 +0000 2013

Replying to @stephharves

But I just want to say: 15 YEARS. Ending with a form email from the dean’s office, and a deleted email address.

Tue Jul 02 15:51:16 +0000 2013

.@CameronNeylon: The “unprecedented good” served by open access is not just a public good, but a good for scholarship. #oabooks

Tue Jul 02 15:52:45 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah and @stephharves

That checklist is the form email I got from the dean’s office. Wow, this year went fast! Be sure to turn in your keys!

Tue Jul 02 16:05:11 +0000 2013

Replying to @mmwwah

No, but there was the suggestion that I needed to account for/turn in all materials bought with college or dept funds.

Tue Jul 02 16:29:25 +0000 2013

@ernestopriego You should NOT have! Thank you, though it’s really way too much!

Tue Jul 02 21:32:58 +0000 2013

Replying to @ernestopriego

The good news is that now *I* owe *you* a drink, next time I see you. I will look forward to it.

Tue Jul 02 21:40:04 +0000 2013

Replying to @CJ_Daugherty

I am so totally it!

Tue Jul 02 23:35:50 +0000 2013

Replying to @CJ_Daugherty

You look fabulous, too! It was great catching up - I’ll look forward to doing it again soon.

Tue Jul 02 23:46:06 +0000 2013

Farewell, London. It was lovely! But I am ready to drag my heavy suitcase somewhere I can unpack and stay put.

Wed Jul 03 07:57:21 +0000 2013

Independence Day! My summer rest and writing retreat begins, appropriately, today.

Thu Jul 04 05:31:23 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

Woo-hoo! Safe travels, & all my best to Brooklyn.

Thu Jul 04 08:46:42 +0000 2013

Replying to @ayjay

Looks like oleander, but I'm not really the person to ask.

Thu Jul 04 15:23:19 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

O hai! :)

Fri Jul 05 13:28:33 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall

2014?!? That’s insane. @emoryhealthcare

Fri Jul 05 14:11:39 +0000 2013

My #oabooks talk: “advan­cing toward its goal with the effi­ciency of a war machine.” I am both flattered and alarmed http://blog.homo-numericus.net/article11208.html

Mon Jul 08 08:25:00 +0000 2013

Replying to @piotrr70

Thank you! I did know it was positive; I just had this image of myself crushing everything in my path that was a bit surprising.

Mon Jul 08 09:54:49 +0000 2013

Made a turn today in the thing I’m writing. The point I’m now working toward is a bit controversial, which makes me think it’s worth saying.

Mon Jul 08 14:37:32 +0000 2013

Replying to @patriksv

It’s always nice to figure out that it’s not just empty blather!

Mon Jul 08 14:38:33 +0000 2013

I have just discovered that it’s possible to take a good picture of me if I don’t know you’re doing it. New avatars may be forthcoming.

Mon Jul 08 15:04:09 +0000 2013

Okay, done. New avatars should be propagating. Imagine me telling an auditorium full of scientists about the digital humanities.

Mon Jul 08 15:38:22 +0000 2013

Replying to @wraabe

I’ve been fretting a bit about how little my avatar resembled me anymore. \(Okay, I haven’t been fretting about it \*that\* much, but\.\)

Mon Jul 08 15:51:51 +0000 2013

Replying to @acavender

I was *very* persuasive.

Mon Jul 08 16:17:37 +0000 2013

Replying to @nmhouston

Thanks! The growing disjuncture between actual me and turquoise-jacket me was taking up far more brain power than it was worth.

Mon Jul 08 16:18:41 +0000 2013

@BendProf I was so traumatized by the experience of driving my cats to LAX when we moved to NYC that I may never recover. \(Them too, alas\.\)

Tue Jul 09 16:20:39 +0000 2013

Replying to @BendProf

Which is to say that the part of moving to my new apt I dreaded most was putting the cats in the carriers to cab them to Brooklyn.

Tue Jul 09 16:23:01 +0000 2013

Replying to @BendProf

Eh. In the scheme of things, it’s easy. But nothing’s as easy as a pixie that needs no blow-drying.

Tue Jul 09 16:27:37 +0000 2013

Replying to @BendProf

SO MUCH. And I was busy trying to keep the crazy cab driver from realizing I had not one but two cats with me… Trauma all around.

Tue Jul 09 16:28:13 +0000 2013

Replying to @rrkennison

Hey thanks!

Tue Jul 09 16:29:12 +0000 2013

Replying to @BendProf

It’s *okay* if I don’t blow-dry it, but only okay. Much preferable if I do. I’m not sure how long I’ll be able to deal with that!

Tue Jul 09 18:33:31 +0000 2013

Replying to @jbj and @wynkenhimself

Ooh! **begins to plot**

Tue Jul 09 18:36:11 +0000 2013

Replying to @dancohen and @jbj

Drop and give me 20, Cohen!

Tue Jul 09 18:43:11 +0000 2013

Replying to @dancohen and @jbj

Oh wait. That was “Drill Instructor Fitz.” My bad.

Tue Jul 09 18:43:29 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself and @BendProf

Alas, my hair has not fully made the move to wavy. It’s 90% straight, with a couple of weird bends.

Tue Jul 09 18:53:37 +0000 2013

I’ve just watched the first half of my #OAbooks talk \(http://bit\.ly/12VLnLS\) & am exhausted. Must moderate coffee intake.

Tue Jul 09 19:45:43 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

Aw, thanks!

Tue Jul 09 19:47:44 +0000 2013

Replying to @triplingual

It’s Arras. I did a little modification, I think, but honestly I can’t remember what...

Wed Jul 10 15:59:25 +0000 2013

Replying to @triplingual

My pleasure!

Wed Jul 10 16:03:49 +0000 2013

Over the course of the last two days, I have migrated just about everything running at http://machines.pomona.edu to http://machines.plannedobsolescence.net. +

Thu Jul 11 14:29:34 +0000 2013

I even managed to get the MarxWiki \(http://machines\.plannedobsolescence\.net/marxwiki\) and the DFW Wiki \(http://machines\.plannedobsolescence\.net/dfwwiki\) running properly again. +

Thu Jul 11 14:29:39 +0000 2013

I’m very grateful to the instructional technologists at Pomona, who gave me extra time for the migration and will be redirecting traffic. +

Thu Jul 11 14:29:44 +0000 2013

But if you link to machines, please note the update: http://machines.plannedobsolescence.net.

Thu Jul 11 14:29:47 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself

It might have come up in the Q&A. The "don't ask" argument comes in part from Susan Bielstein, Permissions: A Survival Guide.

Thu Jul 11 20:18:06 +0000 2013

Replying to @LibSkrat and @wynkenhimself

That's a shame. Bielstein's argument is dead-on: every time we ask, we build precedent, a sense that we should ask.

Thu Jul 11 20:22:26 +0000 2013

Replying to @LibSkrat and @wynkenhimself

And that sense of common practice can bear as much weight as actual law.

Thu Jul 11 20:23:22 +0000 2013

A very happy birthday to @JenHoward and @miriamkp! July 12 is an auspicious day.

Fri Jul 12 13:37:26 +0000 2013

Replying to @profwernimont

ON IT. :) \(cc @wynkenhimself\)

Fri Jul 12 15:05:49 +0000 2013

Replying to @profwernimont and @wynkenhimself

Not in any detail. But we are hard at work on the future of MLA style and its associated habitus!

Fri Jul 12 15:12:41 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall

Waffling? WAFFLING?!? I have changed my avatar once in the last 3 years? I think? And tried to prepare everyone for it.

Fri Jul 12 16:12:40 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall

Really! That one dates back to my pre-MLA sabbatical.

Fri Jul 12 16:14:08 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall

At least yours still looks something like you. I’ve noted the surprise of late when people first meet me in person.

Fri Jul 12 16:14:54 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself and @briancroxall

Dude. I can’t believe you remember that. It was a total selfie. Paris, summer of 2008!

Fri Jul 12 16:16:14 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself and @briancroxall

Getting to work on time is terribly overrated.

Fri Jul 12 16:18:09 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself and @briancroxall

Both, I think, but somewhat dizzying!

Fri Jul 12 16:23:32 +0000 2013

Replying to @acavender

See,@briancroxall? I was not making it up.

Fri Jul 12 18:03:54 +0000 2013

Replying to @katinalynn, @wynkenhimself and @briancroxall

I’ve got my eye on you, Rogers.

Fri Jul 12 18:19:44 +0000 2013

Replying to @amandafrench, @briancroxall, @eetempleton and @acavender

Depends on the goal of the Twitter account. Some intentionally defy identification.

Fri Jul 12 18:51:34 +0000 2013

I need a mod_rewrite guru, stat.

Sat Jul 13 13:51:42 +0000 2013

RT @eclecticbrotha: The week in review: a woman with tampons and a black kid with Skittles are both more dangerous than a white man with a …

Sun Jul 14 06:41:19 +0000 2013

Waking up this morning to utter heartbreak. I am devastated for my country, so far away, in so many ways.

Sun Jul 14 06:42:05 +0000 2013

Get Me Rewrite! http://wp.me/p2w8Sh-E0

Sun Jul 14 08:55:22 +0000 2013

Very sorry to be missing ACH & ADHO mtgs, not to mention #DH2013. Couldn’t figure out a Prague-to-Lincoln itinerary that wouldn’t kill me.

Mon Jul 15 16:20:35 +0000 2013

Replying to @bestqualitycrab

Good grief. I hope it took you weeks — because of stopovers, I mean, not just miserable travel time!

Mon Jul 15 17:01:35 +0000 2013

Replying to @sirmies

Hi. It would be best to email me: kfitzpatrick at mla dot org. Thanks!

Thu Jul 18 07:14:32 +0000 2013

I know there’s something wrong with being this excited because my vacation has been SO PRODUCTIVE, but seriously. SO PRODUCTIVE. #yay #sigh

Thu Jul 18 12:16:05 +0000 2013

Replying to @sleonchnm

It’s astonishing how much you can get done when you’re away and relaxed..

Thu Jul 18 12:19:08 +0000 2013

+1 // RT @jmcclurken: Wishing I was with so many of my friends and intellectual heroes at #DH2013 this week....

Thu Jul 18 21:04:52 +0000 2013

Replying to @sherah1918

Woo hoo!

Fri Jul 19 18:54:45 +0000 2013

Replying to @seth_denbo

Congratulations, Seth; I'll look forward to working with you!

Tue Jul 23 14:31:32 +0000 2013

Congrats, all! // RT @seth_denbo: I'm very excited to be joining AHA this fall as Director of Scholarly Communication & Digital Initiatives.

Tue Jul 23 14:32:52 +0000 2013

Replying to @ernestopriego

Lately, I mistype my own name 2 of 3 times...

Tue Jul 23 14:42:53 +0000 2013

New post at Planned Obsolescence: On the Working Vacation. http://wp.me/p2w8Sh-F8

Wed Jul 24 13:13:35 +0000 2013

Oh god please. Unless you literally mean technics and mechanics of vision. RT @mariabustillos: stop saying "optics"!!!!!!!!!!!

Wed Jul 24 17:38:18 +0000 2013

Replying to @plragde and @mariabustillos

Ha. Should have known you’d be there with me.

Wed Jul 24 17:39:12 +0000 2013

Rock on, @PomonaCollege. http://www.forbes.com/top-colleges/list/

Wed Jul 24 17:40:19 +0000 2013

\(I choose not to believe that there’s a relationship between my resignation and that ranking\.\)

Wed Jul 24 17:40:39 +0000 2013

Replying to @tcarmody

I have always known you were the best, Tim Carmody.

Wed Jul 24 17:41:48 +0000 2013

Replying to @sleonchnm

And you too!

Wed Jul 24 17:42:02 +0000 2013

Replying to @mattbucher

I do wish that list included financial aid info, esp. those schools with no-loan policies \(ahem, Pomona\).

Wed Jul 24 17:50:13 +0000 2013

Replying to @mattbucher

Then again, it’s Forbes.

Wed Jul 24 17:50:54 +0000 2013

Replying to @mattbucher

Sad, but very likely true. The Pomonas of the world are great, but it’s a nightmarish situation overall.

Wed Jul 24 17:55:53 +0000 2013

Replying to @jwolman and @tcarmody

Indubitably.

Wed Jul 24 18:22:51 +0000 2013

Replying to @ProfM_Lindemann

Go you. Thanks for, um, oversharing.

Wed Jul 24 18:49:36 +0000 2013

Replying to @ProfM_Lindemann

Absolutely! Now to develop a colonoscopy pseudonym generator.

Wed Jul 24 18:54:58 +0000 2013

After this week, it’s hard to read the following sentence \(from Giles Slade’s Made to Break\) quite the same way: +

Thu Jul 25 14:34:26 +0000 2013

“Stevens’s definitive contribution to this cultural icon was to ‘put the wiener in the bun’” \(151\). The icon? The Oscar Mayer Wienermobile.

Thu Jul 25 14:34:39 +0000 2013

I wonder if I’ll ever feel the same way about wiener puns again.

Thu Jul 25 14:34:46 +0000 2013

Replying to @literarychica

There’s an article on audiobooks by Lutz Koepnick in the Jan 2013 PMLA.

Thu Jul 25 14:42:27 +0000 2013

Replying to @literarychica

I can only imagine.

Thu Jul 25 14:43:41 +0000 2013

T-minus 6 days until re-entry, post working vacation. It’s been amazing, on both counts: http://www.plannedobsolescence.net/blog/on-the-working-vacation/

Thu Jul 25 15:52:00 +0000 2013

I am, however, looking forward to finally settling into the apartment I moved into two months ago. Maybe buying a dresser, hanging blinds.

Thu Jul 25 15:53:23 +0000 2013

Replying to @surlyF

NICE.

Thu Jul 25 17:18:14 +0000 2013

Replying to @Ed_Raso

I bought a dresser from them in like 1995. Gave it away when I left CA two years ago. I miss that dresser.

Thu Jul 25 17:19:08 +0000 2013

Replying to @rgfeal

“Boss” is indeed a strange word, esp for one right out of academe. “Senior colleague” works well indeed!

Thu Jul 25 17:22:40 +0000 2013

@surlyF Hey, something I’m sure you can use as a blurb somewhere: “Furlough is exactly right.” —Scholarly Kitchen. http://scholarlykitchen.sspnet.org/2013/07/26/dissertation-embargoes-and-the-rights-of-scholars-aha-smacks-the-hornets-nest/

Fri Jul 26 15:47:44 +0000 2013

Replying to @surlyF

That would make a nice card. That, an email, a Twitter handle — that’s all you need.

Fri Jul 26 15:51:44 +0000 2013

Replying to @surlyF

Maybe on the flip side, the inevitable “Furlough is completely wrong.”

Fri Jul 26 15:52:36 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley and @loriemerson

Hey cool — thanks!

Fri Jul 26 15:57:35 +0000 2013

Replying to @theorymeg

You did fabulously, but you would have regardless. I hope all is well with you!

Mon Jul 29 14:49:24 +0000 2013

Replying to @theorymeg

I hear that. Sending you all good wishes!

Mon Jul 29 14:57:49 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself

Woo hoo! Congrats!

Mon Jul 29 16:46:03 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley and @lincolnmullen

Completely agreed that this is very desirable, but I’m not sure what’s needed is a tool. A service, yes. And +

Mon Jul 29 20:26:47 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley and @lincolnmullen

as Brett notes, a name-brand service may go along way toward producing the social change @mia_out points to.

Mon Jul 29 20:27:27 +0000 2013

Replying to @lincolnmullen, @brettbobley and @mia_out

I would argue for a scholarly org or a consortium thereof...

Mon Jul 29 20:30:03 +0000 2013

Packing up to head back to NYC tomorrow. It’s been an absolutely dreamy trip, but I’ll be glad to get home.

Tue Jul 30 13:13:43 +0000 2013

Replying to @boone

I'd love to hear what you wind up with. My printer/scanner died the day before I left on this trip & I'll have to replace soon.

Tue Jul 30 13:34:44 +0000 2013

Okay, packed up, crashing, and bracing for the 3 am cacophony of device alarms. See you tomorrow afternoon, NYC.

Tue Jul 30 19:22:25 +0000 2013

Okay: up at 3 am; dragged the suitcases outside just after 4 am; in the lounge at PRG at 5 am. Home around 4 pm. See you in a bit, NYC.

Wed Jul 31 03:13:45 +0000 2013

FRA. Lufthansa lounge, sleeping cubicle. Brian Eno, Music for Airports, through noise suppressing headphones. Wake me in a couple of hours.

Wed Jul 31 05:39:23 +0000 2013

Hello, Newark! \(A mere 1\.5 hours late\.\)

Wed Jul 31 19:48:47 +0000 2013

Hello, Brooklyn. Thanks for the awesome weather.

Wed Jul 31 21:55:15 +0000 2013

docs.title: 2013 08 01 tweets
docs.text:
Okay. It appears I managed to make it home yesterday. Today begins the process of sorting out the chaos.

Thu Aug 01 10:45:01 +0000 2013

\(Which is to say that if I owe you something… I hope I’ll be able to get it to you soon\.\)

Thu Aug 01 10:45:59 +0000 2013

Replying to @jmcclurken

Thank you! It’s nice to be here, and nice to see an actual stretch of chaos-clearing time ahead.

Thu Aug 01 10:46:23 +0000 2013

Replying to @rgfeal

Ooh, I am trying. Just looking around and saying to myself “one thing at a time. There’s no deadline.”

Thu Aug 01 10:49:01 +0000 2013

Replying to @rgfeal

That sounds SO nice. Enjoy it!

Thu Aug 01 10:53:30 +0000 2013

Ways I know the vacation part of my working vacation is over: I just blow-dried my hair and put on makeup for the first time in weeks.

Thu Aug 01 11:17:53 +0000 2013

Also: time to switch everything out of the travel bag and into the work bag.

Thu Aug 01 11:27:02 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

Aw shucks. You are The Best.

Fri Aug 02 02:17:59 +0000 2013

Replying to @nypl_labs, @tcarmody and @shanakimball

Yes, please!

Fri Aug 02 03:07:44 +0000 2013

Things that rock today: UC Senate, #owot, New York weather, general Fridayness.

Fri Aug 02 20:26:41 +0000 2013

This weekend: major errands, massive unpacking, huge laundry, cooking up a storm. Tonight, sleep. Please oh please, sleep.

Mon Aug 05 00:25:53 +0000 2013

\(PS: Thanks again for the awesome weather, NYC\.\)

Mon Aug 05 00:26:08 +0000 2013

Replying to @stephharves

I hope the jet lag is passing! I slept like a rock, and was thrilled to wake to even more awesome weather.

Mon Aug 05 13:44:56 +0000 2013

Replying to @boone

Nice! Thanks for the followup. I’m glad to hear it’s working well.

Mon Aug 05 15:52:29 +0000 2013

Wha???

Mon Aug 05 20:40:28 +0000 2013

I’m… gobsmacked. // RT @romenesko: The Washington Post has been sold to Jeff Bezos for $250 million.

Mon Aug 05 20:40:54 +0000 2013

Replying to @rgfeal

Pls do not turn his attention in our direction.

Mon Aug 05 20:47:05 +0000 2013

This day has officially just gone crazypants.

Mon Aug 05 20:52:08 +0000 2013

Replying to @surlyF and @wynkenhimself

Banana snake?!?

Tue Aug 06 15:32:50 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself and @surlyF

Oh, the banana flavor, hands down. Ergh.

Tue Aug 06 15:37:33 +0000 2013

RT @mediacommons: Everyday Play, a fantastic new cluster curated by Sam Tobin, is up today at The New Everyday: http://mediacommons.futureofthebook.org/tne/cluster/everyday-play

Tue Aug 06 16:39:25 +0000 2013

Replying to @jmcclurken

“Try rebooting me and see if that helps!”

Tue Aug 06 20:01:20 +0000 2013

Replying to @nowviskie

We are very, very sorry for the @scholarslab loss. But there’s more than a little joyful anticipation on this end. @katinalynn

Wed Aug 07 15:27:07 +0000 2013

Replying to @katinalynn and @amandafrench

The team is super excited about it, too!

Wed Aug 07 15:42:17 +0000 2013

Replying to @lmrhody

Hey, congrats to you and @chnm both!

Wed Aug 07 18:46:54 +0000 2013

RT @MLACommons: We’re happy to announce that MLA Commons has received a grant from the Mellon Foundation to begin phase 2 planning: http://…

Wed Aug 07 18:50:12 +0000 2013

Replying to @mkgold, @MLACommons and @cbox

Thank you! We’re thrilled to be moving forward with you.

Wed Aug 07 19:44:17 +0000 2013

Replying to @wilbanks

The crazy thing is that we released that well over a year ago. The Atlantic even blogged it then! http://www.theatlantic.com/technology/archive/2012/03/how-do-you-cite-a-tweet-in-an-academic-paper/253932/

Thu Aug 08 00:18:17 +0000 2013

Replying to @wilbanks

Sigh. The 7th edition says that URLs are optional. The format is consistent with that edition. But the 8th… *smiles enigmatically*

Thu Aug 08 00:20:52 +0000 2013

Replying to @LibSkrat and @wilbanks

Oh, now that’s just unfair.

Thu Aug 08 00:21:14 +0000 2013

Replying to @wilbanks

More meme delay? The shiny new gig is 2 years old. But would love to say hi in DC sometime!

Thu Aug 08 01:01:54 +0000 2013

Replying to @wilbanks

Avatar and apartment are both sparkly new, yes! And I do still feel like I’m just getting started in the job, so fair enough.

Thu Aug 08 01:05:26 +0000 2013

Replying to @amandafrench and @wilbanks

Happy MLA Releases a Tweet Citation Format Season!

Thu Aug 08 01:08:47 +0000 2013

Replying to @LibSkrat

I do not think @KUnlatched is responsible for that story; it looks like they just tweeted it…

Fri Aug 09 13:08:11 +0000 2013

Stressful vet trip. One kitty freak out; the other comes home with the cone of shame. One up 4 pounds; the other down 4. Both perturbed.

Fri Aug 09 16:11:54 +0000 2013

As R just noted, taking two grouchy 13-year-old kitties to the vet? Not a rainbows and lollipops experience.

Fri Aug 09 16:48:07 +0000 2013

Replying to @dancohen

Thank you, and backatcha. Mine is heartbreaking to watch, bumping into things & being hissed at by her brother. :(

Fri Aug 09 16:52:19 +0000 2013

Replying to @triproftri

Oh no! I hope all is better...

Fri Aug 09 17:08:33 +0000 2013

Replying to @rgfeal

Alice has a bad lick spot - she must have scratched herself & has worried it into infection. :( Alas, @MetVetNYC is Manhattan-only.

Fri Aug 09 17:13:19 +0000 2013

Replying to @LizaPotts, @WIRED and @ecshowalter

\(a\) Released well over a year ago. \(Check your sources\!\) \(b\) Explained then that in 7th ed URLs are optional.

Sat Aug 10 15:14:42 +0000 2013

Replying to @LizaPotts, @WIRED and @ecshowalter

Real names are included if the tweeter provides one. URLs are optional because the 7th ed made them so. +

Sat Aug 10 15:17:36 +0000 2013

Replying to @LizaPotts, @WIRED and @ecshowalter

There’s an explanation in Handbook at 5.6.2. There’s been much discussion since. It’s been heard, trust me.

Sat Aug 10 15:18:20 +0000 2013

Replying to @LizaPotts

I’ve dealt with the occasional Chicago journal. It’s been… different.

Sat Aug 10 15:22:02 +0000 2013

Got brave enough to take a peek into the storage area of doom. The situation is neither as bad as I’d feared nor as good as I’d hoped.

Sat Aug 10 15:24:07 +0000 2013

Once we have sufficient shelving in the apartment, I think we’re looking at one 2-person weekend worth of work. \(But first, the shelving\.\)

Sat Aug 10 15:25:03 +0000 2013

Call from vet: Kitty #1 \(who was down 4 lbs\) has hyperthyroidism; kitty #2 \(who was up 4 lbs\) is diabetic. I’m going back to bed now.

Sat Aug 10 17:02:44 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself

There are many worse things they could have. But it’s going to be a big change for everybody. :(

Sat Aug 10 17:07:44 +0000 2013

Replying to @Exhaust_Fumes

Absolutely; could be much worse.

Sat Aug 10 17:15:15 +0000 2013

Replying to @jcmeloni

Yes, both. He’ll be getting a thyroid pill twice a day; she’ll be getting injected with insulin. :(

Sat Aug 10 19:01:05 +0000 2013

Replying to @CJ_Daugherty

Heh. They have been pretty testy around one another lately...

Sat Aug 10 19:01:20 +0000 2013

Replying to @jmaxsfu

Yes, it was. His symptoms read almost *exactly* like the ones listed here: http://www.2ndchance.info/hyperthyroid.htm

Sat Aug 10 19:02:19 +0000 2013

Replying to @samplereality

Goop! Goop would not be bad. I was given pills instead. We’ll see how well this goes.

Sat Aug 10 19:03:04 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

Have fun!

Sat Aug 10 19:41:48 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley

Thanks, Brett. The vet has not suggested that yet; I’m not sure why. Pills before the nuclear option, I guess.

Sat Aug 10 20:43:56 +0000 2013

Replying to @rgfeal and @brettbobley

Perhaps. She also said something about needing to recheck his kidneys once his thyroid level was stable, so maybe +

Sat Aug 10 21:35:39 +0000 2013

Replying to @rgfeal and @brettbobley

that check needs to happen before we go nuclear?

Sat Aug 10 21:36:02 +0000 2013

Replying to @MiriamEBurstein, @rgfeal and @brettbobley

Whoa. That’s serious. Totally worth it if it’s a real cure, but one draws a bit of a breath.

Sat Aug 10 21:46:04 +0000 2013

Another call from the vet today. After more blood work, it seems kitty #2 may not be diabetic after all. She may be pre-diabetic — or +

Sun Aug 11 21:01:34 +0000 2013

it may be her kidneys. She’ll go back in for more testing on Friday.

Sun Aug 11 21:02:13 +0000 2013

To add insult to injury, kitty #2 is also the one with the cone of shame. And she can’t fit her whole self & the cone in the litter box. +

Sun Aug 11 21:17:20 +0000 2013

And she’s dealing with a couple of dumb hoomins who didn’t think to take the raised sides of the box off for her until after the Incident.

Sun Aug 11 21:18:31 +0000 2013

Replying to @brettbobley and @unsworth

Hooray! And enormous congratulations. Best news to come out of Capitol Hill in quite a while.

Mon Aug 12 13:16:08 +0000 2013

Replying to @jasonrhody

Please, please find a way to do that.

Mon Aug 12 15:17:20 +0000 2013

Replying to @dbvisel

Safe travels, Dan! I’ll look forward to hearing more from the other side.

Tue Aug 13 11:50:22 +0000 2013

Replying to @dbvisel

Boy, I can’t imagine how that happened. No worries — and keep me posted!

Tue Aug 13 12:35:49 +0000 2013

Replying to @wilbanks

THE MADNESS MUST STOP.

Tue Aug 13 13:09:06 +0000 2013

Replying to @mkirschenbaum

That, my friend, is a very, very good question. Also, how do we make it stop.

Tue Aug 13 14:33:57 +0000 2013

New post on Planned Obsolescence: UGH. http://wp.me/s2w8Sh-ugh

Wed Aug 14 13:03:50 +0000 2013

Replying to @sherah1918

JEALOUS.

Wed Aug 14 23:15:24 +0000 2013

Replying to @sherah1918

PS: I am assuming you are in NOLA. Pls go get a poboy at Mother’s and tell me about it in detail.

Wed Aug 14 23:20:01 +0000 2013

Replying to @sherah1918

You. Are. Killing. Me.

Thu Aug 15 02:31:27 +0000 2013

Replying to @sherah1918

Sorry, I went to sleep! No, do not hush. I am living vicariously \(if longingly\) through your food life right now.

Thu Aug 15 10:32:22 +0000 2013

Replying to @CJ_Daugherty

Happy publication day! I hope it’s a wonderful one.

Thu Aug 15 11:11:52 +0000 2013

Replying to @CJ_Daugherty

\(PS: Eat it, stupid US publishers\.\)

Thu Aug 15 11:12:06 +0000 2013

Replying to @LibSkrat

My, these babies are both delicious and protein-rich! \(Excellent stuff\.\)

Thu Aug 15 16:33:32 +0000 2013

Good read. // MT @LibSkrat “How to Scuttle a Scholarly Communication Initiative” is pub’d. Let brickbattery commence! http://jlsc-pub.org/jlsc/vol1/iss4/3/

Thu Aug 15 16:39:24 +0000 2013

Replying to @sherah1918

I am having a deeply Pavlovian response. That looks AMAZING.

Thu Aug 15 19:52:03 +0000 2013

Replying to @msbonn

I’ve been using Feedly, which I’ve come to like quite a lot.

Fri Aug 16 14:41:35 +0000 2013

Replying to @ftrain

Are you really in Industrial Complex, LA? I might be alarmed to tell you how nearby I grew up.

Sat Aug 17 00:36:48 +0000 2013

Replying to @ftrain

Fair enough. I’m in Brooklyn now too, so the distance from there to here is only 46ish years long.

Sat Aug 17 00:40:33 +0000 2013

Replying to @ftrain

YAY! Best thing anyone has said to me ALL WEEK.

Sat Aug 17 00:44:14 +0000 2013

Replying to @annehelen

ROCK ON, AHP. Looking forward to seeing it!

Sat Aug 17 00:45:41 +0000 2013

Replying to @briancroxall

You need to understand those reviews in the context of the personal lives of the reviewers, Brian.

Mon Aug 19 16:42:35 +0000 2013

Finally got a chance to read my colleague Char Miller’s fantastic USETDA 2013 keynote on OA and the undergrad thesis: http://scholarship.claremont.edu/pomona_fac_pub/377/

Mon Aug 19 16:54:57 +0000 2013

Replying to @LibSkrat

Absolutely. Just fantastic!

Mon Aug 19 16:56:52 +0000 2013

There is at least one very good thing to be said about being in a 12-month \(rather than 9\-month\) position: no mid-August panic. Go, that.

Mon Aug 19 18:50:22 +0000 2013

Replying to @LibSkrat

That is what they call the worst of both worlds. Good luck!

Mon Aug 19 18:53:21 +0000 2013

Replying to @acavender

Less than you might think. :)

Mon Aug 19 18:53:34 +0000 2013

Replying to @katinalynn

Have fun! Very much looking forward to seeing you on your return, but I hope the trip is long and relaxing.

Wed Aug 21 12:55:30 +0000 2013

Reporting for jury duty. Not sure what to follow that up with.

Wed Aug 21 12:57:31 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

Woo hoo! Hope everything goes super smoothly.

Wed Aug 21 13:03:31 +0000 2013

Well, that was fast.

Wed Aug 21 13:07:00 +0000 2013

Kicked out for having moved to Kings County v

Wed Aug 21 13:10:37 +0000 2013

Replying to @ivovolt

That’s great to hear - I hope you enjoy it!

Wed Aug 21 13:16:06 +0000 2013

“You don’t have proof you moved with you? But you knew you wouldn’t be serving today.” Uh, no. No, I didn’t.

Wed Aug 21 13:44:23 +0000 2013

Everything on the form & the web says “change your address like this.” Nothing says “if you’ve left NY County you’re ineligible.”

Wed Aug 21 13:45:39 +0000 2013

Ah well. Bonus work day with no meetings.

Wed Aug 21 13:46:03 +0000 2013

Replying to @hjoseph

Whoopsie. Be safe, everybody!

Wed Aug 21 14:03:33 +0000 2013

Replying to @savasavasava

Jury duty!

Wed Aug 21 14:03:50 +0000 2013

Replying to @savasavasava

Certainly makes the next few days better, though I do believe in serving when called!

Wed Aug 21 14:06:37 +0000 2013

RT @mkgold: Commons In A Box \(@cbox\) has now been downloaded over 6,000 times! http://wordpress.org/plugins/commons-in-a-box/ Many thanks to @SloanFoundation @CUNY…

Wed Aug 21 15:46:10 +0000 2013

Replying to @mkgold and @cbox

Congrats, you guys! So happy to be working with you. @SloanFoundation @CUNYGradCenter

Wed Aug 21 15:46:30 +0000 2013

I love the salad I eat most days for lunch a whole lot more when it’s not 59 degrees in my office.

Wed Aug 21 17:35:47 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

NOOOOOOOO. This is wrong in so many ways!

Wed Aug 21 20:55:33 +0000 2013

Replying to @shanakimball

So, so sorry. I am sending good arrival vibes.

Wed Aug 21 21:24:49 +0000 2013

Have taken a couple of days off just in time to reboard the kitty health rollercoaster. Kitty #1 is no longer tolerating the thyroid meds.

Thu Aug 22 12:49:36 +0000 2013

So back to the vet with Kitty #1 today. Kitty #2 has reestablished normal blood sugar, though, without my doing anything. So there’s that.

Thu Aug 22 12:51:10 +0000 2013

Replying to @samplereality

Yup. I’m going in to ask for the ear goop today. Poor little guy.

Thu Aug 22 12:51:43 +0000 2013

Replying to @jcmeloni

Indeed.

Thu Aug 22 13:05:19 +0000 2013

Yay, @nowviskie! // RT @CLIRnews: CLIR appoints Bethany Nowviskie Distinguished Presidential Fellow http://bit.ly/14Hu3fI

Thu Aug 22 17:50:57 +0000 2013

Replying to @bukuwawa

It is! Thank you!

Fri Aug 23 13:31:25 +0000 2013

Furniture delivery scheduled for 10 am to 3 pm arrived at 9.45. Happily, we were home & ready, so something is going right this morning.

Fri Aug 23 14:05:41 +0000 2013

\(Also, the furniture \- a dresser & nightstands built by Gothic Cabinet Craft \- is gorgeous\. So there’s that, too\.\)

Fri Aug 23 14:06:37 +0000 2013

To celebrate the arrival of my new dresser, I unpacked one of the two boxes I’ve been lugging around unopened, those one from 2 moves back.+

Fri Aug 23 19:29:14 +0000 2013

It turned out to be some family pictures, some knickknacks, and a metric crap ton of costume jewelry, some of which dates back to the 90s. +

Fri Aug 23 19:30:12 +0000 2013

I have sorted it into 3 categories: stuff I want to keep, stuff too junky for anyone to keep, and stuff somebody might want, but not me. +

Fri Aug 23 19:30:50 +0000 2013

I now face two problems: how to manage the stuff I’m keeping, and what to do with the stuff I’d like to pass on. +

Fri Aug 23 19:31:47 +0000 2013

There are worse problems. And it’s nice to be down to just that one unopened box. \(Which has stayed unopened through at least 4 moves\.\) +

Fri Aug 23 19:33:18 +0000 2013

But ideas for \(a\) storage, and \(b\) redistribution of costume jewelry wealth are welcome. -

Fri Aug 23 19:33:58 +0000 2013

Replying to @wynkenhimself

My building has a basement, in which I have a storage space. It is currently packed to 100% capacity with book boxes. :-/

Fri Aug 23 19:39:07 +0000 2013

Replying to @jmittell

Thanks, Jason! Actually, the unpacking is kind of pleasant; I’m glad to be getting the last things here settled.

Fri Aug 23 20:13:06 +0000 2013

Birthday tragedy! The place around the corner from my sabbatical studio no longer has its Santa Fe Shepherds Pie on the menu!

Fri Aug 23 22:51:03 +0000 2013

\(We made do with shrimp & crab enchiladas, and shrimp & crab cakes\. Not the same, but quite good\.\)

Fri Aug 23 22:52:32 +0000 2013

Replying to @jcmeloni

Why, thank you!

Sat Aug 24 00:28:30 +0000 2013

Replying to @jasonrhody and @wynkenhimself

I am so sorry I missed this exchange live.

Sat Aug 24 00:29:37 +0000 2013

Replying to @miriamkp

Thanks! I hope all’s well in SoCal.

Sat Aug 24 00:30:33 +0000 2013

No one seems quite as panicked as I at the absence of Santa Fe Shepherds Pie. Let me recap: amazing cuts of beef & pork & veg braised +

Sat Aug 24 00:32:27 +0000 2013

in Dos Equis, and topped with the world’s best mac & cheese. Seriously. AND IT’S GONE.

Sat Aug 24 00:34:03 +0000 2013

Replying to @patrick_mj

Thank you!

Replying to @captain_primate

Mon Feb 24 18:16:02 +0000 2014

Someday I will remember that the awesome results of a first cup of coffee does not imply double awesomeness from the second.

Tue Feb 25 13:37:54 +0000 2014

Replying to @boone

Nice! In this case, tho, the problem is less an unchanged result than the tipping over from not enough to too much w/no sweet spot.

Tue Feb 25 13:42:47 +0000 2014

Replying to @boone

Thus explains the failure of strong AI.

Tue Feb 25 13:44:47 +0000 2014

In other complaints about the fundamental unfairness of the world: I am more comfortable in contacts but I see infinitely better in glasses.

Tue Feb 25 13:48:42 +0000 2014

Replying to @sheepeeh

I was, too, until I turned 40. This is one of several indignities that followed.

Tue Feb 25 13:53:45 +0000 2014

Replying to @sheepeeh

Undoubtedly. I am massively near-sighted but have started developing the post-40 reading issue.

Tue Feb 25 13:59:24 +0000 2014

Replying to @sheepeeh

My glasses, for whatever reason, correct distance well without interfering with my ability to read close-up.

Tue Feb 25 13:59:50 +0000 2014

Replying to @sheepeeh

Contacts do a half-assed job of both.

Tue Feb 25 14:00:02 +0000 2014

Replying to @sheepeeh

They are. A compromise in the truest sense: everybody’s unhappy.

Tue Feb 25 14:02:04 +0000 2014

Replying to @jvinopal

Alas, not just diminishing, but paradoxical. The first produces Great Focus. The second, total scatteredness.

Tue Feb 25 14:07:59 +0000 2014

Replying to @footnotesrising and @sheepeeh

Yes, I know. It’s not an option for me.

Tue Feb 25 15:36:01 +0000 2014

The other thing I always forget about wearing glasses: I am exponentially more sensitive to allergens. Funny what a tiny plastic bit can do.

Tue Feb 25 16:56:52 +0000 2014

Replying to @mihaela_v

They do! Or at least give the impression of doing so. They also protect against the onion-chopping reaction.

Tue Feb 25 16:59:31 +0000 2014

Replying to @katinalynn

Exactly! It’s an onion/jalapeño combo that just set my eyes off on the current freakout from which they are refusing to return.

Tue Feb 25 17:08:58 +0000 2014

Replying to @tcarmody and @TheWire

Hey, congrats!

Tue Feb 25 17:11:57 +0000 2014

Other downsides of glasses \(vs contacts\)? Permanent angry red indentations on the bridge of my nose from the weight of the stupid things.

Tue Feb 25 17:16:20 +0000 2014

Upside of glasses? Seeing. So there’s that.

Tue Feb 25 17:16:41 +0000 2014

Replying to @wynkenhimself

Ooh, I forgot that benefit!

Tue Feb 25 17:18:09 +0000 2014

Replying to @wynkenhimself

Also, I’m a fan of something I hated as a kid: the pane of glass between me & the world.

Tue Feb 25 17:18:34 +0000 2014

Replying to @wynkenhimself

I’m over here; you’re over there; let’s keep it that way.

Tue Feb 25 17:18:49 +0000 2014

Replying to @briancroxall and @wynkenhimself

Mine is ridiculous but in a totally other way.

Tue Feb 25 17:22:34 +0000 2014

Replying to @rgfeal

Way more sensitive. Contact lenses protect the most sensitive part of my eyes.

Tue Feb 25 17:23:40 +0000 2014

Congrats @surlyF! Fantastic news for HathiTrust! http://www.hathitrust.org/mike_furlough_executive_director

Tue Feb 25 18:13:39 +0000 2014

Just walked outside and could read signs from a distance. Today’s count: glasses 5, contacts 2. I think it’s back to the glasses for a bit.

Tue Feb 25 22:51:55 +0000 2014

Replying to @gmbritton

Agreed with the sentiment, and yet where would you go these days?

Tue Feb 25 23:23:03 +0000 2014

Replying to @surlyF

Keep me posted on any plans in that direction!

This week’s #AAUP14 & other convos have me thinking a bit aphoristically about the role of the digital in intellectual change. To wit:

Fri Jun 27 13:48:08 +0000 2014

Network-based knowledge carries distinction less in its means of distribution \(imprimatur\) than in its mode of reception \(community\).

Fri Jun 27 13:48:21 +0000 2014

Replying to @CameronNeylon

It’s exactly that modes of reception ARE modes of retransmission in the network.

Fri Jun 27 13:54:18 +0000 2014

Replying to @CameronNeylon

Actually, I did mean the authority of the transmitter \(Big Name Press/Journal\). The shift is in the locus of authority.

Fri Jun 27 13:59:42 +0000 2014

Replying to @CameronNeylon

That’s a very good question, and worth pondering further.

Fri Jun 27 14:19:07 +0000 2014

Replying to @Infomnivore

That may indeed be part of its effect. Our hope, though, is to use that aegis to empower community authorization.

Fri Jun 27 14:21:17 +0000 2014

Still pondering the shifting nature of authority in digital knowledge production. What does it mean for scholarship per se?

Fri Jun 27 15:17:49 +0000 2014

Digital scholarship is becoming increasingly \(though not exclusively\) collaborative, process-oriented, iterative, and diffuse.

Fri Jun 27 15:17:55 +0000 2014

The digital is, or should be, everywhere in teaching. It demands our attention, not because it is unusual, but because it is not.

Fri Jun 27 18:17:17 +0000 2014

I left my apartment in Brooklyn almost 2.5 hours ago. I am now in the Holland Tunnel. It appears I am about to miss my first flight ever.

Fri Jun 27 20:43:46 +0000 2014

Flight is in 45 minutes. Still about 15 minutes away.

Fri Jun 27 20:54:42 +0000 2014

Got to the airport & was told I could fly, but my bag wouldn’t make it. Ran for it anyhow. Got to the gate in time to board!

Fri Jun 27 21:25:50 +0000 2014

This was only thanks to some very sweet people who let me cut in front of them at security.

Fri Jun 27 21:26:33 +0000 2014

Anyhow, they started boarding! And then stopped! For an hour! Because they have to check the life vests!

Fri Jun 27 21:27:19 +0000 2014

You can’t make this stuff up.

Fri Jun 27 21:27:39 +0000 2014

At least my bag should make it to the plane now.

Fri Jun 27 21:27:56 +0000 2014

Replying to @lindalevitt

I’ve missed connections due to lateness that was not my own, but never missed a first leg due to my lateness.

Fri Jun 27 21:29:41 +0000 2014

Replying to @lindalevitt

But yes, my record remains unblemished!

Fri Jun 27 21:30:07 +0000 2014

Nothing like a little airport-running-induced asthma.

Fri Jun 27 21:49:18 +0000 2014

Okay! Flight reboarded. This has been more travel adventure than I really wanted today, but we’re more or less back on track.

Fri Jun 27 22:28:54 +0000 2014

Replying to @hjoseph

Berlin! Have fun - ALA?

Fri Jun 27 22:36:23 +0000 2014

Replying to @hjoseph

And you as well. Enjoy Paris! And New York! And Venice!

Fri Jun 27 22:39:48 +0000 2014

That form of unattributed copying would be considered plagiarism in school or in journalism. So why would it be it okay on Twitter?

Passing someone else's words or ideas off as your own is intellectually dishonest and lazy. In whatever medium. #grrrr

I am today at the University of Duisburg-Essen for the Global Young Faculty conference on Open Knowledge in Digital Universities. #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:17:14 +0000 2015

Speaking of the digital university, I am once again reminded that Eduroam is the greatest thing since sliced bread. #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:18:08 +0000 2015

Introduction to the Global Young Faculty program by Dr. Dagmar Eberle, deputy director of the Mercator Research Center Ruhr. #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:23:08 +0000 2015

Today’s conference is the final program of the GYF cohort focused on the potentials of digital media in the academic world. #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:24:06 +0000 2015

Now, an introduction to that cohort by Prof. Dr. Eva Wilden and Dr. Thomas Ernst: how they came to work together & their objectives. #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:26:00 +0000 2015

The possibilities of digital media: Dr. Markus Neuschäfer of OKFN, unable to come to Essen, joins us via Skype. #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:46:13 +0000 2015

Neuschäfer’s presentation is entitled “Rewiring the Ivory Tower: Digital Universities and the Evolution of Optimal Science.” #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:47:05 +0000 2015

Begins w Nabokov: “The ‘ivory tower’ cannot be suffered unless it is transformed into a lighthouse or a broadcasting station” #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:48:33 +0000 2015

Neuschäfer: new technologies have potential to decrease control of knowledge but still subject to old habits \(IP laws, anxieties\) #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:52:12 +0000 2015

Neuschäfer quotes Paul A. David: “Open science norms and institutions are a social innovation whose workings + #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:54:53 +0000 2015

+ must be continually re-created as ‘social facts’” #gyf3ok

Mon Apr 27 11:55:08 +0000 2015

“Open Knowledge in Digital Universities” is being live-streamed at http://gyf-blog.de/ and tweeted at #gyf3ok. Follow & ask questions!

Mon Apr 27 12:02:26 +0000 2015

Yes. :)

Mon Apr 27 12:04:27 +0000 2015

Replying to @ekansa

Mon Apr 27 12:06:08 +0000 2015

Hundreds of women — and men — responded with their own stories. Most were silent for years. Many had never said anything until now.

Replying to @kfitz

Thu Oct 13 09:02:30 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

Thu Oct 13 09:02:37 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

Sometimes it’s the fear of reprisal.

Thu Oct 13 09:02:40 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

Sometimes it’s the certainty that they won’t be believed.

Thu Oct 13 09:02:44 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

Sometimes it’s all three.

Thu Oct 13 09:02:48 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

It takes extraordinary courage to go public with private shame, especially when the perpetrator is powerful.

Thu Oct 13 09:02:53 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

I honor the courage of these women who are stepping forward now with a story they hoped they’d never have to tell.

Thu Oct 13 09:03:00 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

I honor their courage in the face of the onslaught that is now certain to come.

Thu Oct 13 09:03:05 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

I stand with them, and with everyone else who has faced such pain, publicly or privately.

Thu Oct 13 09:03:09 +0000 2016

A million years ago, I spent a year & a half working for Universal Television. On my first day, my boss took me to the commissary for lunch.

Tue Dec 27 18:31:02 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

We got in the elevator & headed down to the lobby, and after we got clear she elbowed me and whispered “DID YOU SEE????”

Tue Dec 27 18:31:12 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

We had been in the elevator with Meryl Streep and Carrie Fisher. And I totally, totally, totally failed to notice.

Tue Dec 27 18:31:19 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

This was very shortly after Postcards from the Edge. I had been in an elevator with two of the biggest stars of my life, and hadn’t seen.

Tue Dec 27 18:31:28 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

This story is emblematic of two things for me: my obliviousness, of course, but also Streep and Fisher’s unassumingness.

Tue Dec 27 18:31:35 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

They were just a couple of women — stunningly brilliant, beautiful women, of course — but just a couple of women coming from a meeting.

Tue Dec 27 18:31:46 +0000 2016

Replying to @kfitz

I have carried that moment with me for years as an aspirational emblem, a kind of grace and centeredness I would like someday to possess.

A million years ago, I was the assistant to the director of creative affairs of a large studio’s TV department. +

Tue May 23 17:06:01 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

This was late in the era of the Movie of the Week. The studio had sold one of the networks a series of MotW starring @sirrogermoore. +

Tue May 23 17:06:08 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

My boss had me look for possible vehicles for adaptation. I read and wrote coverage on a dozen mystery/detective novels and scripts. +

Tue May 23 17:06:13 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

I wasn’t involved in any of the meetings, and I never got to meet the man himself. But my boss told me that in the key meeting +

Tue May 23 17:06:18 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

with the studio and the network, @sirrogermoore picked up one of my reports and said “I rather like this one.” +

Tue May 23 17:06:26 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

And then read what I had written out loud. +

Tue May 23 17:06:35 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

That is the closest to Hollywood greatness I will ever come. I remain utterly overwhelmed to imagine my words in @sirrogermoore’s voice. -

Replying to @kfitz

Wed Aug 02 15:21:20 +0000 2017

RT @zeynep: ie, they want to to smother open-access to \(largely publicly\-funded\) scientific research, in order to continue to profit at mon…

Wed Aug 02 15:48:29 +0000 2017

Yes, exactly. Overcoming that inertia may be the key problem we’re facing right now. We’ve got to make the costs of not doing so clear. https://twitter.com/swarthmoreburke/status/892774662152884224

Wed Aug 02 15:52:47 +0000 2017

Replying to @swarthmoreburke

It’s true. Outsourcing this kind of thing has been the norm for so long that it’s hard to reverse course. \(See Blackboard\.\)

Wed Aug 02 15:56:03 +0000 2017

A consortial, collective action model for building a truly not-for-profit scholarly communication infrastructure is our goal at @humcommons. https://twitter.com/swarthmoreburke/status/892775678684352512

Wed Aug 02 15:57:27 +0000 2017

Replying to @swarthmoreburke

Totally. And we mistakenly understand our institutions to be in competition with one another, making collaboration seem impossible.

Wed Aug 02 15:59:55 +0000 2017

A few thoughts on corporate raiders, scholarly communication, and institutional responsibility for taking action. +

Wed Aug 02 16:20:50 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

We mistakenly understand our institutions to be in competition with one another, making collaboration seem impossible. +

Wed Aug 02 16:20:56 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

But there are issues — the future of our scholarly communication infrastructure being one of them — on which we have to collaborate. +

Wed Aug 02 16:21:04 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

None of us can solve these problems alone. But consortial, collective action models provide a means of supporting key scholarly goals. +

Wed Aug 02 16:21:15 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

We have to get past inertia, past the convenience of current models, if we’re going to avoid catastrophic profiteering around our work. +

Wed Aug 02 16:21:23 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

But it’s going to take all of us, and all of our institutions, to make real change. So here’s the call to action: +

Wed Aug 02 16:21:33 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

Support not-for-profit platforms and models like @humcommons. And support the not-for-profit organizations that are building them. +

Wed Aug 02 16:21:41 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

Push your institutions and organizations to join the collectives supporting these models. +

Wed Aug 02 16:21:51 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

And let me know if you want to know more about these models and our goals. I can go on at far greater length!

Wed Aug 02 16:21:57 +0000 2017

Replying to @ferli90

Thank you! We’re very happy about the work ahead.

Wed Aug 02 16:33:38 +0000 2017

Replying to @LibSkrat

This is a key component of the Commons/CORE model: CBOX + Fedora, working fully interoperably. Publishing + repository + social network. +

Wed Aug 02 16:47:37 +0000 2017

Replying to @LibSkrat

Admittedly, it does not run itself. But we are also working toward a collective support model. So… soon?

Wed Aug 02 16:48:07 +0000 2017

Fri Nov 10 00:59:48 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

I’ve heard this concern expressed a fair bit about @humcommons and have a couple of things to say. https://twitter.com/tim_hutchings/status/928907839183171589

Fri Nov 10 13:19:50 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

I’m going to leave aside my somewhat knee-jerk desire to point out that few have complained about the ways that projects with “science” limit their address.

Fri Nov 10 13:19:58 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

Because there’s a real point here: naming the humanities limits our reach. And to a significant extent, that’s purposeful.

Fri Nov 10 13:20:05 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

The humanities have long been underserved by digital infrastructure projects. Scientists have load of open science networks. Social scientists have had SSRN.

Fri Nov 10 13:20:12 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

And as Humanities Commons began with the MLA, and MLA Commons, it seemed only natural that we should serve our own constituency first.

Fri Nov 10 13:20:20 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

But: First. Platforming outward from MLA Commons to Humanities Commons has been one step in a process. And more steps are to come.

Fri Nov 10 13:20:28 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

It’s hard to develop community by simply throwing open the doors. Much as I resist the Facebook analogy, it’s worth considering how the platform grew.

Fri Nov 10 13:20:35 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

First, they established internally-focused networks within individual institutions, enabling members to connect with people they already knew.

Fri Nov 10 13:20:42 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

Then they created means of connecting across those networks. And only once there was a critical mass of participation did they open the doors to everyone.

Fri Nov 10 13:20:49 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

One of the mistakes that’s been made repeatedly in open scholarly communication projects has been the attempt to create the bucket of everything.

Fri Nov 10 13:20:55 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

Sometimes that bucket has been journal-shaped, and sometimes it’s been social network shaped. But they all face the same challenge:

Fri Nov 10 13:21:02 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

Getting individual scholars who identify with their field or subfield and who want to speak with their colleagues to recognize themselves in “everybody.”

Fri Nov 10 13:21:08 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

So @humcommons has begun with communities of practice — but they’re just a place to start.

Fri Nov 10 13:21:15 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

We welcome the involvement of new communities of practice, and we look forward to growing the network in organic, collaborative ways.

Fri Nov 10 13:21:24 +0000 2017

Replying to @tim_hutchings

I completely get that — I’m hoping that we can provide a bridge for such conversations very soon.

Fri Nov 10 15:12:59 +0000 2017

RT @winterking07: In addition to this, there's the parallel mistake of trying to implement the One Idea That Will Transform Everything Imme…

Fri Nov 10 15:14:53 +0000 2017

As I’m wrapping up the last chapter of Generous Thinking, I’m pondering the potential for recentering the university as a community in itself as well as in connection to the broader community.

Fri Dec 22 13:44:55 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

If you have good examples, let me know? I'd be most grateful.

Fri Dec 22 13:44:56 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

I'd like to look at as many experiments in that kind of institutional recentering as possible: how they're imagined, how they're structured, how they're received.

Fri Dec 22 13:44:56 +0000 2017

Replying to @shermandorn

Thanks for these suggestions, Sherman!

Fri Dec 22 14:05:55 +0000 2017

Replying to @shermandorn and @LDBurnett

Both? Probably? But mostly I need to look at some examples of real experimentation — the university stretching beyond itself, building bridges, becoming outwardly rather than inwardly focused.

Fri Dec 22 14:09:40 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

Just to clarify my thoughts here a bit: I’m hoping to examine experimental initiatives in which the university stretches beyond itself, builds bridges, becomes outwardly rather than inwardly focused.

Fri Dec 22 14:47:56 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

So examples might be @CALMSU’s Citizen Scholars program \(http://www\.cal\.msu\.edu/citizenscholars\). Or @UMBCHumanities’s Baltimore Stories project \(https://dreshercenter\.umbc\.edu/multiple\-communities\-multiple\-stories/\).

Fri Dec 22 14:50:19 +0000 2017

Replying to @jimlance554

Thank you for the kind words!

Fri Dec 22 14:51:22 +0000 2017

Replying to @LibSkrat

Ooh excellent. Thank you for the pointer!

Fri Dec 22 14:58:29 +0000 2017

Replying to @LibSkrat

Oh PERFECT!

Fri Dec 22 14:59:39 +0000 2017

I have been biting my tongue, but can’t continue to do so. What those of you passing around that open letter about the MLA’s data sharing practices haven’t been told is that the org has informed the author repeatedly that it’s developing a new platform with an open API +

Fri Dec 22 15:03:24 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

that is designed support exactly the kind of research the author wants to do. That sort of development takes time, and the org has asked for \(and obviously not received\) his patience.

Fri Dec 22 15:04:31 +0000 2017

Replying to @kfitz

There’s more to be said about valuing the work that a non-profit scholarly organization undertakes to support the profession and research within it appropriately, but I’m just going to leave it there.

Fri Dec 22 15:06:31 +0000 2017

Replying to @LibSkrat

Exactly. And one really tires of the leap to public outrage.

Fri Dec 22 15:14:51 +0000 2017

Replying to @rbuurma

I’m referring to past precedents but mostly right now wanting to look at contemporary experiments…

Fri Dec 22 17:02:52 +0000 2017

Replying to @mannahattamamma

Tell me more?

Fri Dec 22 18:40:01 +0000 2017

Replying to @paigecmorgan

Thanks for this, Paige! It’s an ongoing frustration, and one that I can be a little more up-front about now that I am back on the scholar side of things.

Fri Dec 22 18:43:53 +0000 2017

Replying to @_akpiper, @amandafrench, @jasonrhody, @Ted_Underwood and @kbourrier

Andrew, I was copied on multiple email messages in which my former colleagues told you what they were working toward. You would not hear them.

Sat Dec 23 00:02:42 +0000 2017

Replying to @_akpiper, @amandafrench, @jasonrhody, @Ted_Underwood and @kbourrier

And scholarly orgs do have a responsibility to make data as open as they can while still making it possible to do the work. And producing something like the Bib requires a LOT of work.

Sat Dec 23 00:03:45 +0000 2017

Replying to @_akpiper, @amandafrench, @jasonrhody, @Ted_Underwood and @kbourrier

So the MLA, as my colleagues told you, is seeking a sustainable means of making the data open to researchers. But it’s an enormous, expensive project. And the org has a responsibility to the field as a whole to ensure that it, and the project, can survive.

Sat Dec 23 00:06:32 +0000 2017

Replying to @_akpiper, @amandafrench, @jasonrhody, @Ted_Underwood and @kbourrier

You are the one blaming the org, Andrew.

Sat Dec 23 00:08:31 +0000 2017

Replying to @_akpiper, @amandafrench, @jasonrhody, @Ted_Underwood and @kbourrier

By all means.

Sat Dec 23 00:12:13 +0000 2017

Replying to @nkelber

I would love to hear about that! More TK.

Sat Dec 23 11:43:28 +0000 2017

Replying to @lesliekwchan, @buddhall and @RTandon_PRIA

Thanks for this, Leslie! I certainly don’t mean “recentering” in the sense of “returning to the center” — rather, I’m thinking about a new focus within the university.

Sat Dec 23 16:23:22 +0000 2017

Replying to @lesliekwchan, @buddhall and @RTandon_PRIA

And that kind of partnership is exactly what I’m writing about! I’ll look forward to continuing this conversation.

Sat Dec 23 16:24:25 +0000 2017

CONGRATULATIONS!!! That’s amazing! 🍾🎉💃

A big part of what I’ve been writing about lately, and tied into the question I asked Bro Adams recently of @NEHgov, Earl Lewis of @MellonFdn, and Lynn Pasquerella of @aacu yesterday. This is where the rubber meets the road in creating institutional change. #mla18 #s89 https://twitter.com/michaelcrow/status/948948442721562624

Fri Jan 05 16:27:32 +0000 2018

Replying to @NEHgov, @MellonFdn and @aacu

That said, we need to think very carefully about what it is we mean by “societal impact.” Are we really meeting community needs, or are we projecting what we think those needs are? #mla18 #s89

Replying to @swarthmoreburke, @NEHgov, @MellonFdn and @aacu

It’s not singular in the writing I’m doing that’s longer than 280 :)

This is exactly what I’m getting at. Are our institutions listening to the expressed needs of whatever community/ies they are interacting with? Can we treat public service as our actual rather than merely slogan-based value?

Fri Jan 05 16:39:56 +0000 2018

Replying to @swarthmoreburke, @NEHgov, @MellonFdn and @aacu

I’m not sure I follow. Is the “they” here our institutions?

Fri Jan 05 16:42:56 +0000 2018

Replying to @swarthmoreburke, @NEHgov, @MellonFdn and @aacu

Oof, exactly what I’m trying to get at. That’s the underlying meaning of “societal impact,” I think, and what I want us to think a bit more carefully about. Again, it’s a whole chapter, so can’t cover adequately here.

Fri Jan 05 16:45:00 +0000 2018

Replying to @swarthmoreburke, @NEHgov, @MellonFdn and @aacu

That is far more blanket a suggestion than I am trying to make. But any institution that declares itself to be in the public service needs to be thinking more about what that means, how it’s manifested, and how it affects assessment, reward structures, priorities.

Fri Jan 05 16:47:50 +0000 2018

After spending 14 of the last 18 days on the road, I am ecstatic to be sitting at the computer in my pajamas, finishing up some last edits on Generous Thinking. I had a great time at #CHCI18, #ELPUB2018, and #DH2019, but omg there’s no place like home. http://generousthinking.hcommons.org

Wed Jan 09 21:42:55 +0000 2019

Replying to @K_Leonard_PhD

Wed Jan 09 21:44:33 +0000 2019

Another barrier I’ve run into is time. Readers have been enormously generous in the time and attention they’ve paid to commenting on my work, but I worry about how scalable that model is. How many manuscripts can get that level of attention? #OPReview #A4

Wed Jan 09 21:45:54 +0000 2019

Replying to @s2ceball

I grew up in southeastern Baton Rouge. I haven’t been able to find a map that will tell me if our neighborhood fell in “St. George” or not. Either way, I’m horrified by what is only the latest scheme to defund BTR public schools and reinstate segregation. https://twitter.com/beccarosen/status/1130478240542461952

Mon May 20 16:03:44 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

I was in high school there during the first wave, post-consent decree, when white flight took the form of a few magnet schools \(which I attended, and which were integrated, but which did not look like the city\) and a massive proliferation of parochial and private schools.

Mon May 20 16:06:04 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

And the effect of that was the withdrawal of white electoral support for tax/bond issues funding public schools. Why would we pay for public schools, they said; we’re paying to send our kids to private schools.

Mon May 20 16:08:54 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

Shockingly, the school system went into a significant decline. Teachers were underpaid and under supported, facilities fell apart, and the school to prison pipeline took root.

Mon May 20 16:10:56 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

So secession is not new here. This is just the newest tactic by which an overwhelmingly white middle class refuses responsibility for the municipality as a whole.

Mon May 20 16:13:01 +0000 2019

Replying to @helleaux_newman

Indeed.

I need some advice, colleagues, especially from senior academics with a strong commitment to service to the field.

Tue May 21 11:48:12 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

In any given season — the three months of summer, say — how many tenure and promotion cases would you agree to serve as an outside evaluator for?

Tue May 21 11:49:28 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

Now, say you’ve already committed to adjudicate a prize during those same three months, a process that involves reading and evaluating five books. Now how many T&P cases would you say yes to?

Tue May 21 11:50:47 +0000 2019

Replying to @ehayot

Oof, that’s a lot!

Tue May 21 11:55:10 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

The early responses are leaning heavily toward one, maybe two. Which is where I think I am gravitating, given my desire \(a\) to do a good job of the reviews I agree to, and \(b\) to actually get some research done this summer, too.

Tue May 21 12:01:57 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

Now, another question: say you have two requests to review the dossiers of two equally extraordinary scholars, one going up for tenure and one going up for full. You have room to say yes to one of them, but no more.

Tue May 21 12:03:56 +0000 2019

Replying to @billhd

Mmmm, interesting!

Tue May 21 12:05:35 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

The tenure case has a far greater potential impact, of course. But say you’re in a field with very few fulls available to review at rank...?

Tue May 21 12:07:06 +0000 2019

That is the most dismaying thing. I hate that more than I can say!

Tue May 21 12:08:05 +0000 2019

Tue May 21 12:23:39 +0000 2019

Tue May 21 12:39:17 +0000 2019

Yep. I would love to chat with you about this as well. It’s enormously important, and time-consuming, and hard to do well. And hard to find a balanced approach to if you really care about building academic community.

Watching on the edges of my timeline the all-too-frequent debates about whether “y’all” is singular or plural. Y’all, it’s plural.

Tue May 21 17:23:22 +0000 2019

Replying to @kfitz

“All y’all,” while of course also plural, is not a simple plural. It’s the plural emphatic, and can be roughly translated as “each and every last one of you.”

Replying to @kfitz

Like hearing your full name called out by your mother, getting all y’alled is almost never a good sign.
